183001.name: GM's Monthly Miscellany (August 2015)
rpgissuearticle: 20 Things to Find in a Smuggler's Storeroom
GM Advice: How to Name the Roads in Your Campaign
183001.description:
From publisher blurb:

Featuring material from some of Raging Swan Press’s newest products as well as classic releases of yesteryear, advice articles and material from Creighton’s on-going design of the megadungeon Gloamhold, the GM’s Monthly Miscellany series is a terrific free resource for the busy, time-crunched GM.

This month’s issue features:

GM Advice: How to Name the Roads in Your Campaign
Coldwater At A Glance (from Village Backdrop: Coldwater)
I Loot the Body: Trinkets (from I Loot the Body)
Scions of Evil: Gahlgax Atarrith (from Scions of Evil)
20 Things to Find in a Smuggler’s Storeroom

183002.name: Gravaton (Supers!)
183002.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dr. Adrian Lerner was THAT guy. He was the one who walked around the lab as though he was superior to everyone and he loved pointing it out. That changed the day a lab accident produced wonderful powers to control gravity. Unfortunately, having powers reinforced his belief that he was superior. He will now prove it to the world unless your heroes can stop him.

183004.name: Espião
183004.description:
Espião ("Spy") is a board game from the defunct publisher based in Oporto (Portugal), Karto.

It is a game that somewhat resembles the Chess and Checkers, but with extremely simple and basic rules. With a low level strategy is being accessible to all ages.

Game for 2 players where each has 16 playing pieces: One Boss, 8 agents in the front row, 7 spies in line next to the Boss.
The goal is to "hunt down" the Boss of opposing opponent, much to chess style.

Each player can move a playing piece in turn and the direction of their movement is given by the arrow(s). The only piece that can move without respecting the arrows are the Boss and can only move a single house. Spies can move up to four houses and agents can move up to two houses. The enemy piece is captured when it hits and occupies the house where the opponent's piece.

Portuguese description:
Jogo de Tabuleiro Espião da extinta editora sediada no Porto (Portugal), Karto.

É um jogo que lembra um pouco a Xadrez e Damas, mas com regras extremamente simples e básicas. A estratégia também de um nível muito baixo, sendo acessível a todas as idades.

Partida para 2 jogadores em que cada um tem 16 peças: 8 agentes na fila da frente, 7 espiões na fila ao lado do chefe e um chefe.
O objetivo é "caçar" o chefe de espionagem adversária, muito ao estilo do xadrez.

Cada jogador só pode jogar uma peça no seu turno e a direção do seu movimento é dado pela seta. A única peça que se pode mover sem respeitar as setas é o chefe e só pode mover uma única casa. Os espiões podem mover até quatro casas e os agentes podem mover-se até duas casas. As peças inimigas são capturadas quando se atinge e se ocupa uma casa onde está a peça do adversário.

183005.name: Snow Eel
183005.description:
Publisher blurb:

Quiet alpine snow fields may occasionally be disturbed by strange protrusions in sinuous lines, as though something had passed beneath the snow without breaking the surface. The wise know this to be a sign of dangerous snow eels, and take precautions against the electrifying terrors that have been known to shock both man and horse in order to feed on the stunned victims.

Mountain Terrors: Snow Eel is a bestiary PDF for the Chronicle System, the rules engine that powers our popular A Song of Ice & Fire Roleplaying game.

183006.description:
Players in Qwinto all play at the same time, with everyone trying to fill the rows on their scoresheets with numbers as quickly — and as highly — as possible in order to score the most points.

To set up, each player receives a scoresheet that contains three colored rows of shapes (mostly circles with a few pentagons); the rows don't completely overlap, but they do overlap enough to create five vertical columns of three shapes, with one pentagon being in each vertical row.

On a turn, a player rolls 1–3 dice, with the dice being the same colors as the rows: orange, yellow, purple. Each player can place whatever sum is rolled into an empty shape in a row that matches the color of one of the dice. Two rules must be followed when placing a sum in a row:


All numbers in a row must increase from left to right.
No number can be repeated in a vertical column.


A player does not have to enter the number in a row, but if the active player, the one who rolled the dice, doesn't do so, then they must mark a misthrow box on their scoresheet.

The game continues until someone has filled two rows on their scoresheet or someone has tallied four misthrows. Players then tally their points: For each completed column on their scoresheet, a player scores points equal to the number in that column's pentagon. For each completed row on their scoresheet, a player scores points equal to the rightmost number in that row. For each incomplete row on their scoresheet, a player scores one point per number in that row. For each misthrow, a player loses five points. Whoever has the highest sum wins!
183006.name: Qwinto
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 49 - Star Wars: Rebellion Two Year Anniversary

183007.name: Karma Crystals: Pass The Karma
183007.description:
When Bad Karma Strikes, Pass It On To Other Players!

You can travel down life through good deeds or bad deeds, but karma will follow you either way. In Pass The Karma, your best tactic is to collect that bad karma now and pass it on to your opponents to get the win.

This 2nd entry into the Karma Crystals game collection adds a set of elemental shards and a new way to pass on your bad karma to other players. This game also introduces a Karma Crystal scoring system to track all that bad Karma going around. Last but not least, you get 12 new monster elemental cards for your collector’s deck!

Collect up to elemental elemental shards (up to TWO per type) to represent your forward movement through your karma travels. If you get too many per type, you get Karma Crystals and get a chance to pass their reverse-move effect on your score to other players.

Roll dice to work with the various monster elemental cards - monsters are the good guys and help you win! Determine how many karma moves you score per roll and collect your elemental shards for the match, or pass on your no-match karma to another player! When you get elemental shards of FOUR types, that triggers the end of the game and scores are tallied at the end of the round.

In addition to the unique dice matching game mechanic, a unique auto player system is used to facilitate up to EIGHT total players per game. The game also provides an easy way to track multiple game wins for playoffs in case you have more than 15 to 20 minutes to play. No paper score cards and pencil needed - just Karma Crystals, crystal cubes and elemental shards to track and build your score.

rpg: Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing Game
183008.name: Come To Daddy (B&T)
183008.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Most fairy tales end with a ”happily ever after.”

This is not one of those tales

In Come To Daddy, the characters end up in the clutches of a most evil family of crazy viking mutant cannibal killers and their weird monster creations in the middle of a frosty nowhere. The place is also haunted by the souls of some of their unfortunate victims and full of lethal traps for the unwary. Surviving this adventure will take both brawn and brain as well as a major dose of luck. And as if that is not enough, far more sinister things are lurking in the shadows, waiting to be unveiled.

Welcome to nightmare on earth.

☩

My family’s always been in meat.


– Torgil Rodbrok, mutant cannibal lycanthrope killer

rpg: Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing Game
183009.name: No Country for Weak Men (B&T)
183009.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Somewhere in Frostreave…

“Ever since we left that so-called town at the edge of the land of eternal ice, I’ve been freezing my butts off! And no trace of that were-whatever-thing we’re supposed to hunt down.

Our best scout, Halross, says she’s been passing here, into this valley, but I get a bad feeling from all this silence, frost and snow. It’s empty here. No animals. No tracks. No nothing, but ice and snow. It’s not natural…

And now we’re stuck in this cave. The blizzard has lasted two days now, and our supplies are almost gone. Hell, I’d give a sack of gold for a cold ale and a hot wench in my lap right now.

I can smell the fear of the others – die of starvation or disgust here, or freeze to death out there. And some other not so pleasant smells too… Some choice, huh?

Maybe we can roast that gnome’s pony? Would have been nice with some food now… Or, we just roast the gnome… Everyone’s on the edge. No sign of the blizzard waning either. I reckon someone will snap soon…

Well, not me. Guess it’s time we get moving…”

No Country for Weak Men is a traditional dungeon, meant to be played the hard way. Dark, shitty and remorseless. And if the Draugr don’t get you the cold or lack of food will…

183012.name: Superbike
183012.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a brilliant scientist who lives in your neighborhood asks you to test his latest invention, the Superbike, you have no idea what you're getting yourself into. This specially designed racing bike enables you to reach speeds in excess of sixty miles per hour. You can't wait to keep this incredible secret to yourself. If the Superbike falls into the wrong hands, it could mean trouble. What will you do?

183013.name: Un Indien Dans La Ville
183013.description:
User Summary

Adapted from the French movie of the same name, this French only Gameboy platform title loosely follows the plot of the movie.

183014.name: Outlaw Gulch
183014.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are in boarding school, and your roommate is the Crown Prince of Aggar. He has vanished without a trace, and it's up to you to find him. All the clues indicate that he's headed west. But the year is 1892, and the Wild West is frontier territory, full of dangerous outlaws, gold prospectors, and Indian tribes. Your friend could be anywhere, should you look first?

183015.name: Master of Martial Arts
183015.description:
From publisher blurb:

You and your best friend, Billy, have traveled the world together, sharpening your martial-arts skills. So when Billy mysteriously disappears one night, you don your black belt and set out to find him. Your search takes you to the exotic city of Bangkok, where you suddenly find yourself surrounded by a band of Thai fighters. Across the street, a strange woman beckons to you frantically. Is she inviting you to safety or a swift, horrible death? The fighters are closing in. What will you do?

183016.name: Showdown
183016.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a top contender in the Sudbury Horse Classic, one of the year's most important national horse shows. When you overhear a man plotting to kill a horse insured for half a million dollars, you realize there's more at stake here than a blue ribbon. If you don't act fast, this prized show jumper will lose its life. You could go to the authorities, but by the time they arrive it might be too late. What will you do?

183017.description:
Description from the publisher:

Towns on the Old West frontier are full of danger and adventure around every corner!

The Shadows of Brimstone: Frontier Town expansion allows players a deeper and richer Town experience between adventures, adding exciting new types of Towns to find (such as Plague Towns, Outlaw Towns, or Mutant Towns), six new Town Locations to visit (such as the Street Market, Sheriff's Office, Indian Trading Post, or Smuggler's Den), a new expanded Travel Chart, and a deadly new ranged Enemy – Bandits — for use both down in the Mines as well as in Town!

With this expansion, Heroes also have the opportunity to play out Adventures in the Frontier Town itself using the new Town Adventure Board! Heroes can protect the townsfolk while battling demons in the streets, have a shootout with Bandits trying to rob the local bank, or find themselves in a duel at high noon! Since the buildings are random, the camp location will now contain limited versions of any crucial buildings that were missing like doc's office, church and saloon.
183017.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Frontier Town Expansion
boardgameaccessory: Shadows of Brimstone: Deluxe Dark Stone Set

183018.name: Viking Raiders
183018.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a young Viking living on the coast of Norway and you hear that a vicious band of Viking raiders is headed for your village. These bloodthirsty conquerors are certain to seize anything they want--including you. Do you run away and try to hide--or let yourself be captured? Only you can choose .

183019.description:
Historical Battles "Verdun 1916"
It is a war game for two players set in the First World War, where we take control of German or French army to destroy our enemy.
This game has two game modes: The Front is a game system Ameritrash and Defending Line is more strategic. It also features expansions: Supremacy and Brotherhood latter with four-player mode.

This game is created by Rúnica Art Games, in 2016 in Colombia.

Thank you all for believing in the Colombian creativity.


Batallas Históricas "Verdún 1916"
Es un juego de guerra para dos jugadores ambientado en la primera guerra mundial, donde tomaremos el control del ejercito Aleman o Frances para destruir a nuestro enemigo.
Este juego tiene dos modos de juegos: The Front que es un sistema de juego Ameritrash y Defending Line que es mas estratégico. También se cuenta con las expansiones: Supremacía y Hermandad esta ultima con la modalidad para cuatro jugadores.

Este juego es creado por Rúnica Art Games, en el año 2016 en Colombia.

Gracias a todos por creer en la creatividad Colombiana.
183019.name: Batallas Históricas "Verdun 1916"

183020.name: Earthquake!
183020.description:
From publisher blurb:

You're visiting San Francisco when suddenly a strange rumbling fills the air and buildings begin to shake-it's a major earthquake! You look around and see an old man pinned to the sidewalk by rubble. You want to help him, but a friend of yours may be in even bigger trouble nearby. Every second counts. What are you going to do?

183021.name: Assault on Yavin Four
183021.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first Death Star has been destroyed. But the Empire remains. An Imperial cruiser has landed on Yavin Four. The Rebel base is threatened. Your mission: to prevent the assault on Yavin Four ... at any cost. May the Force be with you.

183022.name: Escape from Thyferra
183022.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Rebel forces have found an Imperial conspiracy involving contaminated bacta.

183023.name: Attack on Delrakkin
183023.description:
From publisher blurb:

Imperial troops are bombarding the planet of Delrakkin - disguised as Rebel forces! The Empire want the Rebel Alliance to be blamed for the attack. The Rebels must stop this evil deception. Your mission: to defend Delrakkin...and save the Rebellion. May the Force be with you.

183024.name: Destroy the Liquidator
183024.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Imperial Star Destroyer Liquidator is quickly approaching the Rebel base on Yavin Four. It is part of an Imperial plan to control hyperspace - and crush the Rebellion. To prevent the Empire from carrying out this evil deed, the Rebels must locate the Imperial forces without being discovered. Your mission: to stop the Liquidator ... and get out of Yavin Four alive! May the Force be with you.

183025.name: The Hunt for Han Solo
183025.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a bounty hunter. Your target is Han Solo. Both Jabba the Hutt and the Empire want him - dead or alive. He is on his way to Tatooine to deliver something very important to Jabba. You must reach him first. Your mission: to hunt down Han Solo before he gets away. Good luck.

183026.name: Search for the Lost Jedi
183026.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Jedi Master is missing. You must find her...and save her. The adventure is yours. May the Force be with you.

183027.name: The Bartokk Assassins
183027.description:
From publisher blurb:

A band of Bartokk assissins is in the possession of many unusual Trade Federation starfighhters. They have also kidnapped an inncent child. The Bartokks will stop at nothing to destru you. May the force be with you.

183028.name: Hunt the Sun Runner
183028.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your adventure begins... A ghost ship is on a crash course with a helpless planet. First you must find it. Then you must stop it.

183029.name: Le Petit Chaperon Rouge
183029.description:
Le Petit Chaperon Rouge ("Little Red Riding Hood") is a cooperative memory game. The goal of the game is to find pairs of the same tiles while trying to avoid the wolf tiles. When you find a pair, The little red riding Hood advances towards Grandma's house, but if you flip a wolf tile, then the wolf advances. The players need to arrive at Grandma's house before the wolf does. There is also a Hunter tile which resets the Wolf back to its cave when revealed, but is then removed from the game.

From the publisher:
Le Petit Chaperon rouge est un jeu de mémoire où les surprises ajoutent au plaisir!

Tu dois former des paires de provision pour faire avancer le Petit Chaperon rouge sur le chemin de la maison de Mère-Grand.

Prends garde au loup! Seul le chasseur peut l'empêcher d'arriver chez Mère-Grand avant toi.

183030.name: Sail and Steam Navies
183030.description:
Sail and Steam Navies is a PDF set of rules designed for 1/600 scale miniatures, but has information for use with 1/1200 scale miniatures. The period covered is 1840 to 1880 when most warships were equipped with sails as well as steam power. The basic rules are 40 pages long, with charts, markers/templates, an example of play, and conversion information for 1/1200 scale. The Under Both Flags module is included and adds six scenarios, a scenario generator, and log sheets for the ships. There are over 1000 log sheets representing almost every ship involved in the American Civil War and a number of forts and shore batteries. Sets of 1/1200 scale counters in PDF format are available separately for use instead of miniatures.

Players may fight historical battles using one of the 6 scenarios provided or create their own using the scenario generator. Game length will vary depending on the number of ships used and scenario victory conditions. Most scenarios played at conventions with multiple players last 3 to 5 hours.
The game uses D10s for resolving combat and other actions. Usually you will only need one or two dice but more will be required for most damage checks. D6 dice are used to record momentum for each ship. A player aid and a sheet of markers/templates will need to be printed out for use. As with most miniatures based systems any flat playing surface can be used and a ruler or measuring tape is required for checking range and movement.

The turn sequence is straightforward; it starts with writing speed orders for the turn (how fast the ship will go for the turn), followed by combat (cannon fire, musket fire, boarding/melee), then movement, and finally morale checks and repairs.

183031.name: The Search for Grubba the Hutt
183031.description:
From publisher blurb:

Grubba the Hutt is missing ... and Jabba the Hutt is angry. If Han Solo wants to live, he and his friends will have to find the young Hutt and bring him back to Jabba's palace--immediately. The bounty hunters who have taken Grubba will not give him up easily. Your mission: to track down Grubba and keep Jabba happy...or else.

May the Force be with you.

183032.name: Ithorian Invasion
183032.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bounty hunters have taken Grubba the Hutt to the planet Ithor. You must get him back. The Ithorian leader Momaw Nadon has offered to help you. But in return you must aid him in his revolt against the Empire. Imperial forces have taken control of Ithor's center, the Tofanda Bay. Your Mission: to liberate the Ithorians - and find Grubba the Hutt - before it is too late. May the Force be with you.

183033.description:
From the publisher:
Welcome to the world of Two Hour Wargames!

Chain Reaction 2015 is an introduction to Two Hour Wargames. It’s a complete game – not a teaser – and is free. Chain Reaction 2015 is a set of man-to-man combat rules that can be played in a variety of periods and with any figures you may already have.

Chain Reaction 2015, like all THW games, can be played solo, cooperatively – all players on the same side – or competitively – head to head. Inside you’ll find:

The current Reaction System, used in all Two Hour Wargames, that allows you to learn one set of mechanics to play a variety of periods.
Quick game mechanics that yield realistic shooting and melee results.
Three scenarios that can be played over and over with no two games ever being the same.
Character advancement based on your success in each game.
An easy to use Campaign system that generates your next game based on how well you’ve done.
Ways to generate your characters and your opponents – Police, Gangers, Militia, Guerillas, and Military.
All this and more…




Chain Reaction 2015 lets you to learn the current version of the Reaction System used by THW without spending a dime. While our counterpart Swordplay is about hand-to-hand combat with sword and shield, Chain Reaction 2015 is about modern firearms.

Chain Reaction 2015 gives you a chance to see if you like the Reaction System, before trying one of our period specific games. Think of Chain Reaction 2015 as a preview of our other period specific games like 5150: Star Army, All Things Zombie – Final Fade Out, and NUTS!
183033.name: Chain Reaction 2015

183034.name: Togorian Trap
183034.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a bounty hunter. The Galactic Empire has sent you to Togoria to trap the Rebels Han Solo, Princess Leia, and Luke Skywalker. To find them, you must travel through the wilds of Togoria, where fierce creatures stalk their prey. A great reward awaits you – if you can survive. Your mission: to ensnare the Rebels and bring glory to the Empire.

183035.name: Revolt of the Battle Droids
183035.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are an Imperial soldier. A revolt has begun on Boonda the Hutt's moon. The leader of the revolution is the devious droid Wuntoo Forcee Forwun. His army is made up of hundreds of droids... and they are all prepared to kill on sight. Your mission: to stop the battle droids before they take on the Empire.

183036.name: Showdown in Mos Eisley
183036.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a swoop biker working for Jabba the Hutt. Your base is a cantina in Mos Eisley, one of the most dangerous spaceport cities in the galaxy. And now things have become even more dangerous. Battle droids have attacked your cantina, injuring your friends…and threatening Jabba himself. Your Mission: to save Jabba from the deadly droids…or else.

183037.name: Charlie's Angels Throws Bullets
183037.description:
Charlie's Angels Throws Bullets (Lanza Balas) skill game with Farrah Fawcett, Kate Jackson and Jaclyn Smith pictured.

RULES:
1) Tap & tilt cardboard so that bullets begin in the start position and enter maze.
2) The goal is to get each bullet in its own chamber.
3) Each bullet that enters the waste area become "loose cannonballs".
4) When 5 bullets become loose cannonballs, the game is over.
5) The player who places the most bullets in chambers in the shortest time wins.

183038.name: Siberian Dice
183038.description:
This game originates from isolated indigenous tribes of Siberia. It was recently discovered by "mainland people" and immediately caught attention of Lame Heron Games. This superficially simple game turned out to be a marvel of an alien mathematical genius. It is unusual and elegant beyond words, it is very easy to learn but very hard to excel at.

Its unbelievably concise rules, while being simple enough for a child to learn, generate a strategy as complex as the best known "western" games.

The core of the game's mechanics is the notion of dice-perfection:
A die is perfect when the number of pips on the face of the die equals the number of dice neighboring it, regardless of those dice ownership and pips.

The drama of the game is that this perfection status (and therefore the goal) is very fragile.
The conflict of the game is that manipulating their own dice only players affect the status of the opponent's dice as well.
The trickery of the game is that the goal is impossible to achieve using only your own dice.

183039.description:
Promo Card Included in GTM Issue 187

Type: Cohort

Traits:
Outsider
Arcane
Eidolon
Veteran

Power:
If the current scenario lists cohorts, treat this cohort as if it were on that list.

If the top card of the blessings discard pile has the Corrupted trait, bury this card to add 2d4 to your combat check; if you succeed, you are dealt 2 fire damage. If the top card of the blessings discard pile does not have the Corrupted trait, recharge this card to add 2d4 to your non-combat check; if you succeed, recharge 1 random card from your discard pile.
183039.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – "Valais Durant" Promo

183040.description:
In Kingpins, you’re running a criminal syndicate in 1920s Temperance Town. The onset of Prohibition means it’s a race to see who will become the best bootlegger in the business! Recruit the right ne’er-do-wells to your side and undercut your rivals at the right moment to ensure that your syndicate comes out on top.

The goal of the game is to be the player with the lowest score after five rounds of play. Cards left in your hand at the end of a round will add to your score. Play smart and leverage your cards’ special abilities if you want to win!

Shuffle the deck and deal five cards to each player.
Place the remaining cards in a face down stack in the center of the playing area. This is the stockpile.Flip the top four cards of the stockpile face up and place them north, south, east,
and west of the stockpile. These are the recruitment stacks.

GAMEPLAY
The game lasts five rounds. In each round, players take turns in clockwise order until the round end is triggered (see ROUND END).

On your turn, you may take any number of the following actions, in any order:

Play a kingpin (12) from your hand to start a new syndicate stack in an empty space on one of the four corner positions around the stockpile (NE, SE, NW, SW).
Play a card from your hand to any stack. The card you play must be the next lowest in rank, but opposite in color (e.g., You can play a red 10 on a black 11).
Move an entire stack onto any other stack. This is only possible if the bottom card of the stack being moved is one rank lower and opposite in color to the top card of another stack (e.g., a stack of R4-B3-R2 can be moved onto a stack of R6-B5). Recruitment stacks can be moved onto syndicate stacks, and vice versa.
Play any card from your hand to one of the original (N, S, E, W) recruitment stacks that has become empty.
Discard a femme fatale card to play a different card from your hand to the bottom of any stack. The card played must be one rank higher than the card currently on the bottom of the stack, and opposite in color.
Play a hideout to any stack. This is only possible if the top card of the stack is a 1 and opposite in color to the hideout.
When you play a card, resolve its special ability (if any) immediately. If the ability cannot be resolved, simply ignore it.




If, after playing a card, you have none left in hand, the round ends. If you have cards left but cannot or do not want to take any more actions, end your turn by drawing a card from the stockpile.

If the stockpile runs out during the round, continue to play as normal but do not draw.

ROUND END
The round will end either (a) when one player manages to get rid of all the cards from their hand or (b) when the stockpile has run out and all players have passed consecutively—whichever comes first.

Score all cards remaining in your hand at the end of the round (taking all special abilities into account). The scoring value of each card is indicated in its bottom right corner. Add your score for the round to your running total.

GAME END
After the fifth round is complete, the game is over. Players should then compare their scores. The player with the lowest total score is the winner—the true kingpin! If there is a tie for lowest total score, the tied player who won the most rounds is the winner.
183040.name: Kingpins
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 21: Steam Works And Duel Lists
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 48!!! Ft Patrick Hillier, Eric Booth, AnnaBeth and Kerensa
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 51!!! ft Patrick Hillier, AnnaBeth and Kerensa

183041.name: Kannst du Rechnen? Piratenstarke Schatzsuche
183041.description: Kannst du Rechnen? Piratenstarke Schatzsuche is an action game, a treasure hunt. Players take the role of pirates, roll the dice and try to move to the beach token that have exactly same number of shells as the sum of the dice. Count the dice properly together, and go with your pirate on the right beach tokens. Whether you've calculated correctly, you see when you turn the card. Who's at the Pirate Flag get a treasure chest full with gold, and you can also grab chest from the other players with your hook. When all treasure chests are obtained by players, the one who got the most gold pieces win the game!

183042.description:
Pocket Sports Cycling is a competitive dice game for 1 - 4 players. Each player controls a team/rider as they travel through 42 stages over 3 countries.

The game includes 6 custom dice, 4 team cards showing a rider and his unique abilities, instructions, 3 country courses and 12 wooden cubes to track fatigue, H2O and position on the Leaderboard.

A simple mechanic uses a control die that determines what style of attack a rider will use, attempting to overtake the rider in front. Each attack has an 'intensity' value that the Peloton must equal or better to stifle the attack.

There are decisions to be made on when to use special abilities and skill checks to avoid hazards.

It's fast, dice rolling action, that fits in your pocket.
183042.name: Pocket Sports Cycling

183043.description:
Pocket Sports Hockey is a fast, dice rolling game of Ice Hockey.

The game uses 8 custom made dice with a positional player system that 'calls' the play as it happens on the ice. It's a very rapid, light game that captures the theme of Ice Hockey.

There are 4 positions on the ice. Defense, Wings, Center and a Star Player. The game sees the 'puck' being moved from position to position and shooting on goal.

Your opponent controls a Goalie die to roll and make saves, and a 'check' die for making big hits against the player with the puck.

4 International Team cards are included with a goal scoring track and Power Play track, that uses cubes to easily keep score.

A simple light filler, the player to first score 6 goals wins the game.

Packed with check hits, shots on goal and even fights, this perfect pocket sized hockey game will be suitable for any hockey fan
183043.name: Pocket Sports Hockey

183045.name: Village Royalty
183045.description:
A Little Card Game for 2-5 Players.

After a particularly thorough round of assassinations in the capitol, the Monarch and the entire royal family are dead.
You are one of several despotic aristocrats in the tiny village of Lionsgate. You've heard some troubling rumors that the person next in line for the throne is a commoner from your village. This could prove problematic, since you've never been much of a friend of commoners. You lose sleep at night imagining your comeuppance.

At the start of a round of Village Royalty, one card is hidden away. This is the Monarch. At the end of the round, any villagers from the same guild as the Monarch are worth twice as many points.

On each player's turn, they first add a villager card from their hand to the Market in the middle of the table. They then have a chance to bribe a villager, either from the market, or from another player, for one more coin than the villager already holds. After bribing a villager, the player can use the villager's action, which might earn them more coins, points, or some other advantage.

Play continues until a player either has no cards or no coins. The Monarch is revealed, and points are counted. Continue playing rounds until someone reaches 20 points.

183046.name: Hero of the Kingdom II
183046.description:
You and your sister had finally found a safe haven in a small fishing village. But more troubles came soon after that. The threat of an unstoppable crew of pirates spread its shadow over the entire kingdom. Your beloved sister was kidnapped by the pirates and taken far away to lands unknown. You have no choice but to embark on a journey to save her. You must be brave. You will travel to the end of the world, helping people, fulfilling quests, learning valuable skills, and finding hundreds of useful items.

- Explore a beautiful country and sail to far islands.
- Help people and fulfill many interesting quests.
- Learn skills such as fishing, hunting and gathering.
- Find hundreds of useful hidden items.
- Reach up to 48 achievements.

Source: The Developer Website.

183047.name: King's Night
183047.description:
From the publisher:

An easy card & board & drinking game with many mini games, simple rules and cruel skills.

Every player draws a card at their turn. There are 3 types of cards in the deck: a mini-game, a skill and a rule.

If you draw a mini-game, you are going to play the game that is displayed on the card. Mini games are super easy to play and very exciting.
If you draw a skill, you can use it anytime you want. Items are powerful abilities that can be used to attack your enemy.
If you draw a rule, from now on, everyone must obey this rule.




Every time you lose a mini-game, disobey a rule or get hurt by a skill, you have to move your pawn on the board.

The player that reaches the exit first, has to drink the King's s shot. This is a mix of different drinks in one glass. Cards in the deck decide when & who is allowed to create this disgusting cocktail.

183049.description:
In City Council each player takes the role of a council member of a newly founded city. The government will select the members of the city council for the first few years until the city rises and flourishes, by which time the most popular member will receive the position of Mayor.

In order to build the city, you and the other councilmen must maintain a low level of pollution, fight crime, create jobs, and sustain an adequate city budget. If you and the others don't keep up the good work, the city project might not succeed, the government will take over, and all players will lose.

As a member of the council, you must also strive to gain the favor of the different political groups who rule the streets of your city. As the game progresses and the city grows larger, more and more political interest groups will try to impose their will on the city by knocking on your office door and asking you for small "favors" in which you will have to act on their behalf. In return, they'll offer you their support and you'll receive victory points for your personal cause, possibly allowing you to become the city's first Mayor.

City Council: Deluxe Edition contains the original game along with one expansion:

• City Council: The Disaster Deck consists of ten event cards that disrupt "normal" city life by causing havoc everywhere, and it introduces a new game mode, creating a fully co-operative experience for City Council players. In each round of play, the players change roles, taking crucial steps to prevent these events from tearing apart the growing city.

City Council: Deluxe Edition was originally, erroneously, reported to contain the City Council: Government Agent expansion.
183049.name: City Council: Deluxe Edition

183050.name: Tsair Deng
183050.description:
Tsair Deng (Slant nail) is similar to One Arm Joe, except that it is played with Chinese dominoes instead of a standard double six set. Also similar to the Korean game of Dancing Dragons, which is essentially the same game played with two open ends instead of one.

If four people play, each is dealt 8 tiles. If three people play, each is dealt 10 tiles and the remaining two are not played. If two people play, each is dealt 16 tiles.

For the first tile laid, the leader must declare which half is 'open'. Then all dominoes are connected to the only open half of the boneyard, in a straight line. Once the boneyard counts a multiple of eight dominoes, the dominoes are stacked backward upon the previous row. The boneyard can therefore count up to four rows.

Whenever a player is unable to play, he must discard a tile from his hand facedown.

When all the players' hands are empty, the round is scored. Each players counts the pips on his tiles, and must pay to his opponents with lesser scores the difference in points. If a player manages to play all his tiles, this scoring difference is doubled.

183051.name: Travel in Time
183051.description:
Ταξίδι στο Χρόνο ("Time Travel") is an educational game in which 2-4 players are been asked about important facts from history of Greece and the other world. The game is played with four different ways, depending on the difficulty you want to play, if you want to use sand timer etc.

The game consists of 500 cards, 200 blue(easy) and 300 red (difficult) and 1 sand timer, and every player can choose the color of the card, so children with different ages can play together.

183052.name: Shadow Fight
183052.description:
User Summary

Shadow Fight is a game where you are an Oriental fighter. You fighter several opponents in 1 on 1 matches, starting unarmed, but soon using a whole array of oriental weaponry. Beating opponents grant you new weapons and money for upgrades.
Typical in these games are for both fighters to be only shown as silhouettes.

183054.name: Bounty Hunter vs. Battle Droids
183054.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a bounty Hunter. You are engaged in a fight to the death against a lethal squadron of battle droids. The droids' leader, Wuntoo Forcee Forwun, will stop at nothing in his quest to rule the galaxy. You must stand in his way. But be careful - the droids are not your only enemies. Other bounty hunters want to get to Forwun before you do. The reward is high - and the risks are extraordinary. Good luck.

183055.name: The Vactooine Disaster
183055.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Planet Vactooine is in grave danger - a squadron of ruthless battle droids is about to attack. The droids are part of a sinister conspiracy to control the galaxy. As a member of the Rebel Alliance, you must protect the innocent planet from certain doom. Your mission: to prevent the Vactooine Disaster! May the Force be with you.

183056.name: Prisoner of the Nikto Pirates
183056.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Millennium Falcon has been damaged and captured by bloodthirsty Nikto pirates. You are trapped in the pirates' Predator-class vessel…with only one chance to break free. Time is already running out. Your mission: to steal the parts needed to fix the Falcon, repair your ship, and make a daring escape.

May the Force be with you.

183057.name: Shadow Fight 2
183057.description:
User Summary

Like its predecessor, Shadow Fight 2 is a game where you are an Oriental fighter. You fighter several opponents in 1 on 1 matches, starting unarmed, but soon using a whole array of oriental weaponry. Beating opponents grant you new weapons and money for upgrades.
Typical for this games is both fighters are only shown as silhouettes.

Besides the move from web browser to mobile, the game has new opponents, cutscenes, and a map where you'll plot your route to the end boss.

183058.name: The Monsters of Dweem
183058.description:
From publisher blurb:

The monsters of Dweem do not take any prisoners. They are the color of ice, and can appear at any moment with their jagged teeth bared. You are an Imperial soldier who has traveled to Dweem in search of Han Solo and his Rebel friends. You will be lucky to get off the planet alive. Your mission: to trap the Rebels before the monsters of Dweem trap you.

Good luck.

183059.name: Voyage to the Underworld
183059.description:
From publisher blurb:

Imperial stormtroopers are on your trail—and there's only one place for you to hide. Coruscant's underworld is a bizarre maze of danger and fear. But in order to survive, you must find the strange wise man at its center. Your Mission: to travel to the heart of the underworld and escape your pursuers.

May the Force be with you.

183060.name: Imperial Jailbreak
183060.description:
From publisher blurb:

A powerful weapon is being held at the Imperial prison on Merakai. You must retrieve it... or face severe punishment. The hitch? You must break into and then back out of the prison – without getting caught. Your mission: to engineer the biggest jailbreak in Merakai history!

Good luck.

183061.name: Darth Vader's Return
183061.description:
From publisher blurb:

Darth Vader has returned to Coruscant after the destruction of the first Death Star. There, he discovers his next mission. In the days before Grand Moff Tarkin's death, Tarkin recorded a top secret holotape... complete with information that would enable the Empire to dominate hyperspace. Your mission: to retrieve the missing holotape and bring glory to the Emperor.

Good luck.

183062.name: Rogue Squadron to the Rescue
183062.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Empire has seized a Corellian Action IV bulk freighter. As a member of Rogue Squadron, you must find out why the Imperial forces have taken the vessel. Then you must stop them. Your mission: to free the freighter's crew from their detention cells, and to infiltrate the hijacked craft.

May the Force be with you.

183063.name: Bounty on Bonadan
183063.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a bounty hunter. The Empire has hired you to track down an Imperial engineer who has been arrested by the deadly Corporate Sector Authority security police. If you rescue the prisoner, you will be handsomely rewarded. If you don't, you will have to face the wrath of Darth Vader. Your mission: to win the bounty...and keep your life.

Good luck.

183064.name: Total Destruction
183064.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a Rebel. On a distant planet in the Unknown Regions, the Empire is setting up a device that will allow them to control all hyperspace travel. If they succeed, the Rebellion will be crushed – and the Empire will dominate the galaxy forevermore. You are the Rebellion's only hope. Your mission: to destroy the Imperial device – and thwart Darth Vader's sinister plans.

May the Force be with you.

183065.description:
In 2012 the Institute of National Remembrance published a game called “ZnajZnak”. The game is the history of Poland told with 133 symbols. Playing “ZnajZank” makes it unbelievably easy to remember the most important figures, dates, places and objects in Polish modern history.

ZnajZnak - Sport is an educational game for 2 to 8 players about sport in Poland (1918-1945). The 133 symbols placed on the game cards were carefully selected to show best sportsmen, club badges, world records and many more.

ZnajZnak - Sport includes 63 cards on each of which 12 different symbols have been placed. Every two cards have a common symbol. Your job is to find and name it as fast as you can. If you don’t recognize your symbol flip your card and read the information on the other side. Then place a new card on the back of your deck and go on with the game. If you manage to name your symbol you should give your card to the player on the left. The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.
183065.name: ZnajZnak: Sport

183066.name: The Fury of Darth Maul
183066.description:
From publisher blurb:

Darth Sidious has a mission for you.

Someone has stolen his starfighters.

Now you must get them back.

Feel the dark side.

183067.name: Jedi Emergency
183067.description:
From publisher blurb:

You have learned of a young girl who has the power to become a Jedi. You have come to the planet of Corulag to see her.

But an evil scientist doesn't want to let her go. And her home is under attack by Bartokk Assassins.

As a Jedi, you must save her.

The future is at stake.

183068.name: The Ghostling Children
rpgitemversion: Star Wars Episode I Adventures First Edition
183068.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ghostling children live on a beautiful, isolated world, safe from harm…until they are captured by an evil trader. Soon they find themselves on the harsh planet of Tatooine, about to be sold to the terrifying Gardulla the Hutt.

You are their only hope. You must break into Gardulla's fortress and free them.

Can you save the Ghostlings?

183069.name: The Hunt for Anakin Skywalker
rpgitemversion: Star Wars Episode I Adventures First Edition
183069.description:
From publisher blurb:

Anakin Skywalker and his friends have helped to free a group of Ghostling slaves. Now their owner, Gardulla the Hutt, wants to find out who's responsible. And the Hutt wants revenge.

Your assignment: to track down Anakin Skywalker and bring him back to Gardulla.

Can you find him?

Can you save him?

183070.name: Capture Arawynne
rpgitemversion: Star Wars Episode I Adventures First Edition
183070.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jabba the Hutt has a mission for you. Princess Arawynne and the rest of the Ghostling children are missing. They have been hidden, and Jabba wants them back…at any cost.

You head to Gardulla the Hutt's pleasure garden to track the slaves down. Be careful! Arawynne and her friends aren't going to be captured without a fight…

183071.name: Trouble on Tatooine
rpgitemversion: Star Wars Episode I Adventures First Edition
183071.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are in big trouble. Slave hunters are on your trail. An innocent band of Ghostling children is depending on you. And you have just one chance for freedom.

Can you make it?

183072.name: Rescue in the Core
183072.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a Gungan on your way to the Quarry, a spooky abandoned prison. When an underwater storm hits and fierce sea creatures attack, you must take desperate measures to save yourself and your ship.

Can you make it?

183073.name: Festival of Warriors
183073.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Festival of Warriors is the most challenging athletic competition in Otoh Gunga. You are one of hundreds of participants in its main event, the Big Nasty Free-For-All. This year's Free-For-All is the nastiest yet, because of the unexpected arrival of some very unfriendly droids.

Can you win the race…and save the Gungans?

183074.name: Pirates from Beyond the Sea
183074.description:
From publisher blurb:

Space pirates have attacked the Gungans' sacred place, hijacking ancient statues and threatening to sell them to the highest bidder. You are the only Gungan who can save these treasures—and defeat the invaders.

Move quickly. Time is running out.

183076.name: The Bongo Rally
183076.description:
From publisher blurb:

The festival arena outside Otoh Gunga is under attack. An evil pirate and a renegade pair of droids are speeding toward the big Bongo Rally to cause mass destruction. Only one Gungan can stop the villains.

That Gungan is you.

183077.name: Danger on Naboo
rpgitemversion: Star Wars Episode I Adventures First Edition
183077.description:
From publisher blurb:

The planet of Naboo has been blockaded. You have been sent as a Jedi emissary to establish peace. But you find war instead.

Naboo needs your help.

183078.name: Podrace to Freedom
rpgitemversion: Star Wars Episode I Adventures First Edition
183078.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a slave on the planet Tatooine. When a band of visitors needs a way to leave Tatooine, you offer to help.

Your only hope is to win the most dangerous Podrace of your life.

183079.name: The Final Battle
183079.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Trade Federation has captured the peaceful planet Naboo. Now you must save it. Battle droids, starfighters, and an evil Sith Lord stand in your way.

Can you do it?

183080.name: The Cavern of Screaming Skulls
183080.description:
From publisher blurb:

Three missing gems.

One dangerous cave.

One life in the balance.

You are on a race against time…and death.

May the Force be with you.

183081.name: The Hostage Princess
183081.description:
From publisher blurb:

A princess has been taken hostage by a squadron of deadly droids.

The Jedi must find her…before it's too late.

May the Force be with you.

183082.name: Jango Fett vs. the Razor Footers
183082.description:
From publisher blurb:

Count Dooku has discovered a conspiracy that he wants stopped.

He knows just the bounty hunter to stop it.

You.

May the Force be with you.

183083.name: The Shape-Shifter Strikes
183083.description:
From publisher blurb:

Darth Tyranus has placed a bounty on the head of Hurlo Holowan, the diabolical droid engineer.

But Holowan has fled to her fortified estate on Kuat.

Getting into her headquarters is going to be difficult. Getting out is going to be tougher. Only a shapeshifter could hope to enter. Only a bounty hunter like you could hope to exit…alive.

183084.name: The Warlords of Balmorra
183084.description:
From publisher blurb:

What Count Dooku wants, Count Dooku gets.

Even if it's a Senator.

Even if it's a Hutt.

He's lucky to have a bounty hunter like you to help him.

183085.name: Mummy (ICONS)
183085.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Manual of Mutants & Monsters Mummy for ICONS wants to Wrap Up Your Heroes

This release of The Manual of Mutants & Monsters for ICONS provides game stats on the Mummy, an undead horror doomed to rise up again. Whether charged with guardian something, or cursed to eternal life as some form of punishment, the mummy has undead villainy all wrapped up.

This product includes a template for creating a mummy from just about any character, as well as a sample mummy and the far more powerful mummy lord.

183086.name: Ferry Station
183086.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 267th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a small ferry station at a river.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

183087.name: The Aelfmynster Ruins
183087.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep in forest, overgrown with moss and ivy, stand the Aelfmynster Ruins. So named by the locals for it's resemblance to a church, they were unaware of the importance that this Elvish temple once held. Whilst the Eldthruin Empire was at its zenith, the High Temple of Methry'uin was famed throughout the land as a place of worship, but that was long ago. Travellers that come across the ruins may seek shelter from a storm beside the marble walls, little realising the secrets beneath the worn stones.
The Aelfmynster Ruins is a set of printable dungeon floorplans compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

The Aelfmynster Ruins is a multiple level set, comprising 2 battlemaps (each depicting a different floor)
Ground Floor - A ruined temple or minster made of marble, with grand circular steps and columns. An altar stands above a panel of stone, ornately carved with script.
Crypt - Reached by a set of secret steps that open in front of the altar, the floor of the colonnaded crypt is broken and torn by tree roots that have grown down there. The grand Elf deity statue at the end of the building watches over the crypt as time takes its toll.

183088.name: Cities of Aden
183088.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Darkfall brought the Known Lands to the brink of ruin, with countless settlements destroyed on that terrible day, and more during the chaos that followed. Those villages, towns, and cities that have survived have been forced to become bastions of strength and military power, standing against the hordes of nocturnals like beacons in the darkness. These are the destinations that bring respite to weary adventurers, allowing them to barter their spoils of war for new and exciting equipment! But they are dangerous as well, and some may find that the nocturnals are a much more straightforward foe than their fellow survivors!

Cities of Aden includes details on twelve of the Known Lands' most intriguing settlements, as well as an assortment of eight new Traits that players can use to create a character from one of these vibrant towns!

183089.name: Hybrid Classes Vol. I
183089.description:
From publisher blurb:

5 New Hybrid Classes for your Game!

The Forge Priest- a specialized armor crafter that can imbue his spells onto armor worn by others.
The Forest Warden- a unique hunter who's animal companion gains the abilities of a wizard's familiar.
The Looter- a barbaric rogue that moves swiftly into battle, stealing anything thats not nailed down.
The Mariner- A naval based class that takes the fight to the devils beneath the waves.
The Shadowskiver- a sneaky, illusion based assassin who can manipulate the fabric of darkness.




Plus new spells, feats and skills to enhance their special abilities!

183090.name: Journey to Oblivion
183090.description:
From publisher blurb:

FQ5 – Journey to Oblivion continues the Filbar Quest Series and begins in The Knolls with word that Baron Wizzel requests your assistance. A humanoid threat has been growing near the small town of Oblivion. The baron will speak with the party and offer them a large reward to perform a scouting mission. The baron and other nobles are attempting to gather their forces but would like an idea of what they are going to face. With the reputation of the PCs the baron feels that the group is more than capable of the mission.

Once at Oblivion the party will discover that the humanoids are reported to be “everywhere” but the highest concentration will be to the east on the frontier. This adventure also includes a fleshed out town of Oblivion which can be used in any campaign. While this adventure is part of the Quest series it is easy to integrate into your own campaign as a ‘one-shot’ adventure. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

183091.name: Gem Rush Skill Cards
183091.description: From the nimble mind of Gem Rush designer Jeremy Lennert, this set of eleven Skill cards gives each player a unique mining ability as their edge. In addition, there are several gameplay variants to choose from.

183092.name: No Country for Weak Men (S&W)
183092.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Somewhere in Frostreave…

“Ever since we left that so-called town at the edge of the land of eternal ice, I’ve been freezing my butts off! And no trace of that were-whatever-thing we’re supposed to hunt down.

Our best scout, Halross, says she’s been passing here, into this valley, but I get a bad feeling from all this silence, frost and snow. It’s empty here. No animals. No tracks. No nothing, but ice and snow. It’s not natural…

And now we’re stuck in this cave. The blizzard has lasted two days now, and our supplies are almost gone. Hell, I’d give a sack of gold for a cold ale and a hot wench in my lap right now.

I can smell the fear of the others – die of starvation or disgust here, or freeze to death out there. And some other not so pleasant smells too… Some choice, huh?

Maybe we can roast that gnome’s pony? Would have been nice with some food now… Or, we just roast the gnome… Everyone’s on the edge. No sign of the blizzard waning either. I reckon someone will snap soon…

Well, not me. Guess it’s time we get moving…”

No Country for Weak Men is a traditional dungeon, meant to be played the hard way. Dark, shitty and remorseless. And if the Draugr don’t get you the cold or lack of food will…

183093.name: Come To Daddy (S&W)
183093.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Most fairy tales end with a ”happily ever after.”

This is not one of those tales

In Come To Daddy, the characters end up in the clutches of a most evil family of crazy viking mutant cannibal killers and their weird monster creations in the middle of a frosty nowhere. The place is also haunted by the souls of some of their unfortunate victims and full of lethal traps for the unwary. Surviving this adventure will take both brawn and brain as well as a major dose of luck. And as if that is not enough, far more sinister things are lurking in the shadows, waiting to be unveiled.

Welcome to nightmare on earth.

☩

My family’s always been in meat.


– Torgil Rodbrok, mutant cannibal lycanthrope killer

183094.name: Tanemaki
183094.description:
User summary:
たねまき (Tanemaki) is a card game from Hoy Games that bears similarity to Bohnanza in theme and scoring, but the basic gameplay is significantly different.

The similarities are:
Players are farmers growing different crops in up to two fields.

When these crops are harvested, they turn over into coins (Hoyer) according to the distribution on the crop. The design of the cards looks similar to Bohnanza in this respect.

The difference is the way cards are distributed. The active player draws a hand of cards from the draw deck, drawing the number of players plus one. They choose an opponent and pass them a seed card face-down in secret. That player has three options: to either plant it face-up in their own field, or place it face-up in the Storehouse in front of the active player, or pass it face-down to another player who is still in the round (who then has the same options but cannot pass it back). Once a player plants a seed card in a field, they are out for the round. Eventually, all the other players will have planted a seed card, or added the seed card to a field with that crop. The active player is left to choose their seed card from what is left in their hand or what is in the Storehouse (which can store 2 cards). The remaining card is discarded. The turn passes left to the new active player.

If a player has their two fields occupied, and has to plant a seed which does not match the two crops, they must harvest one crop. As well as the seed cards, there are manure cards which act as Jokers. Planted cards are staggered to show how many are in a field, so any Manure cards go at the back of the stagger.

Play ends when the active player cannot draw enough cards to distribute. The player with the most money winds, ties are broken by owning the most of the rarest plants.

So whilst Tanemaki has obvious connections to Bohnanza, the game play is calculated and based on hand management from the card draft, and no bartering is involved.

The 2nd edition includes English rules. The differences between the 1st and 2nd editions are:
- Redesigned the box
- Reduced card size
- Improved card quality
- Redesigned the back of the cards

Publisher summary:
プレイヤーは農家となり、野菜の種を集めます。
種が必要な量までまかれたらお金を得ることができます。
一番お金を多く獲得できた人が勝者となります。

You are a farmer, who's trying to grow vegetables.
Collect the seeds, plant as many as possible and then harvest them for coins.
The player with the most coins wins the game.

183095.name: Wieża Snów (Issue 6 - Summer 2005)
183095.description:
Wieża Snów
kwartalnik o grach fabularnych i fantastyce
Numer 6 - Lato 2004

183096.name: Wieża Snów (Issue 11 - Fall 2006)
183096.description:
Wieża Snów
kwartalnik o grach fabularnych i fantastyce
Numer 11 - Jesień 2006

183098.name: Wieża Snów (Issue 8 - Winter 2006)
183098.description:
Wieża Snów
kwartalnik o grach fabularnych i fantastyce
Numer 8 - Zima 2006

183099.description: What’s a cowboy without his horse, you ask? Well, ask no more for Flick 'em Up! Stallion Canyon, the first expansion for Flick 'em Up!, introduces dashing horses! Two cowgirls also join the gang amongst many new elements that will have you conquering brand new towns and scenarios for more flickin' fun!
183099.name: Flick 'em Up!: Stallion Canyon
boardgamepodcastepisode: MOBG podcast 39 This is the Real Deal, Part 2 of Spiel Essen

183100.name: Rank & Vile
183100.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a fantasy adventure where the characters are the monsters! Your squad is besieging a civilised city, and you've been many moons in this mud. If the enemy don't get you the food will, or the officers. Or the ogres.

Fifteen events take your squad from the relative safety of their siege tower to the final assault on the walls. In between, you'll follow orders, no matter what they are.

Five PCs are provided with 5th Edition D&D stats. It's simplicity itself to use this scenario for any fantasy edition or rules, as it's heavy on the words and light on the numbers so you can make it your own.

183101.name: Conventional Wisdom
183101.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Gaming conventions are brilliant. They combine the best of social hobbies, in a place where you are surrounded by like-minded people, with all the buzz and excitement of a festival. Yet, they can also be intimidating to the newbie.

If you don’t know what’s going on, or who’s who, you might think all the fun was happening elsewhere. Even if you’ve been to Cons before, you might be nervous about stepping up to run games, or volunteering to help with the organisation.

This guide is for everyone who wants to get an even better Con experience. It’s written with the UK community in mind, but the etiquette of Cons is pretty universal, and travels well!

The first section, ‘Rules to Live By’ is for everyone, but especially if you’re new to Cons. The second section ‘Mastering Games’, is for those who want to run games at Cons, or just run even better Con games. Even if you don’t think that’s for you, it’s well worth a read. Running good Con games is easier than you think, and incredibly rewarding.

183102.name: Trivial Pursuit: Wellness Edition
boardgamefamily: The All Canadian Trivia Board Game
183102.description:
A small version of the famous game, specially produced for the Nestle Company and it promotes the healthy ways of life.

The box contains everything you need to play, a folded board, a die, 6 different plastic player tokens with 36 pieces, and a deck of cards, that have the following categories of questions:
1. Diet and Health
2. Workout
3. Entertainment,Hobbies and Relaxation
4. Ecology and Environment
5. Science and Technology
6. Geography and History

This product is for promotional use only

[P]acket contains pre-generated characters, as well as a pre-generated Stronghold. It also contains a sample background for an Alliance mission with the Gravewood minor faction. It should be used in conjunction with the rules.

183113.name: Even More Things to Kill and Eat!
183113.description:
From the back of the book:

The first sourcebook for the classic beer and pretzels role-playing game KOBOLDS ATE MY BABY! Between these covers you will find a plethora of powerful poultry, a myriad of mytHical monsters, a duffle of dangerous deities, an ocean of outrageous outfits, a smattering of silly sorceries, a rucksack of ridiculous rules, and more, MUCH more! You will find pirates, cowboys, wrestlers, ninja, and chickens, even more chickens than you can shake (and bake) a delicious cornmeal coating onto! It’s more of everything that you love about KOBOLDS ATE MY BABY! it’s time for more! MORE! MORE!

183114.name: A Little Magic
183114.description:
User summary:
Scenario and sourcebook for a Parlor Larp. Includes core rules and everything needed to play for 1 Director and 4-8 players. Requires no preparation, a normal sized room, and takes about 4-5 hours.

From the introductory material:
A Playful love story in a New England town with a little magic.

183115.name: All Saints' Eve
183115.description:
User summary:
Scenario and sourcebook for a Parlor Larp. Includes core rules and everything needed to play for 1 Director and 4-8 players. Requires no preparation, a normal sized room, and takes about 4-5 hours.

From the introductory material:
Small town politics, human crimes, and ancient evil on Halloween Night.

183116.name: Argentin
183116.description:
User summary:
Scenario and sourcebook for a Parlor Larp. Includes core rules and everything needed to play for 1 Director and 4-8 players. Requires no preparation, a normal sized room, and takes about 4-5 hours.

183117.name: Eridanus Rising

183118.name: The First of December

183121.name: The Mirror Room

183123.name: Snow White
183123.description:
User summary:
Scenario and sourcebook for a Parlor Larp. Includes core rules and everything needed to play for 1 Director and 4-8 players. Requires no preparation, a normal sized room, and takes about 4-5 hours.
