183125.description: Your fingers are going to get a bit sticky with this one! The S'mores Faction also includes nine new fighters tiles, three S'mores-only power cards (Sticky Fingers, Gimme S'More, and Fired Up), and a sheet of nine thought bubble clingers.
183125.name: Foodfighters: the S'Mores Expansion

183126.name: Avalanche
183126.description:
The charge is set, the choppers are primed, and the riding conditions are nearly perfect. It's time to shred this slope like no other!

In Avalanche, each player assumes the role of an adrenaline crazed snowboarder, and participates in an event where riders deliberately race an avalanche (and each other) down the mountain. It is of course important to stay in front of the snow, and to try and finish the event first, but what really matters to these shredders is bragging rights. In the end, whoever has the most to brag about wins!

Each round, players will simultaneously choose up to three action cards to bet, and place them face down on the table. Once everyone has decided which moves they want to try and pull off, they reveal their cards, and each player rolls in turn order for the resources they need to successfully complete their actions. Some actions are easier to pull off than others, but will usually grant you either fewer bragging rights, less combo, or less movement.

After each player has completed their rolling phase, the avalanche is advanced, and anyone who is caught by it must subsequently roll for an immediate rescue. Once they've managed to successfully latch onto a helicopter, they lift out, land one space in front of the avalanche, and a new round begins.

183127.name: All the Little Things
183127.description:
User summmary:
Players control characters that are small toys or other household objects, which have been animated, or "brought to life", by human attention and proximity. The player characters are animated by positive emotions and energies while opponents may be animated by negative emotions or energies.

183128.name: Feast of Goblins
183128.description:
From the introduction:

Feast [of Goblins] is about Goblins, strange amalgamations of left over parts from the creation of life in our world. They live in [a] realm that’s as slapped together as them. They live, they die, only to be recycled to make more. That is unless a feast occurs.

User summary:
Unusual complex but rapid character creation process yielding unique physical bodies. Abilities based primarily upon randomized body components.

183129.name: Pathways (Issue 51 - Aug 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Twenty Dungeon Statues with a Secret
Twenty Things to Find on an Evil Altar
183129.description:
From the Publisher's Blurb:

A Plague of Pathways

Our first Patreon enhanced issue, so we are bringing you even more FREE Pathfinder content. A monster template, epidemics, magic whistles, Dungeon Dressing for statues and altars, and advice on GMing plagues, plus episode #16 of the Path Less Traveled Comic by Jacob Blackmon. If you say no, we will release a False Idol Leukodaemon so you can attempt to stop him and his disease spreading cultists!

Rite Publishing brings you Pathways, a free 'zine packed with plenty of Open Gaming Content for you to take to the table. You'll find articles by Rpg Superstar Mike Welham (Pathfinder Module: Doom Comes to Dustpawn), Wendall Roy(In the Company of Dragons), Steven D. Russell (Book of Monster Templates) Creighton Broadhurst (Raging Swan Press) plus an interview with Monica Marlowe (Rpg Superstar 2014)

183130.name: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - Season Two
videogamehonor: 2014 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Story of the Year Nominee
2014 The Game Awards Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
2015 British Academy Game Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
videogamecompilation: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - Season 2: Episode 1: All That Remains
The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - Season 2: Episode 2: A House Divided
The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - Season 2: Episode 3: In Harm's Way
The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - Season 2: Episode 4: Amid The Ruins
The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - Season 2: Episode 5: No Going Back
183130.description:
The Walking Dead is an episodic video game series based on Robert Kirkman’s award-winning comic books. Season One of The Walking Dead won over 90 Game of the Year Awards.

Season Two continues the story that began in Season One. You are Clementine, a young survivor in a world gone to hell. The dead have risen to feast on the living, and the living cannot be trusted.

The story you experience in The Walking Dead Season Two is driven by the choices that you make. Because of that, your story could be very different from someone else’s. If you played Season One and the DLC episode ‘400 Days’, the choices you made there will affect Season Two.

While you don’t have to play Season One or 400 Days to enjoy Season Two, we recommend that you do in order to get the most from the story.

Source: The Game Website.

183131.name: Picross Monster
183131.description:
User Summary

Picross Monster sees you working out classic nonogram style puzzles in order to 'find' and collect monsters. Each puzzle, once complete, reveals a different monster and rewards you with a little info about each one.

The game contains puzzles on a 5x5 grid, 8x8 grid, 10x10 grid and a 15x15 grid.

183132.name: Lara Croft GO
videogamehonor: 2015 CVA Best Animation of the Year Nominee
2015 CVA Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2015 CVA Best Canadian-Made Game of the Year Nominee
2015 CVA Best Game Design of the Year Nominee
2015 CVA Best iOS Game of the Year Winner
2015 CVA Best Visual Arts of the Year Nominee
2015 CVA Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Global Game Awards Best Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
2015 The Game Awards Best Mobile/Handheld Game of the Year Winner
2016 Apple Design Awards Best Mobile Game of the Year Winner
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2016 D.I.C.E. Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2016 D.I.C.E. Best Game Design of the Year Nominee
2016 D.I.C.E. Cellular/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2016 SXSW Best Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
183132.description:
Lara Croft GO expands the turn-based puzzle gameplay and takes you on an adventure set in a long-forgotten world. Explore the ruins of an ancient civilization, discover hidden secrets and face deadly challenges as you uncover the myth of the Queen of Venom.
A never-before-seen take on the iconic franchise featuring challenging gameplay, gorgeous visuals and a mesmerizing soundtrack, all at your fingertips.

Source: The Publisher Website.

183133.name: Pictionary Dice Game
183133.description:
It's "Pictionary in a can" with the Pictionary Dice Game. The new twist on the classic drawing game has two players rolling dice to decide what to draw next. Out of three descriptor dice and three subject dice, the players choose a die from each category to make a unique combination. The artistic battle is then on.

Draw as quickly as you can to help your team guess the combination. Your opponent's doing the same thing. The first team to guess right scores the point. The first team with five points wins it all, including the coveted bragging rights. Add this to family game night or pull it out at parties for an unforgettable game night full of laughs and really bad drawings.

183135.name: Championship Manager: Season 97/98
183135.description:
Championship Manager 97/98 is a game in the Championship Manager series of football management computer games, based on the Championship Manager 2 game engine. It was developed by Sports Interactive and released in October 1997, exclusively for the PC, as the final game in the second generation of CM games.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Championship_Manager%3A_Season_97%2F98 Championship Manager: Season 97/98]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

183136.name: Niji no Silkroad
183136.description:
User Summary

This game takes the Dragon Quest JRPG formula and spins it into something new. In Rainbow Silk Road selling high and buying low is the name of the game. The player does not get any gold or experience points for wining battles! Instead the player is forced to trade goods on the Silk Road to acquire money. Money buys more powerful weapons and armour -- how you "Level Up" -- as well as the Kings favour and additional quests.

This game was only released in Japan.

183137.name: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Take-Down – Missions in Korea
183137.description:
Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Take-Down – Missions in Korea is a South Korean-made PC game release on July, 2001. The game is not based on the Rainbow Six game timeline since the game was not released outside of South Korea and was only made by Kama Digital Entertainment for the South Korean gaming market with major content difference and the game's events on South Korean soil.

In the game, RAINBOW gets deployed to South Korea and battles seemingly armed terrorists and criminals that have committed various acts, mostly against South Korean nationals.

Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Clancy%27s_Rainbow_Six,&...; available under the [ http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ CC-BY-SA License].

183138.description:
Just when you thought it was safe to return to the island paradise of Cuba, it's time for the revolucion! New characters are joining the party and everyone has a secret agenda. The crooked lawyer will join forces with whoever suits his interests, the diamond lover hopes to get caught and the revolutionaries will win if the godfather accuses them.

Look out for the fake diamond as well. It can allow you to get away with thieving from the big boss, but if you also took real diamonds you might still get your hand caught in the cookie jar.

This expansion for Mafia de Cuba will keep you guessing until the last minute! Viva La Revolucion!
183138.name: Mafia de Cuba: Revolución
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 93- Clank! and The Dark Side of Gaming: Obsession

183139.description:
A new expansion published in the 999 games 25 years gift box. It adds a new tile, a joker and gift tokens to the game. It seems it is more intended as a fun promo extension than a serious addition to the game.

The tile replaces the tile on which the number "2" is placed. The number "2" is then placed at the same tile as the number "12". Place the joker on the new tile.

The joker gives away "gift tokens" that can be traded for resource cards.
This expansion increases the strategic value of wool, which in the basic game is considered the least attractive commodity. Furthermore, the Joker is useful to chase the robber and/or to protect a land tile.

This item is contained in 999 Games trakteert!.

This is identical except in artwork and theme to the Catan Mini-expansion in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015.
183139.name: Catan: 999 Games 25 jaar Expansion

183140.name: Samara: Expansion 1 – Buildings, Goals & Tokens
183140.description:
Samara: Expansion 1 – Buildings, Goals & Tokens contains the stretch goals of the crowdfunding campaign for Samara, specifically:


10 building tiles that play a special role
10 hidden goal tiles
A wooden horse, sword, and professor token that give a special power to one worker

183141.name: Nephandum: Creature del Terrore
183141.description:
From the back of the book:
Creature del terrore introduce nuovi mostri che andranno a infestare i luoghi corrotti dall'influenza del Nepahndum. L'avvento dei cinque terrori ancestrali provoca la comparsa di orride creature in grado di scatenare paura e devastazione in qualsiasi mondo di gioco.

English translation:
Creature del terrore introduces new monsters that will haunt the places corrupted by the influence of Nepahndum. The advent of the five ancestral terrors causes the appearance of hideous creatures can trigger fear and devastation in any game world.

183142.name: Empyrea
183142.description:
From the back of the book:
Empyrea espande gli orizzonti dei mondi di gioco, utilizzando le regole d20 system per presentare una nuova cosmologia alternativa e compatibile con i sistemi planari di qualsiasi ambientazione fantasy.

English translation:
Empyrea expands the horizons of the game worlds, using the d20 system rules to present a new alternative cosmology and compatible with planar systems of any fantasy setting.

183144.name: Empyrea: 1 I Segreti di Gemini
183144.description:
From the back of the book:
Gemini, un fulcro leggendario di mistero, potere, fascino e ricchezza. Da sempre la maestosa città interplanare attira vaste schiere di viaggiatori che giungono nella metropoli guidate dal miraggio delle sue opportunità e delle sue meraviglie.

English translation:
Gemini, thea fulcrum of legendary mystery, power, brilliance and richness. The majestic interplanar city always attracts vast numbers of travelers arriving in the city guided by the lure of its opportunities and its wonders.

183145.name: Dick: A Card Game Based on the Novel by Herman Melville
183145.description:
Dick is a party game in which you use direct quotations from Herman Melville's 1851 novel, Moby-Dick, to propose answers to mock-serious questions. It is a game about playing irreverently with words and meanings.

In each round, one player serves as a judge and reads aloud a question or fill-in-the-blank prompt from a green card. The other players submit white cards, each containing a verbatim quotation from Moby-Dick, as suggested completions for the prompt. The judge reads all the submissions aloud and chooses the best one, construing "best" however he or she sees fit. The winner keeps the green card, everybody replenishes their white cards, and the role of judge rotates to the next player. At the end of the game, whoever has the most green cards wins.

The game depends on understanding the particular wit of the other players and strategically playing answers to appeal to each round's judge. The sheer irreverent weirdness (sexual and otherwise) of Moby-Dick is what makes the game exciting and hilarious.

183146.name: The Devil's Bedpost
183146.description:
The Devil's Bedpost - A quick 2 player game of card drafting.

As working class MUBs (monsters under the bed), your and your opponent dream of becoming middle monster management in the Devil’s hellish hierarchy. To that end you decide to compete in the annual MUB evaluations. You are each given a target bedroom and all the devilish tools at your disposal to keep your sleepy victim awake all night. The MUB who earns the most points after eight hourly rounds of mayhem and mischief will get a promotion, the other MUB... well, they’ll get what’s coming to them...

Setup:
Shuffle the deck of cards and deal 16 cards to each player. The remaining two cards will form a discard pile. That’s it.

Game Phases:
There are 3 phases to each round:
1. Play 2. Discard 3. Pass.

1. Play:
During this phase each player will play one card from their hand face down, then reveal at the same time and place it in their ‘bedroom’. On the first turn, players will place the card down in front of them. On consecutive turns each additional card will be placed adjacent to one already played. Cards will form a rectangle of 8 cards by the game’s end. It does not matter which end of the card line the adjacent card is played to.

Each bedroom has 4 sides and 4 corners. Top and bottom sides of the bedroom are opposite each other. Left and right sides of the bedroom are also opposite each other. Cards may never be moved in a bedroom unless the special action on a card allows it.

After playing a card each player must use the special action of that card, if applicable.

2. Discard:
Players now each discard from their hand face down to the discard pile.

3. Pass:
Players now pass their remaining hand of cards to the other player.

Game End and Scoring:
After each player has placed their eighth card in their bedroom, and discarded the final card from their hand to the discard pile, the cards are scored.

The top of each card shows its point value (as well as a small black number which shows how many of those types of card are in the deck).

Many of the cards have special actions which give scoring bonuses depending upon position and/or number of cards. The player with the highest score is the winner. If players are tied, the player who sleeps the longest the next night is declared the winner.

183147.name: Into the Deep (Issue 5 - May 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Business As Usual: Carellines Ltd. ‐ An Aggressive Competitor
Contact!: The Virushi, The Intelligent Bulldozers
Travellers Guide: Virshash ‐ The Home of Giants

CONTENTS:

Editor's Desk

Travellers Guide: HavantFeatured Adventure: Havant Happenings

Who Are You?: Travik Sundowner
Who Are You?: Darka Mancinado
Business As Usual: Carellines Ltd. ‐ An Aggressive Competitor

Contact!: The Virushi, The Intelligent Bulldozers
News Feed:
Library Data: The Urlaggash Subsectors
Back Page:

183148.name: The Imperium Staple (Issue 12 - Jun 1987)
183148.description: The 12th issue of The Imperium Staple.

183149.name: Teh Cutest Wittle Awwpocawpse
183149.description:
The Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse come to Earth to collect all souls.

The goal is to bring about the Awwpocawpse by riding the planet of its entire population in 4 turns. Be the horseman with the greatest collection of souls at the end.

Each player take one horseman (Death, Famine, Pestilence and War) and moves over the game board (the world) and snap up as many souls as possible. Each time they can use 3 Action Points to achieve that goal. Actions that can be taken are:

Move to an adjacent territory
Reap: take a population token from the territory they occupy or adjacent to.
Use a special ability, as described on the character's card.




The game is oriented at children.

183150.description:
In Morocco, players are families of artisans carrying on the ancient traditions of the world famous Jemaa el-Fnaa market square in Marrakech, Morocco. Each day, they work to claim the best stalls across the market and attract customers to sample their wares or be enthralled by their amazing spectacles.

It is going to be an extra busy day so the families fight even harder to claim the their needed space. The ancient families of snake charmers, water sellers, rug merchants, magicians, and food sellers work hard vying for the best stalls.

In Morocco, players will send their workers out to try and claim stalls at the market. When enough workers from the same family have made it to a stall, that family claims it and clears out any adjacent juice sellers.

Morocco is played over two separate phases: scout the market and assign workers. In the first phase, players use the nearby roof to scout the market and determine where the busiest stalls will be. In the second phase, players use the gained information to send workers out into the market.
183150.name: Morocco
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 037 – Top 10 Publishers
Episode 20: TatterCon 2015!
Episode 28 - Game Development with Josh Lobkowicz
The Long View - Quick Looks #21
Vox Republica 135: Gaming Difficulty
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 99

183151.name: Robox
183151.description:
You and your opponent have a team of 3 Robox that are fighting to see who is the best, and the player who defeat the opponent's team will be the winner. Both start with 1 active Robox and the other two will be in the reserve waiting to fight and helping to the active one. Plus, every Robox will be secretly configured with one of the 4 Special Powers.
On your turn you have to pick 2 of the 7 possible actions:

Attack: Only the active Robox can attack. Roll a die, if it's equal or less than your Attack Power (energy tokens + base point), remove 1 Energy Token from the defense of the opponent's active Robox.
Charge: If your Robox is in the Potentiate Position, change it to the Charge position and add 1 Energy Token from the pool to its Defence.
Potentiate: If your Robox is in the Charge position, change it to the Potentiate position and move 1 Energy Token from the Defence to the Attack.
Accumulate: Only the Active Robox can accumulate. Put 1 Energy Token from the pool next to your Robox Card. It will count as an extra Energy to your next attack and then it will go back to the pool.
Donate: Only the Reserve Robox can donate. Give 1 Energy Token from the defense of this Robox to the defense of the Active Robox; or from the attack of this Robox to the attack of the Active Robox.
Replace: Switch the Active Robox for 1 of the Reserve Robox.
Special Action: Use your special power.

183152.name: T2
183152.description: T2 is a fast paced micro drafting game for 3-5 players, each player secretly chooses then simultaneously reveals cards in an attempt to outwit the opposition. After four reveals the round is awarded to the player with the most points but the game is not over until the same person wins twice.

183153.description:
Trickster is a fun and easy-to-learn card game for 3-7 players, lasting about 15 minutes. Each Trickster set features its own heroes and new ways to play. Find the set that’s right for you... or mix together characters from different sets to customize your own game!

A Trickster set has 49 cards with seven heroes, each with their own simple effect on play. A hero appears in seven different suits, each a color of the rainbow: Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Indigo, Violet. Each hero and suit combination appears once in a set.

The first player of each round may play any card from her hand. The second player in the round is called The Trickster, who may also pay any card from her hand. Any subsequent player that round must play a card that follows the pattern set by the Trickster. (If the first two cards are Yellow, then everyone must play a Yellow card.)

If you cannot follow the pattern, you must collect cards played this round into your personal scoring area. If everyone was able to play one card, then the Trickster collects the cards.

The goal of Trickster is to have the fewest cards by the time any player has emptied her hand. Whoever has the fewest cards is the winner... with one exception! If you have more cards of a suit than any other player, you may ignore those cards when scoring.
183153.name: Trickster: Starship
boardgamefamily: Guild: Game Designers of North Carolina
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 15: Trickster, Princess Bride, Firefly, Oh My!

183154.description:
Trickster is a fun and easy-to-learn card game for 3-7 players, lasting about 15 minutes. Each Trickster set features its own heroes and new ways to play. Find the set that’s right for you... or mix together characters from different sets to customize your own game!

A Trickster set has 49 cards with seven heroes, each with their own simple effect on play. A hero appears in seven different suits, each a color of the rainbow: Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Indigo, Violet. Each hero and suit combination appears once in a set.

The first player of each round may play any card from her hand. The second player in the round is called The Trickster, who may also pay any card from her hand. Any subsequent player that round must play a card that follows the pattern set by the Trickster. (If the first two cards are Yellow, then everyone must play a Yellow card.)

If you cannot follow the pattern, you must collect cards played this round into your personal scoring area. If everyone was able to play one card, then the Trickster collects the cards.

The goal of Trickster is to have the fewest cards by the time any player has emptied her hand. Whoever has the fewest cards is the winner... with one exception! If you have more cards of a suit than any other player, you may ignore those cards when scoring.

'Trickster: Symbiosis' is a highly strategic set featuring characters from the biopunk setting Symbiosis by Steven Sanders.
183154.name: Trickster: Symbiosis
boardgamefamily: Guild: Game Designers of North Carolina
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 15: Trickster, Princess Bride, Firefly, Oh My!

183157.name: Bolt Action: Dad's Army
183157.description:
"During the days of 1940, Britain was under dire threat of Nazi invasion. A massive citizen army, the Local Defense Volunteers, was raised to defend their families and homes. Although armed with old or ad hoc weapons and equipment, the Home Guard, as it became known, was a vital part of the defense of British shores."

This boxed set contains 18 detailed pewter miniatures in 28mm scale with plastic bases. Also included are rules chronicling Dad's Army and how to field them in games of Bolt Action on the tabletop.

(in civilian garb)

Grocer Hodges
Frank Pike
Merchant Seaman Frazer
Mr. Mainwaring, Bank Manager
Jack Jones, Butcher
Arthur Wilson
Charles Godfrey
Joe Walker
Reverend Farthing
The Verger




(in military uniform)

Air Warden Hodges
Private Pike
Private Frazer
Captain Mainwaring
Lance Corporal Jones
Sergeant Wilson
Private Godfrey, Medic
Private Walker

183158.name: The City of Gold
183158.description:
A spin-and-move race game for 2-4 players with a man on foot, a man on horseback, a man in a car, and finally a man in an airplane. All four compete to be the first to reach the City of Gold. The man on horse moves 2x as fast as the man on foot. The car moves 3x as fast and the airplane 4x as fast as the man on foot. The airplane has the longest distance to travel while the man on foot has the shortest.

As in many race games, two players cannot occupy the same space at the same time. The person spinning knocks the occupant back to start. Blue spaces on the board are "safe" spaces where the occupant cannot be dislodged. The player spinning returns to start.

The player with the airplane must hit the red #4 by the exact number to enter the City of Gold. Likewise, the car must hit the red #3, the horse the red #2. and the man on foot the red #1. Only then may the player progress to the finish. The first player reaching the finish is the winner.

183159.name: PowerFrame Core Rulebook
183159.description:
From the introduction:

PowerFrame is a universal toolbox roleplaying game. It provides a solid, powerful framework of rules that allow you to build and play in your own action-adventure settings.

...

PowerFrame excels at games in which civilisation is tenuous, travel is treacherous, and creatures are dangerous – fantasy worlds, frontier societies, the postapocalypse. Characters often have humble beginnings, but can develop into epic action heroes.

183160.name: To The Last Drop of Blood The Battle of Kobani October 2014
183160.description:
By the beginning of October, 2014, the first set piece battle in the war with the radical ISIS terrorists occurred at Kobani, Syria, along the Syrian‐Turkish border. ISIS intended to secure this border town to make it easier for their volunteers to enter Syria from Turkey. But, like many battles, it was a battle that need not to have occurred. ISIS volunteers had entered from Turkey from many crossing points but the one difference was its close proximity to the ISIS capital of Raqqa. It was that reason that ISIS decided to fight a more conventional battle this time. It seemed like a sure win as up to 4000 ISIS soldiers gradually descended upon the Kobani area along with some 25‐30 AFVs from captured Iraqi booty when Iraq allowed the city of Mosul to fall. These AFV's, American M1 and T‐72M were still formidable weapons even in inexperienced hands and add to this numerous artillery guns from war booty, and ISIS was almost assured a victory. But like at Stalingrad in WW2, where the Russians refused to be defeated, the Kurdish YPG Peshmerga felt the same. Kobani had been in Kurdish hands and as ISIS swept many Kurdish towns into their hands and slaughtered them, the Kurds decided to make a stand.

A map hex is 550 yards across. Each unit represents a 100 men and each turn represents one week. The game lasts from Oct 1 to Jan 15. Leaders represent a single person, while AFVs represent 5 five tanks. Artillery units represent one battery of 4-6 guns.

183162.name: Don't Look Now - The Extra Bits (Apr 2005)
183162.description:
From the issue:

The following text contains a number of sections from [rpgarticle=24846], the scenario we published in Warpstone issue 23. They were cut for reasons of space but we think they are still worth publishing for those GMs who wish to include.

User summary:

This additional material was released in a 3-page PDF that was available for free download.

183164.name: Playing With Fire
183164.description:
A scenario for WFRP

From the introduction:

Playing with Fire is a WFRP adventure designed for player characters in their first career. GMs who have more experienced players may want to modify the scenario to make it more challenging for their players. The events of this scenario take place in Ostland town of Wolfenburg and the nearby areas of the Middle Mountains and Forest of Shadows.

183165.name: The Drowning Well
183165.description:
A scenario for WFRP
Supplemental maps and players handouts were provided in a separate ZIP archive containing five images.

From the introduction:

This adventure is designed to be played when the PCs are travelling between two cities or towns in the Southern Empire. During their stay in town, let them hear rumours of a number of violent murders taking place across the city. This adventure starts after the capture of the psychotic criminal, Otto Mercads, with the PCs being hired to escort him; however, you could easily involve them in his capture.

183166.name: Giant Slayers
183166.description:
A scenario for WFRP

From the introduction:

There are not many applicants for the post of 'Giant slayer' yet none in fact! ... [The Mayor] will confirm [the characters] are the only applicants so far and give them directions to an old mine. Later that day while planning the hunt, [the characters] are approached by [a man] who says that he'd like to join in the hunt if they will have him, splitting the reward fairly.

183167.name: I Hired a Contract Killer
183167.description:
A scenario for WFRP

From the introduction:

Henri Murzeau is a Bretonnian exile living in the Empire. He has worked as an Imperial excise man for fifteen years, but a visiting dignitary objected to a foreigner working for the Emperor and he was fired. Henri had dedicated his life to the job and all he was left with was some savings. He had no family of friends. Henri decided to end his life, but he lacked the courage to do so. Instead he hired a local criminal group to do the job for him.

183168.name: Return to Grovod Forest
183168.description:
A convention scenario for WFRP

From the introduction:

Humfried Grünfeld had long been a member of the Wizards' & Alchemists' Guild in Middenheim in good standing for over 25 years. His career as an alchemist was steady, but not remarkable in any way. Age, however, was becoming a big concern with pain in his joints, poor eyesight, and a persistent, bothersome cough. Infirmity was something that Humfried feared and he knew that whatever pension to which he was entitled would be woefully inadequate. The future was dim indeed unless Humfried could find another way, an alchemical means of extending his life...

183169.name: Journey Into Darkness
183169.description:
Part Two of the Saga of the Black Anvil
A scenario for WFRP

From the introduction:
This scenario is the first of two sequels to "The Missing Children of Regensdorf". This first appeared in INVALID OBJECT ID=46902, type=family and then in Corrupting Influence: The Best of Warpstone Volume One.

183170.name: A Lover Lost
183170.description:
A scenario for WFRP

From the introduction:

This is a short adventure for characters in their first careers (and suitable for novice players), although some notes and suggestions are included for more experienced characters and players. The PCs are introduced to the city of Nuln before journeying to a nearby family estate. They have the opportunity to unite two lovers and put an end to the machinations of a powerful Necromancer.

183171.name: Who Was Hans Kotter of Essendorf? (1E)
183171.description:
A convention scenario for WFRP1
Character nameplates for convention play were provided in a separate 3-page PDF document.

From the introduction:

Seventy years ago two brothers, Hans and Seigfried von Kreiglitz, the youngest sons of an impoverished aristocrat from Ostland, began trading timber through Schoppendorf.The business became successful and they began to transport numerous goods to and fromthe east of theEmpire. In time, Seigfriedmarried and had children, who were brought up in the business, learning the trade. However, Hans grew unhappy that Seigfried was dominating the company and challenged him. Hans was never seen again.

boardgamecompilation: Crabs Adjust Humidity: Omniclaw Edition (unofficial expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
183172.description:
From the publisher:

Volume Five of the unofficial 3rd-party expansion to the hit party game Cards Against Humanity.

When we first created Crabs Adjust Humidity, they said we were crazy. "Doomed."

I like to think we weren't, at first. But it's too late now, for us. Far too late. All we can do now is complete the ritual, and hope that when the Old Ones come, they pass up our shrunken, withered husks in favor of more... succulent meat.

To that end, we bring you Crabs Adjust Humidity: Volume Five. Here's another 112 cards, stuffed to the gills full of blasphemy, vitriol and the foul gibbering of the irredeemably insane.
Includes: 80 white cards, 32 black cards
Professionally printed on linen-finish, casino-quality cards.
100% compatible with Cards Against Humanity.
Custom serialized hologram on every box, so you know you're not getting a counterfeit.
Loves you just the way you are.
Best if used by 07-23-3015.
183172.name: Crabs Adjust Humidity: Volume Five (unofficial expansion for Cards Against Humanity)

183173.name: Who Was Hans Kotter of Essendorf? (2E)
183173.description:
A convention scenario for WFRP2
Character nameplates for convention play were provided in a separate 3-page PDF document.

From the introduction:

Seventy years ago two brothers, Hans and Seigfried von Kreiglitz, the youngest sons of an impoverished aristocrat from Ostland, began trading timber through Schoppendorf.The business became successful and they began to transport numerous goods to and fromthe east of theEmpire. In time, Seigfriedmarried and had children, who were brought up in the business, learning the trade. However, Hans grew unhappy that Seigfried was dominating the company and challenged him. Hans was never seen again.

183174.name: Das Geheimnis der Krähe
183174.description:
Ein inoffizielles Abenteuer für das Warhammer FRP

Aus der Einführung:

Auch dieses Abenteuer beginnt für die Gruppe völlig harmlos und der Ort der Handlung ist diesmal das Empire selbst, also ein Platz, an dem sich die Abenteurer gut auskennen dürften...

183175.name: Tödlicher Sand
183175.description:
Ein Abenteuer für das Warhammer FRP

Aus der Einführung:

Eines schönen Tages, während sich die Abenteurer gerade wieder mal arbeitslos in einer der größeren Städte des Empire aufhalten, hören – oder lesen sie – von einem gut bezahlten Auftrag bei relativ einfacher Tätigkeit.

183176.name: Am Wegesrand...
183176.description:
Aus der Einführung:

100 unliebsame Begegnungen für das Warhammer FRP

183177.name: Die Bestie von Altdorf
183177.description:
Ein Abenteuer für das Warhammer FRP

Aus der Einführung:

Die Abenteurer kommen gerade in Altdorf an, der Hauptstadt des Empire und Sitz des Emperors Karl-Franz...

183178.name: Blutiger Schnee
183178.description:
Ein Abenteuer für das Warhammer FRP

Aus der Einführung:

Die Abenteurer sind gerade in der Nähe der Grey Mountains unterwegs, vielleicht, weil sie gerade wieder einmal etwas in Bretonnia zu erledigen hatten, oder aus sonstigen Gründen (z.B. könnten sie eine Nachricht an einen in einem Bergdorf lebenden Zauberer überbracht haben)!

183179.name: Das Geheimnis von Haderfurt
183179.description:
Ein Abenteuer für das Warhammer FRP

Aus der Einführung:

Eines allzu schönen Tages erhalten die Abenteurer eine Nachricht, dass ihnen eine große Summe Goldes winkt, wenn sie sich unverzüglich bei Adrian-Lazar von Rabenfels einfinden.

183180.name: Das Vermächtnis von Constant Drachenfels
183180.description:
Ein Abenteuer für das Warhammer FRP

Aus der Einführung:

In einer beliebigen Stadt, vorzugsweise jedoch in Marienburg oder Nuln, werden die Abenteurer von einem älteren, gutgekleideten Mann in Begleitung einer gutaussehenden jungen Frau angesprochen. Er stellt sich sogleich mit Adalbert Aulenbacher vor, seines Zeichens Schriftgelehrter und ehemaliger Zauberkundiger aus Altdorf; seine Begleitung ist Theresa Thielenbeck und sein Lehrmädchen.

183181.name: Ein Besuch beim Alchmisten
183181.description: Welcher Spielleiter (und auch Spieler) kennt bei diesem System nicht das leidige Problem, einen magischen Gegenstand zu haben, der weder preislich irgendwie einzuschätzen noch zu identifizieren ist?

183182.name: Im Norden Lauert der Tod
183182.description:
Ein Abenteuer für das Warhammer FRP

Aus der Einführung:

Die Abenteurer werden eines Tages von einem ihnen bekannten Adligen namens Harald von Hovland eingeladen (oder sie lesen auf dem Stadtmarkt einen Anschlag, dass wackere Personen gesucht werden), der sie mit ernster Miene empfängt.

183183.name: Jahrmarkt des Schreckens
183183.description:
Ein Abenteuer für das Warhammer FRP

Aus der Einführung:

Alle Jahre wieder findet in der Stadt Nuln ein großer Jahrmarkt statt, der seinesgleichen im gesamten Empire sucht!

Er entwickelte sich im Laufe der Jahrzehnte von einem kleinen Stadtmarkt zu dem Ereignis, das er heute für die – nur wenig Abwechslung gewohnten – Einwohner dieser Stadt und auch vieler anderer, extra hierfür angereister Besucher, darstellt.

183184.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 222 - 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
Rustlers of the Night: Giant Fly
183184.description:
"Saturday Morning Hacktoons"
Cover by the Fraim Brothers

183186.name: Appalachian Trail Game: Special Edition
183186.description:
Create your own adventure on the Appalachian Trail as you hike your way along the nearly 2,200 mile footpath from Georgia to Maine. Prepare for your own WALK IN THE WOODS with this fun new game! GEAR, CHANCE, and CHALLENGE Cards define your journey.

GEAR - Be prepared and learn to use the essential items during the game when faced with emergency scenarios.

CHANCE - Encounter opportunities to race ahead, hazards that slow your pace, or choose to stop and enjoy the trail.

CHALLENGE - Play and learn about hiking first aid, LEAVE NO TRACE camping and backpacking skills, Plant and Animal I.D., and Trail History.

Chance and GEAR Cards interact during the game. When faced with an emergency, if you are carrying the proper equipment, then you can continue your hike. Collect points as you correctly answer questions, identify plants and animals, and use the gear in your pack to help navigate through perilous situations that arise! The game ends when the first player completes a Thru Hike--arriving at either Katahdin or Springer Mountain. All players then tally the points from their Trail Journal cards and the player with the most points is the Winner!

This game is a fun and engaging way to prepare new hikers (kids scouts, students) for a their next adventure! It is also great for seasoned adult hikers to reminisce and test their knowledge! (Did I hear "alternate rules" with adult beverages?) It is also perfect for COUCH POTATOES because it lets them hike the AT from the comfort and safety of their living room! (One of the game pieces is a sofa!)

183187.name: Grow Fairy Kingdoms
183187.description:
Grow Fairy Kingdoms is a Competitive Plant-Growing Game for 3-6
players, ages 6-and-up.

Each player starts with a Base on which to grow their plant.

There are two phases: the Day when each player chooses tiles to grow their plant, and the Night, when each Thorn on your plant is a chance to prune your rivals.

There are four main types of tiles: Stems which cause the plant to branch, Flowers for victory points, Thorns for night-attacks, and Leaves for shielding against attacks.

Rare tiles include powerful gold Flowers, Thorns, and Leaves, as well as tiles to place on opponent plants: Caterpillars (to eat opponent tiles) and Rot (to prevent growth).

In the Night phase, Thorns allow players to roll six-sided die to target the ends of rival plants.

The game ends when at least one player survives a night with at least 5 victory points.

Game comes with 98 tiles and one 6-sided die. No reading required.

183189.name: The Order of the Holy Grail
183189.description:
User Summary

A simple to play level grinding RPG involving automatic battle.

This game includes 12 playable characters that can be swapped in and out of your party of 5, over 1000 items for you discover, equip and sell for gold, and many monsters and traps to encounter on your journey.

Climb the 'Lighthouse of the World' in order to progress, taking on floor after floor of increasingly difficult enemies. Play for five minutes, or play for hours - this is a lightweight yet addictive RPG romp!

183190.name: Automatic RPG
183190.description:
User Summary

Automatic RPG is the RPG where you can let your Heroes do their own thing. Why? Well, because in this game, Heroes level up and earn EXP all by themselves! All you have to do is spurn them along from time to time and watch them grow into full-fledged Heroes!

- Story Outline -
Chronic depression, unstable government and extreme weather.
Rising prices and unemployment. You even ruined the morning’s sunny-side up, and got turned down by the girl you like. All of this the evil doings of the Demon King.

The King, realizing the Demon King’s evil handiwork, ordered the
legendary Hero to defeat him once and for all.

Key Points:
● No need to constantly guide your party. Just watch as they fight all by themselves.
● You’ll get EXP even when not playing the game, so your team will get much stronger just by playing a little each day!
● Gameplay hotter than you’d expect with over 70 different items!
● A lukewarm story of a Hero and his allies!

Automatic RPG is a time-killing, clicker-style game.

This game is completely free.

183193.description:
From the publisher:

Gallina City is an interactive and exciting family game. Become the boss of the farmyard by finding the identical images as fast as possible.
Be precise with your descriptions and pay attention to the other players’ descriptions. Otherwise you might lose some feathers!

In Gallina City you try to get rid of your cards as fast as possible in three rounds (with progressively increasing hand size at the beginning of them). Cards are composed of four poultry scenes, with slight variations between the quite similar scenes found in different cards.

For achieving this goal every player describes the scenes in their cards at the same time as other players do. In this pandemonium of people talking about chickens, you try to discover who has in her card exactly the same scene as in one of yours. If you are right, each of you discard your card and are one step closer to victory.
If the other players show you that the pictures are not *exactly* the same, both of you get penalized and take another card from the deck.

The round ends when one or more players have exactly two cards left in hand. The rest of the players earn as many negative points as their hand size at that spot.

After three rounds the player with less negative points win.

Gallina City includes rules for a team version.
183193.name: Gallina City

183194.name: Tieren auf der Spur
183194.description:
From the back of the box:

Looking for an animal! - Who is the first to track down the trail?
We only now it is a predator, living in the jungle, more than 2m long and has sharp claws ...

Sixty yes/no Questions, found on the gameboard, give useful hints to find the animal. Smart combining the questions, which are marked green for correct and red for incorrect, gives you great chances to win the animal card.

183195.name: Avenging Angel
183195.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Avenging Angel is at its core an "interactive story" set in an imaginary world, but the exploration, experiencing, and participating happens through time tested and familiar FPS dynamics. The story takes place on Planet Earth, in a steampunk setting, roughly 10000 years from our current day and age, where 21st Century has not only passed from history to legend, but also from legend into myth.

Source: The Game Website.

183196.name: Grave Prosperity: Redux part 1
183196.description:
Grave Prosperity: Redux follows Amber Ridge as she finds herself broken down on a mountain road. Without any reception and no signs of passer-byers, she is forced to walk to the nearest town- Prosperity. A place that knows no God and exists only to make you suffer.

Source: The Game Website.

183197.description:
In Serengeti: A Race For Life, two players compete in the African Savannah, in a last ditch attempt to preserve the ecosystem and ensure there is a future for its wildlife.

Remember that keeping a close eye on all species, big and small, is your primary mission. Beware of scorpions that may very well thwart your plans if left unchecked however!

Serengeti is played over a variable number of turns during which players will track animals, providing them with unique ways to deal with the various threats in the game as well as helping them efficiently manage their resources.

At the end of the game, victory points will be awarded depending on the players' deck content as well as majority in the Savannah. The competition track may also tilt the outcome in favour of the player who best achieved to stay one (or more) step ahead of his opponent!
183197.name: Serengeti: A Race For Life

183198.name: EUROPA à la Carte
183198.description:
The Players travel around in Europe and try to get as much Gourmet Awarts as possible.
The player change their role while the Play from dishwasher to Gourmet and back to porters.
Only some roles allow the player to try to get a Gourmet Award.
The Player who has most awards at the end of the game wins.
The game is dice driven (4 travel dice an 1 Hotel die)

183199.name: Dora ABC-Pilot
183199.description:
Dora the Explorer travels to her friends.
By travelling the kids learn to write the letters of the alphabeth.
There are 13 cards for the 26 letters. On each letter there are ways where the players figure have to move to the friends of Dora (also on the letter) Which way they have to go is written on the card. There are chips which show each a friend. Finding the right chip allow to move.

183200.name: Aggressivität Partnerschaft-Spielserie
183200.description:
With this game the player's reaction on aggressive utterance of the other players is rated.

1 player gives the instruction and makes the Rating (-3 to 3 points for each reaction)

Each player gets 20 of the 120 cards. On a player's turn, another player chooses 1 of his cards and attacks the active player with the aggressive sentence on the Card. The player has to react in 5 seconds. The more positive he reacts (open for further discussions) the more Points he will get from the moderator.

Whoever has the highest positive sum of points after 20 rounds, wins the game.

Note: Although a player count of 8 and a card count of 120 doesn't seem to make sense (8 people would need 160 cards), the player range of 4-8 is given in the rules. No rule change for 7-8 players seems to have been provided.

183201.name: Blade Maneuver Cards
183201.description:
Publisher's description:

Tired of flipping back and forth through your copy of Blade of the Iron Throne to reference the game's combat Maneuvers?

This teaching deck provides convenient access to them all - simply select the card you need, and read!

Each one includes the Maneuver’s practical details as well as its core rules page number for quick further reference. Additionally, every deck ships with 3 extra blank cards to easily add your own home-brewed Maneuvers to the mix.

183202.name: Remy
183202.description:
The player who has first moved all his 4 Pins over the board wins.

The game board is a 6x8 Chess field.

This game is a mixture between Pachesi and Chess.

Players roll a die. With 6 the Player has to place a pin on the first row of the plan.

The figures move like the figures in Chess. Which Chess figure they are at the moment is shown in a little hole in the field where the figure stands. There is a board below the fields. This can be moved in the positions 1-6. Each position changes the chess values for all fields. The rolled die shows on which position this board is moved.

All chess figures of a player on the board are moved in each turn.

The player has to throw out an opponent figure if possible.

183203.name: Mecha Mice
183203.description:
On the island of Searbay mousekind has reached levels of technology undreamed of, but the thousand enemies that have always existed and always will are still just beyond the wall. With the invention of the Mecha Suit mousedom has a chance to survive, and the tools to hold back the darkness of dissolution and barbarism.

Join the Corp, become the Paw.

Mecha Mice is a story telling game of heroic mice armed with the latest technology fighting a thousand enemies a thousand times larger than themselves.

Publisher Blurb

183205.name: Mungo
183205.description:
The game board shows 4 trees which grow from the center to all 4 edges.

Each leaf of the trees is one field where the figures can move.

There are some spaces between the leaves, where the figures have to move around. The figures can even move from branch to branch or from tree to tree if the leaves are neighbored.

At the beginning of the game places his 8 colored stones on different leaves (2 on each turn until all are placed)

If a Player can jump over an own stone he lines it with other own stoned (jumped over in previous rounds) to a line (namesd snake).
If all own stones (which are on the board) are lined, the player moves his snake instead of his pawn.

If he reaches one of the start fields with his snake he can place the Stones of his snake on the nest fields, in the middle of the board. Fields have to be free.

The number of fields the player is allowed to move his pawn or snake is driffen by an additional figure, the Mungo.

The Mungo is moving on the top line of leaves of the trees (at the edge of the board). The number of leaves the branch where the Mungo is, is the number the Player can move. Additional the length of his snake (number of stones) enhances accordingly the movement number.
The Mungo is moved the doubled number of the calculted movement number.

There are additonal rules for removing and adding stones from the board.

Game ends when all fields in the middle (between the trees)are filled with stones. The player with the majority of stones in the middle wins.

183207.name: ... ist doch logisch !
183207.description:
Mathematic think and logic game.

Each player gets the same set of numbers (1 and 2 digits). He shuffles them and takes new that he has again 12 numbers on his hand each round. The player adds 3 stones to his Hand if he cannot do anything on his turn.

The game board shows places for the numbers and the 4 base calculations between them.

Additionally there are rows of number fields, where the player can place series of numbers with always the same difference.

On players turn he can place whole valid calculation, or a part of a series of 3 or more numbers (with the same difference).

A third possibility is to continue a series. The actual player places as much as he can.

If something is wrong, he gets the numbers back and the next player has his turn.

The game ends after the round when the first player has placed all his numbers. The player without Stones wins. If more than 1 has finished the one with the less number of used special marked field wins.

183209.name: ISNOGUD Endlich Kalif ?!
183209.description:
The game theme is based on the comics of Isnogud who always tries to become caliph instead of the actual caliph Harun al Pussah.

The game is about jewels. Isnogud tries to hold four different colors of them to win.

At the beginning Tunichgud (Assistent of Isnogud) has 1 of each 4 colors and Isnogud has 4 from each color.

On a player's turn he rolls the die and moves his 1 figure clockwise or anticlockwise on the track.

If the color of the field is equal with the 1 of the stone Colors the player gets one of this from Isnogud.

If the players have all 5 stones of 1 color they win.

If the Color of the field is black, one of the 12 cards is opened. They show 8 times Isnogud and 4 times the caliph.

If the card shows the fourth caliph the players win if it shows the sixth Isnogud the players lose.

183211.name: Pegasus II
183211.description:
User Summary
Pilot your ship the "Pegasus II" across alien planets bombing installations and shooting down missiles. Fly through tunnels and watch out for flying birds, saucers and dragons. Make it off the planet and refuel your ship for another wave.

A terrain generator lets you make your own planets to fly over.

183212.description:
Note: These games come together in one box, and have shared components. The smaller maps for 18MS and 18GA are both on the back of the big map for 18Dixie.

18Dixie is an 18xx game set in the Southeast region of the United States. Players invest in railroad companies in an effort to have the greatest net worth at the end of the game. This is determined by adding the cash holdings of the players to the value of the stocks each owns. The money in the actual companies, though, are separate from the individual player's money. During the game, there are alternating stock rounds, where players buy and sell stock in the various railroad companies, and operating rounds, where the various companies operate. When operating, the companies lay tracks, place stations, and buy and run trains.

18MS is an 18xx game set in Mississippi and Alabama, together with portions of adjoining states. Players invest in railroad companies in an effort to have the greatest net worth at the end of the game. This is determined by adding the cash holdings of the players to the value of the stocks each owns. The game consists of five Stock Rounds, where players buy and sell stock in the various companies, each of which is followed by two Operating Rounds, where the various companies operate by laying tracks, placing stations, and buying and running trains.

18MS is a separate mini game using some of the components from 18Dixie together with some additional components specific to 18MS. 18MS aims to be a smaller, shorter game that may be useful for teaching the 18xx system to newer players.
183212.name: 18Dixie with 18MS and 18GA
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 47 – Wildcatters
Heavy Cardboard Episode 37 – All the games!

183213.name: Savage Insider Deluxe (Issue 1 - May 2013)
rpgissuearticle: The Secret of Isla de Monos
183213.description:
From Publisher's Blurb:

Savage Insider Premium contained a wealth of Savage Worlds content spanning the genres with much of it useful across multiple settings. During the course of publishing the five issues, a lot of content was extracted and released as standalone products for specific settings, such as Mercenary Breed and Faith & Demons: The Rising. This resulted in a lot of duplicated content.

To remedy this, Mystical Throne Entertainment has decided to compile all non-extracted content from Savage Insider Premium Issues #1 - 5 into a single offering. Thus, we bring to you the first Savage Insider Deluxe issue, filled with the remaining compiled content from Savage Insider Premium Issues #1 - 5 in a single release. The content herein is primarily setting agnostic and can be utilized across multiple settings or within your own homebrew.

Savage Insider Deluxe Issue #1: Modularity contains a wealth of content covering fantasy, sci-fi, and horror. The modular design of Savage Worlds means you can add new mechanics, ignore existing ones, or modify ones to your liking without breaking the system. We embrace this concept in all of our Savage Insider releases and especially exploit that herein.

Savage Insider Deluxe Issue #1: Modularity includes:

Auspicious Archetypes:

Cataphract - A shock trooper archetype great for breaking shield walls
Engineer - When you need a smith or mechanic, look toward your engineer.
Hierophant - As cultic priests, hierophants are knowledged in the ways of the occult.

Expanded Mechanics:

Voidlancer - A new look at ship-to-ship space combat with an emphasis on cinematic.

Great Adventures:

Community Service - A dark fantasy delve into an abandoned underground temple for Ancient World.
Flight of the Fancy - A black powder fantasy adventure with a peek at Dragons of Avalon.
Seven Kings of Shambhala - A pulp action adventure into the depths of the Hollow Earth.
The Secret of Isla de Monos - A pirate adventure out to an island of secrets.

Racial Profiling:

Dhampir - Rule the night with this half-vampire race.
The Lokka - Deceive the masses using this shapeshifting race.

Random Encounters:

Ritual Room – Find out what secrets are held in this single ritual room.
The Ossuary – Can you handle the horrors that dwell in the ossuary?

Surveyed:

Lord Bane - Enter the domain of Lord Bane and all its chaos.
Underhome - Careful of this village and its secrets.

183214.name: Savage Insider (Volume 3, Issue 1 - Spring 2015)
183214.description:
From the Publisher's Blurb:

We're passionate about Savage Worlds and want to share that with you. The theme is Endings and Beginnings, which it is threaded throughout all the pieces and covers a range of genres.

What's in It for You

Two Discounts Off Maps by Middle Kingdom Exploration & Trading Co.
Recent Releases - From January to March.
Upcoming Releases - Works in the works.
Designer’s Diary - Sean Patrick Fannon talks about Evil Beagle Games’ Shaintar: Legends Unleashed.
Game Prep: Concept by Interlude - Finding out who the character is before deciding what they can do!
Game Prep: The End is Nigh! Or Is It? - Tips for handling bringing a campaign to its close.
Esoteric Orders: An Abundance of Gods - Shinto inspirations for any genre. with NPCs, powers, and setting sketches.
Equipment Corral - Two pieces for your collection at both ends of the spectrum: one to bring death and one to bring life.
Character Gallery: Three Masters of Action - After the lives they knew ended, all transform to take on anything thrown their way..
Mechanics Wise: Back from the Dead - Unconventional options for handling character death.
Expanded Mechanics: The More You Know - Getting more out of language and knowledge skills.
Stories to Inspire: The Past and the Future - When a deserter becomes a vigilante, there’s a fine line between criminal and hero.
Surveyed: The Pride of Thalsen - A small, but influential village faces the theft of a treasured artifact. A great place to start a campaign.
Great Adventures: The World Trembles - A campaign-ending adventure for Legendary Ranks. Can they defeat Ashur and all the aliens brought with it, or will their fantasy world die?
Great Adventures: Escape from the Apocalypse Myceleon, Destroyer and Devourer - On the edge of Unknown Space, an immense, alien being seeks to make a meal out of a planet.
Convention Connection - April to July

With this issue, we introduce "stretch goals" to unlock free content between issues! Simple tasks like sharing Facebook links, tweets, and G+ posts, reviewing the magazine on DriveThruRPG and RPGNow websites, and other quick-to-do items are the key.

Buy it now to use at your next game and to find out all the details on unlocking the freebies!

183215.name: Word Shark
183215.description:
From the box: "Feed the Sharks! How many words can you make? Use word families to build reading, spelling, and comprehension skills."

Word Shark is an educational board game where players compete to use tiles to build or complete words. It comes with two-sided mats, offering two ways to play.

Side one, the Shark Mat, has five different incomplete words, each with the first letter missing. The letter tiles with consonants are placed in a pile face down. Each player in turn chooses a tile and tries to complete one of the words on his or her mat with the letter. If a word cannot be completed, the tile is returned to the pile face down. The first player to complete all five words wins.

Side two, the Ocean Mat, challenges players to make as many words as possible on their mats. Each player starts by drawing an agreed number of starting red consonant tiles and yellow vowel tiles. Players then work simultaneously to create as many words as possible on their mats. Players may continue to draw or trade tiles from the center pile to continue making words. (The rules do no specify how many tiles can be taken at a time). Players can decide whether to make words individually or in crossword fashion. The winner can be either the player who made the most words or the player who used the most tiles.

183216.name: On A Roll 3D
183216.description:
Our favourite spherical hero is back, only this time in glorious 3D! Can you navigate through 24 huge levels across 6 different themes? Be prepared to take on all the platformer classics: spikes, mines, dynamite, conveyor belts, springs, switches, doors, bumpers, lasers, saws, fire, ice, water, electricity and trapdoors, not to mention a host of enemies and bosses!

Source: The Developer Website.

183217.name: Paper Airplane Flying Game
183217.description:
Paper Airplane Flying Game is a dexterity game where players fold paper airplanes and then fly them toward a board representing a landing strip, trying to land them in the highest point value areas. The highest point value areas are both smaller and further away, making it harder to score higher point values.

Description from the package: "First, fold your paper airplanes following the instructions. Next, stand 2-3 paces from the front of the game board. Throw a plane and try to land it on the runway, aiming for the highest points. Let each player take a few practice turns. Then, throw one plane per turn. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins!"

Players may decide on their own how many turns to play and how to score plane points (i.e. exactly where the plane must land and how it must be placed to score points for section it lands in.)

183218.name: Curious George Adventures Pop-Up Candy Game
183218.description:
In Curious George Adventures Pop-Up Candy Game, players compete to be the first to reach the Man in the Yellow Hat while collecting as much candy as possible along the way.

The game comes with packages of Rascals candy, which are placed in the candy circle on the board. Players choose a game piece and place it on the start square. They take turns rolling a die marked with various fruits, then move their piece to the next matching fruit on the track. Along the way, players may land on spaces that cause them to move forward or backward or lose or gain candy. Some spaces have pop-open doors which have hidden instructions inside. The first player to reach the end of the track wins and gets to eat all his earned candy. Other players must return their candy to the candy circle and go hungry.

183219.name: Apple Addition
183219.description:
From the box: "Practice number recognition and basic addition with this fun apple-picking game."

In Apple Addition, each player uses a two-sided card shaped like an apple tree. There are two way to play.

Level 1 - Pick & Match Apples: Each player takes an apple tree card showing several numbers. Players then take turns randomly choosing an apple marker from the box. Each marker shows a number of apple seeds. The player must correctly count the seeds and then, if it matches a number on their card, place it over the number. The marker is then flipped. If the player counted correctly and the number matches, the marker stays on the card. If the number does not match one on the player's card or the player counts wrong, the marker goes back in the box. If the player draws an apple with a worm, he or she must put an apple from his tree back on the box. An apple core causes loss of a turn. First player to cover all the numbers on his or her tree wins.

Level 2 - Apple Addition: Each tree displays three addition problems. The game is played by the same rules. The first player to find the answers to all three math problems wins.

183220.name: Ninja Game
183220.description:
The object of the game is to survive your journey and enter the palace. Along the way you are challenged by masters of ancient oriental weapons, pick and pass cards and spaces you land on. Also you are confronted by with the pit, which is the house of Dim Mak, and by the March, which is guarded by the fearful dragon.
You are competing with palace ninja all along the way. Each player can attack or challenge opposing players during his journey. Combative point tokens are exchanged. Spinning shuriken wheel is used to advance each players ninja.

183221.name: Savage Insider (Volume 3, Issue 2 - Summer 2015)
183221.description:
From Publisher's blurb:

We're passionate about Savage Worlds and want to share that with you. The theme is Uprising, which it is threaded throughout all the pieces and covers a range of genres.

What's in It for You

Limited-Time Offers from Pinnacle Entertainment Group ($5 off!) and Obatron Productions (20% off!).
Recent Releases from April to June.
Upcoming Releases showing off works in the works.
Designer’s Diary & Product Spotlight where Jim Davenport talks about Savage Characters, Volume 1.
Game Prep articles by Sean Tait Bircher of Wine and Savages and debuting SI author, Garrett Crow.
Great Adventures by returning author, Zach Welhouse, and an unofficial Deadlands adventure by Owen Lean.
Equipment Corral with two pieces to gain the advantage in an uprising.
Mechanics Wise by once-again author Tanya Beeson.
Expanded Mechanics by Jerrod "Savage Daddy" Gunning.
Stories to Inspire by Rachel Rutledge.
Random Encounters featuring DramaScapes's Med Bay map.
Convention Connection links you to worldwide conventions.

Buy it now to use at your next game and unlock between issue freebies earned by sales, reviews, newsletter sign-ups, and social media shares!

183222.name: A City Sleeps
183222.description:
A City Sleeps follows Poe, youngest member of The Silk, an ancient clan of dream exorcists that can enter the minds of sleeping hosts to rid their dreams of demons. When the residents of SanLo fall into an endless slumber, only Poe can rescue them from a never-ending nightmare. Equipped with her legendary Koto-sword “Heartstrings”, and flanked by her stable of powerful ghost familiars, she must cleanse their dreams, and uncover the city’s dark secrets.

Driven by an unforgettable original soundtrack that builds through player actions and enemy engagement, A City Sleeps infuses classic twin-stick hardcore shoot ‘em up sensibilities with moment-to-moment tactical choices.

Source: The Developer Website.

183223.name: Say What?
183223.description:
Similar to Celebrities, Say What? is played in three rounds.

Say What? contains dice, a minute glass and 160 cards with four things on each card.

Before each round each team rolls a die to decide whether they have to describe celebrities, characters, works of fiction or things. They then have one minute to describe as many as possible.

In the first round, you can say anything except any part of what's on the card!

In the second round, you can only say one word!

In the third round, you can only use charades!

183224.name: Zombie Brawlerz
183224.description:
Are you brave enough to enter the Brawlzone and start Brawlin' with your 'Rookie Deck'? The fast-paced card game, packed full of mini zombies all with attitude. Power-up your zombies and become unstoppable, use your Rare & Super Rare zombie cards to be UNBEATABLE! Pick-up and Play - Play Anywhere - There's always a chance to win. 50/50 Play:The Rookie Deck has been designed so it can be split equally between two players, so each player can use 20 Zombie Cards and 5 Add-on Cards. Using 50/50 play means that if your friend, Brother or Sister doesn't have a deck or has forgotten theirs, they can still play this great Zombie card game! Simple and easy game-play makes Zombie Brawlerz great fun straight out of the box.

Zombie Brawlerz is a top trumps mechanic game with strategy cards that alter the dynamics of each round, with incredible cartoon style zombie artwork.

183225.name: SCHAR: Blue Shield Alliance
183225.description:
In the future mankind stretches out across the galaxy utilizing new technology based on dark matter – humans were finally able to discover new worlds and colonize the universe. It was the search for new life that drove this exploration more than anything else, but after hundreds of years it appeared we were alone.

Suddenly that all changed. Without warning our colonies were attacked. An alien force, known as the Constituents of Nothing appeared out of nowhere systematically wiping out our colonized worlds. These aliens were unlike anything we’ve ever seen – they harnessed the same dark matter to power themselves and their civilization. Our weapons were useless against this new threat.

Soon we discovered pieces of the alien’s destroyed technology could help us create an Anti-Dark Matter particle. This Blue-Energy, named for the color it glowed, stopped the aliens in their tracks. Now mankind must band together, to form an alliance and push back the CoN invasion. We must protect our colonies using Blue-Energy shield generators. Otherwise we face certain extinction.

Source: The Game Website.

183226.name: Paper Doll Game
183226.description:
A poem on the box describes the game: "A Thoughtful Girl must dress with care. / What goes with what? What shall you wear? / The spinner says to pick some shoes. / But only YOU know which you'll choose. / And with your clothing you'll select / the hobby that you most respect. / Pursue your vision with a passion-- / There's more to life than only fashion! / The first one dressed and on her way / has won the game. / Do you want to play?"

Each player chooses a paper doll and take turns spinning the spinner. The spinner will tell them which piece of clothing or accessory to add to their doll. One space on the spinner requires the spinner to lose a piece. The first player to completely dress and equip his or her doll wins.

The game is notable for its diverse paper doll characters, multi-ethnic outfits and selection of hobbies that is less stereotypically girly, such as astronomy, guitar and science.

183227.name: I Remember: A Matching Game
183227.description:
I Remember: a Matching Game is part of the Crayola Games line. It is a new twist on the classic game Memory. Like Memory, a collection of tiles is placed face-down. In I Remember, a spinner is added and tiles are assigned to one of four categories (food, animals, toys or transportation). The game can be played at three levels. Level one is played with only one category of tiles, reducing the number to make matching easier. Game play is identical to Memory--players turn over two tiles trying to find a match. If the tiles match, the player keeps them. If not, they are replaced in the same positions and the next player plays. When all tiles have been claimed, the player with the most tiles wins.

In level two, players spin the spinner to determine which of four categories they must match. The current player then turns over a single tile. If it matches the category spun, the player keeps the tile. If not, it is replaced in its original position. The next player then attempts to match the same category. Once a match is made, the next player spins to determine the new category and play continues. When all tiles have been claimed, the player with the most tiles wins.

Level three is played in a similar way to level two, except after spinning players must find two tiles with matching pictures in the category spun.

183228.description: Spin Doctor: The Card game of Dirty Politics is a card game for 2 to 6 (or more) players wherein the players take on the role of candidates running for President of the United States. During the course of the game, players will accumulate votes by collecting state cards while at the same time thwarting their opponent’s ability to do the same by putting them in scandal, winning debates, being underhanded and generally behaving like a mud slinging politician!
183228.name: Spin Doctor: The Card game of Dirty Politics

183230.name: Family Happenings
183230.description:
Family Happenings is a roll-and-move game designed to be used as a tool for stimulating discussions during therapy sessions with children. The rules note that it "should only be used by a trained professional."

In the game, players roll a die to move pawns on a track. As they move, they land on various types of spaces. On Feeling Card spaces, the player must draw a card with a feeling printed on it and describe a time when he or she experienced that feeling. On a Do A Stunt space, the player draws a card and performs the action printed on it. On a Mail space, a card with the start of the first sentence of a letter written to a friend or family member is drawn. The player must complete the sentence. On a Family Happenings space, the player draws a card with a question that refers to a family problem that the child may have experienced (cards are marked with categories so the therapist can customize the deck to his clients). The player must answer the question. Roll 'n Go squares occur at junctions in the path and allow the player to roll again and move in a direction determined by their roll. Sent To Your Room squared require the player to go to their "room," a space marked with their pawn's color. They must then answer the question in their room before rolling to leave the room on their next turn. On a Spin space, the player spins a spinner and may gain or lose a turn or gain or lose chips depending on the roll. At the end of each player's turn, he or she receives one chip as allowance.

Players attempt to reach the end of the track, which if the peak of the roof on the house-shaped track. The game may end in one of two ways. The first player to reach the peak of the house can be declared the winner, or a time limit can be imposed, with the player holding the most chips when time runs out winning. In this version, reaching the finish space brings a bonus of five chips, after which the player may continue to move on the track.

183231.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Adventure Land, King Agamis rules from his castle. Rich cities, vast forests and rugged mountain ranges dominate the country. The large river is known to be lined with gold and the forests filled with medicinal herbs, but dangers lurk beneath the fog! Only the bravest adventurers dare to face the challenges. When you move your adventurer tactically and bravely fight the fog creatures, you'll win the favor of the king. Illustrated by Franz Vohwinkel and designed by acclaimed duo Wolfgang Kramer and Michael Kiesling who between them have won the highly coveted Spiel des Jahres award 5 times.

There are three different adventure scenarios to choose from, depending on the age/skill of the players:
-Adventure 1 (The Fellowship ) the simplest of the three adventures
-Adventure 2 (The Magnificent) a little more challenging
-Adventure 3 (Escape to the Cities) the most challenging because there are many things to pay attention to simultaneously
183231.name: Adventure Land
boardgamepodcastepisode: 6. Devon Dice podcast, The Castles of Burgundy review
Episode 14 - Pack O Games & Gordon Calleja
Episode 51 - Adventure Land
Essen 2015 - HABA
HLG 13: Terugblik op 2016
HLG 6: Samen
HLG-EXTRA 2: Ducosim Jubileumbeurs 2016
HLG-EXTRA 5: Spellenspektakel 2016
MOBG podcast 39 This is the Real Deal, Part 2 of Spiel Essen
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 44!!! The EPIC Week!!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 77!

183232.name: Cards & Punishment: Vol. 1 (unofficial expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
183232.description:
Cards And Punishment is an unofficial, unauthorized, underground, black market expansion pack for the most excellent party game, Cards Against Humanity (TM).

This deck includes 35 black cards and 80 white cards.

183233.name: Rummikub Kids Edition
183233.description: A simplified variation on the classic Rummikub game of playing numbered tiles in sets and runs. Features 10 numbered tiles per suit rather than 13. It can be played at three levels of complexity: beginner, allowing runs or sets of two or more tiles with no jokers; intermediate, adding the jokers; and advanced, requiring sets and runs of at least three tiles as in regular Rummikub.

183234.name: What Do You See? Colors
183234.description:
In What Do You See? Colors, players choose face-down cards, trying to be the first to complete a set and win the game. There are three different ways to play.


Search and Match Colors - Each player takes a card marked with a colored star designating which color he or she will collect. Picture cards are placed face-up in the center of the table. Each player in turn takes a card to match their color. If the color matches, the player keeps the card. If not, he or she must put it back. Play continues until all players have six matched color cards. This game is for very young players, and is meant to teach color recognition.



Seven That Match - This game is played similarly to Search and Match Colors. In this version, each player has two color cards to match. Cards are placed face down. Players pick one card at a time and try to match it to one of their cards. If it matches, the player keeps the card. If not, it goes back to the center face down. The first player to collect six cards matching the color of one of his or her star cards wins.



What Color Do You See? - In this version, each player has a game board with spaces for eight different colors. All cards are placed face-down on the table. Players take turns choosing a face-down card. If the player doesn't yet have the color, he or she covers the corresponding space on his or her card. If he or she does have the color, the card goes back face down. In this version, there are also wild cards, which can be placed on any color. The first player to cover all colors on the card wins the game.

183235.description:
It’s a fur-flying frenzy for the late Olga’s cash!

For weeks, the nation has been captivated by the competition to win the fortune of the late Olga. The rules are simple, the one who takes care of all the cats wins. But contestants are running out of patience as their opponents resort to tossing cats and outright sabotage. There’s only a handful of contenders left, will you be the last caretaker standing?
