Feline Fortunes is a card game for 2-4 players that plays in 20-30 minutes. In the game you’ll need to manage the cats in your Lap, defending yourself and attacking others. If you run out of Patience, you’re out of the game, and the last player to keep their wits is the winner.
COLLECT CATS
Gather Olga’s cats into your Lap and show the world you’re the best caretaker. Gather 3 or more and you’ll get back some of your precious Patience as they purr.

TOSS CATS
If a cat falls off your Lap, you can toss it at an opponent to wreak havoc with their play space. You don’t win the cash by playing nice, after all.

UNIQUE CATS
Cats can push each other, fight with one another, launch other cats and even copy each other’s abilities. With more than 60 cat cards, who knows what will pounce into your Lap next.

STRATEGIC CATS
All information is open in Feline Fortunes, so you always know what you’re opponents are capable of. But a single move can dramatically affect the entire game, so don’t get too comfortable, buddy.
183235.name: Feline Fortunes

183236.name: Riana Rouge
183236.description:
Riana Rouge is a 1997 adult action-adventure game developed and published by Black Dragon Productions. It is one of the few titles that have earned an "Adults Only" rating from the ESRB.

Plot

The game stars Playboy Playmate Gillian Bonner as Riana, a shy secretary who spies on her boss attempting to rape a coworker. She enters the office and tries to help her, but, she is overpowered by her boss and thrown out of the window. Somehow, she is transported to another world where she is a seductive warrior who must rescue the world from an evil dictator (her boss) and rescue her friend (the coworker).

Source: Wikipedia, "Riana Rouge", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

183237.name: DayTrippers GameMasters Guide
183237.description:
An infinite variety of bizarre experiences await your exploration, from Dream Worlds and Alternate Earths to distant planets in our universe and others. The Daytrippers Gamemasters Guide is a toolkit for creating surreal adventures that take place in these weird worlds and alternate dimensions. Each adventure is designed to last a single session and return the PCs back to earth. Using this toolkit, the GM takes the players into new and wildly divergent realities every session, blurring the line between subjective and objective reality, and cranking up the weirdness to eleven.

The time is shortly after the year 2100, the location is the first world. Massive megacorporations dominate the economic landscape and incredible advances in technology make the most miraculous things possible, from genetic modification to medical nanotechnology and microfusion power generators. But the most earth-shaking development of the 21st century is one we're only beginning to see the ramifications of. As the 22nd century dawns, the inner and outer worlds of SlipSpace are opening up to human exploration, thanks to the development of the amazing vehicles known as SlipShips.

The bold explorers who pilot these vehicles are called DayTrippers, and they face a multiverse of physical and psychological dangers to bring back priceless knowledge and powerful artifacts from far-flung dimensions and times. The setting is inspired by the surrealistic fiction of Moebius, Michael Moorcock, Rudy Rucker, Stanley Weinbaum, Jack Vance and other masters of weirdness.

Written by Tod Foley (designer of Cyberspace, Ghosts in the Machine, and Watch the World Die) the Daytrippers Gamemasters Guide blends modern and traditional gamemastering techniques with the random input of oracular systems and the spontaneously-generative approach of surrealist art. The result is a fast interpretive system with its own skittery mechanics, spitting out psychoactive science fiction narratives.

(from Back Cover)

183242.name: Rebellious Archetypes Volume I
183242.description:
From publisher blurb:

Be a Rebel with a Cause!

Not every evil lurks in deep, dark dungeons far away from innocent townsfolk, waiting patiently for adventurers to kick down their doors and start fighting. Some monsters don't just prey on society from without, but have burrowed and wormed their way into the very heart of the civilized world, and twist and corrupt the very laws that are supposed to protect the innocent, using them to oppress and exploit them, instead. These evils are no less a threat than the ones that most adventurers face, but many PCs are ill-equipped to deal with them. This is a job for rebels.

This book presents five new rebellious archetypes for five different classes. Included are the freedom bomber, an alchemist archetype with an explosive twist on the mutagen, and which specializes in using bombs and demolishing buildings to get his message across, the voice of the revolution, a bard archetype with glorious ideals of a free society, who proves that the pen is mightier than the sword with stirring declarations that can be spread throughout the populace to win their hearts and minds, the street fighter, a brawler archetype who incites widespread violence wherever he goes, and is always looking for a reason to get into a scrap, the minuteman, a gunslinger archetype with a militia background who knows how to strike fast and hard, and disappear before the enemy can regroup, and the face of the revolution, a swashbuckler archetype with a dashing flair and a heroic persona, which allows them to inspire the populace while at the same time avoiding retribution from those they fight.

Whether you're about to embark on a politically-themed campaign (such as the official Paizo adventure path focusing on revolution), or you just want a selection of exciting new abilities for passionate and freedom-loving PCs, this book has lots of tantalizing options to offer. Even GMs can get in on the fun, as several of the archetypes here are perfect for rebellious villains as well, and can make for exciting and memorable encounters.

183243.name: Lighthouse Adventure
183243.description:
The lonely dweller of the lighthouse was sailing back to his lookout packed with food when a huge, all-consuming storm started. The raging waves consumed the ship and its load, too. Luckily, he escaped and pulled through the storm on a lonely rock. Four sailboats set out after him competing with each other to hurry to his aid.

There is six wind strength discs (which mark the steps), that lay face down at one end of the board. First player turns over any of the wind strength discs and takes as many steps as shown on the disc. After everyone has looked at the disc, he turns it back over immediately. There is two rules:

The total number of steps on the disc have to be taken.
You can step forwards or backwards, but only in one direction at a time, you can’t change direction while in motion!




If somebody steps on the field where the guard of the lighthouse got shipwrecked, he has to place guard in the boat and continue the trip with him (since the aim is to reach the goal together with him)! If player placed him in the boat, he has to mix the wind strength discs at once, before the next player’s turn. This makes the game harder, since the discs memorized so far change their places. The goal is still to arrive on the field where the guard or the ship transporting the guard is standing. According to some rules, the guard can change the boat.

The player who first docks at the isle of the lighthouse with the guard sitting in his or her boat, wins.

183244.name: What Killed the Stiner Boy?
183244.description:
From publisher blurb:

3.5 Compatible Adventure for 4 PCs of levels 2-4

After witnessing a young man (the “Stiner Boy”) seccumb to a deadly disease that has been ravaging the town of Estermere, the party is ultimately contracted to solve the mystery of its origin and discover a cure. Although a number of leads and potential side quests present themselves as they explore the town and speak with its inhabitants, the party will eventually stumble upon a ruined church deep in the marsh. In the crypts beneath the church, they will encounter a number of nefarious monsters along with a gang of bandits who are both behind the disease’s occurance, and hold the key to its cure.

In addition to the main quest (and rewards) associated with solving the disease mystery, the party has the opportunity to get involved in the town’s politics by helping an innocent man escape jail, brokering trade relations with the Jademi (Reclusive nomadic clans of Half-Elfs), and making useful contacts with an aspiring spy/assassin guild.

Although this adventure was designed such that it could be placed into virtually any campaign world with minimal modifications, it also serves as the follow-up to DNMM-01 “Bait and Switch” and will lead into future adventures in Mistwick. The politics of the town and many of its inhabitants will become important NPCs and adventure hooks in the future.

This adventure is the second in a new campaign world (Mistwick Marshes) where the spirits of an ancient elvish civilization still roam the muggy swamp and don't take kindly to those who seek to loot their ruins. Settlers on the frontier face constant perils from dangerous monsters, insidious witches, and roaming barbarian gangs.

With this Purchase you get:

An Adventure book (26 pages) that includes:
Complete Stat Blocks for all creatures and GM Reference Maps as close to the description of the encounter as possible.
An optional Dream Interpretation Skill ("Visare") to add a prophetic quality to your game experience along with a random "Visare" generator.
Battlemaps for 2 wilderness encounters, a guard house, and a crypt.
Battlemaps for a brothel and a ruined church

A Map Book (40 pages) that includes:
Ready to Print, scaled (5' = 1") letter sized, multiple page PDFs in color for all combat encounters. No need to mess with printer settings - just print, cut the white margins, and glue/tape together so that the overlapping parts match for a seamless map.

183245.name: Undine!
183245.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Amazing Races PDFs introduce new archetypes, feats, character traits, racial traits, and archetypes for the core, featured, and uncommon races described in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Race Guide. Every PDF contains two full pages of high quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Amazing Races: Undine! includes new racial feats, undine character traits, and alternate racial traits for undine. In addition, this product features a new archetype for undine inquisitors: the Aqueous Avenger!

183246.name: The Book of Unconventional Character Classes
rpg: Dice & Glory: The Ultimate Role-Playing Game
183246.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new Character Codex containing specialist fantasy character classes that are strange and unconventional adding new flair to any Dice & Glory campaign! This book is a great resource for both Players and Game Masters wishing to introduce some eastern flavor into their game! Among those classes that can be found within the new Character Codex’s pages are the Dragon-Blood Warrior, the Leatherneck, the Leopard-man, Skull-Cleavers, Bookworms, High Sages, and Zombie Creepers!

This book contains:

Over 76 Fantasy Specialist Classes with full descriptions of class abilities and level progression tables!
Of these, there are 5 Brick classes, 12 Fighter classes, 11 Adventurer classes, 6 Rogue classes, 9 Psychic classes, 22 mage classes, 6 Clergy classes and 11 NPC classes!
NPC tables which can be applied to NPC's to easily apply specialist class levels!
6 forms of stylized Martial Arts forms!
...Plus information on Specialist Class Variants along with 15 variants.

183247.name: Born to Magic
183247.description:
From publisher blurb:

They're better than you, and they know it. Prideful and majestic unicorns hold their horns up high and strut through life with confidence as they delve into the mysteries of the cosmos on their own terms.

New feats, spells, a prestige class, and lore all designed for doppelganger ponies!

183248.name: The Lunar Library of Thurindisar
183248.description:
From publisher blurb:

A READY TO PLAY ADVENTURE

Need an adventure that’s ready to go? This book provides just that, plus a chance for your party to travel where no adventurer has before.

Alset the Mad is willing to hire you to explore a lost library hidden on the moon. He’ll transport you there and back, and you’ll confront creatures never before seen by man or demi-human. You might even find some new allies or new civilizations along the way.

Here’s what you get for your gold pieces:

a base town and local personalities
new moon monsters
pregenerated player characters (PC’s)
five map images for use with a Virtual Tabletop
five printable large maps (color and black and white)
printable tokens




This adventure can be used with your favorite old school fantasy ruleset, retroclone, or retro-inspired game with little or no modifications. It can also be used with later editions with a little tweaking.

183249.name: The Thin Blue Line: A Detroit Police Story
183249.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Watch your step rookie, or you’ll end up in Corktown.”

Calamity brews in Detroit. Paranormal activity is on the rise. An angry spirit, a dangerous creature, or a pack of desperate cultists hides under every sewer cover and within every abandoned building. The officers of Corktown Precinct are the only thing standing between the city and paranormal onslaught. Corktown has a secret, though. Its crew of supposed washouts are either psychics or have encountered the paranormal. These damaged, over-worked, and under-paid officers must keep paranormal activity in Detroit under wraps and out of sight. No mean feat in a city as old, large, and haunted as Detroit.

Corktown officers face constant threats from mundane crime, paranormal forces, as well as their inner demons and growing madness. Do they have what it takes? Can they stand against the growing threats, or will they be consumed, along with the city they guard?

The Thin Blue Line is a modern horror setting that requires the Savage Worlds Core Rulebook and the Savage Worlds Horror Companion for use.

This is the full setting for The Thin Blue Line - A Detroit Police Story. It includes detailed information on the setting's NPCs, paranormal creatures, adventures and an adventure generator, and cursed items.

183250.name: Cities & Towns
183250.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure at your doorstep!

Inside are 3 fantasy settlements, each with a complete description, index of NPCs, and adventure hooks appropriate for the area. Use them as a town the party encounters along the road, a base of operations, or turn them into something of your own.

Each location comes with high resolution map for your use.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
183251.description:
This is a tile-laying race game with players starting with boards that are identical, and one player drawing tiles that they all will use. They race to get their explorers to temples first and earn points. Along the way they can collect additional points by collecting items off the paths they create.

Description from the English Ruleset:

Many moons have come and gone since your boats departed on the journey to Karuba. Once you arrive on the island, each player will lead an expedition team of four adventurers. Now you just have to navigate your way through the dense jungle to make it to the temples. „Just“ may be something of an understatement; the ancient jungle trails have to be found and uncovered first! Hurry up and be the first to reach the temples to collect the most valuable treasures. Many paths have dead ends and you need to be patient to find the right/best way (through the jungle). Look! A gold nugget! You can pick it up and collect it, same applies to the shiny crystals along the paths.
boardgameversion: English/German Spiel Des Jahres Nominee Seal Edition
183251.name: Karuba
boardgamepodcastepisode: 14. Devon Dice Podcast - Runemeet vs the Spiel Des Jahres Nominees
Dice Tower Con - Episode 041
Ep 035 – Spiel des Jahres predictions and discussion
Ep 036 – BGG Spring Con & Spiel des Jahres 2016 Nominees
Ep 039 – Fleet, Origins, and Pokemon Go!
Ep 040 – The 2016 Spiel des Jahres Winners!
Episode 14 - Gaming Like it's 1999
Episode 27: Tiny Epic Almes
Episode 42 :: Board Game of the Year 2016 - Brawling Brothers Awards
Episode 49 :: Vast Review + Watch it Played & The Secret Cabal
Episode 53 - Terra Mystica
Episode 7 - Spiel des Jahres
Episode 91- The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire
Epside 35 :: The Others + On The Couch with Josh and Brandon
Essen 2015 - HABA
ET116: Es un pajaro, un avión es .. SUPERFILLERS!!
Gamer Tested - Spouse Approved - Karuba
HLG 6: Samen
HLG-EXTRA 5: Spellenspektakel 2016
MN 0113 We Discuss the Spiel des Jahres Nominees for 2016
Perfect Information Podcast Episode 18 - You're the Best Around!
Podcast #105 - Juegos que no tienen nada que ver con el Memuar
RJ61: Especial Dau Barcelona 2016
The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 125
The Game Pit: Episode 65 - Short Games with Mark Johnson
The Good The Board and The Doomed To Repeat: Episode 70 “Historical Games”
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 77!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 82
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 85!

183252.name: Grendel
183252.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Grendel CRUSH!!”

Sometimes what your campaign needs is a hero of legend, who everyone recognizes, even though they’ve never met her before.

Grendel is a radiated monster, the unstoppable and rage-filled alter-ego of physicist Dell Greyson. Irradiated during a space mission (as a result of the meddling Doctor Seymour Stevenson, who has since become the genius villain the Superior), Greyson struggles to find a way to control the monster within. Grendel has helped to save the world, but is also a target of unending efforts by a special military team to capture him!

183253.name: Triceratops
183253.description:
From publisher blurb:

"This time, it’s YOUSE gettin' extincted!"

Boerio “Barry” Oberto was just another hired thug working for the Cartels, until he was selected to be a test subject in the Ramses Corporation's efforts to create augmented superbeings. Becoming the mighty Triceratops (PL 10), the Cartels sent Barry to deal with the annoying hero Recluse. Barry isn’t as dumb as people think, and his augmented muscles and suit of triceratops allow him to go toe-to-toe with some of the most powerful heroes on Earth!

183254.name: Bloodrager
183254.description:
From publisher blurb:

This edition of “Fantastic Feats” – a series of feats based around a certain theme or subject – is about the Bloodrager, those that combine the fury of the Barbarian with the bloodlines abilities of the Sorcerer.

The feats you'll find inside:

Blood Resistance - Your blood makes it harder to cast spells against you
Fated Dodge - Whilst raging, your have a better chance of dodging
Potent Blood spells - Spells with a random factor to them are stronger if cast whilst raging
Potent Combatant - Melee attacks made whilst raging can now have a chance to be more deadly
Potent Rage - Morale bonus is increased whilst raging
Rapid Recovery - Fatigue time from a blood rage is reduced
Stronger Bloodline - Bloodline effects are calulated as if you are 1 level higher

183255.name: The Highwayman (Hybrid Class)
183255.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces a new hybrid class, the highwayman. The knight of the road, or gentleman bandit; the highwayman combines the code of honor of a cavalier with the less than honorable skills of the rogue. A new Order is also presented that may be used by Cavaliers or Samurai.

183256.name: "R" is for "Rescue"
183256.description:
From publisher blurb:

HELP! SAVE ME!

This entry in the Icons A to Z series takes a look at the staple of superhero adventures: saving innocent people from danger and disaster. It's not all about punching-out costumed crooks and criminals! People are in need of your help, and this chapter looks at ways heroes can provide it, including:

Vehicular crashes: planes, trains, and automobiles
Safeguarding innocent bystanders during heroic battles
Fires and other disasters
Collapsing structures and contingent pyramid tests
Search and rescue operations and medical emergencies
Basing an Icons series around rescue operations




So what are you waiting for? People need saving!

183257.name: The Thespian
183257.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Welcome to my stage!"... The Thespian!

A Power Level 10 Rogue, The Thespian is ready to make the scene in your next Mutants and Masterminds campaign.

"A flair for the dramatic" is putting it mildly. The Thespian demands center stage, and he has the skills to steal it from even seasoned superheroes! This charismatic criminal can make life difficult for your street level superheroes, or anyone with an artistic angle.

183258.name: Unnatural Codex 2: Of a Devil's Seed
183258.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are a lot of scary things out in the night, be sure to watch out for what lurks in the darkest shadows!

Unnatural Codex is a supplement for Horrors in the Night but can be used with any WEG d6 system!

Inside you'll find full stats for the insidious race of tiefling's as well as 22 new Special Abilities, 12 devilish magic items, and 16 new hellish spells for players and game master's alike!

183259.name: You Are Microscopic
183259.description:
From publisher blurb:

On hand when a brilliant scientist unveils his latest invention--a machine that shrinks human beings--the reader is shrunk to a miniscule size and must fight such fierce foes as house flies.

183260.name: Surf Monkeys
183260.description:
From publisher blurb:

You're riding the surf off California, when you discover your friend Jorge has disappeared. The search for him leads to a gang of surfers called the Surf Monkeys. You expect they know more than they're letting on, but to find out for sure, you'll have to join their gang. Jorge's life may be in danger and every minute counts. Do you join the gang, or continue the search on your own?

183261.name: Cop Salad
183261.description:
Trick-taking game based on characters from the comic series Fried Pickle Noir by J.R. Mounts. Players assemble teams to take on jobs in the crime-ridden city of The Pits. The goal is control the teams and win the jobs by selecting the right Good Guys, Mobsters, or Shady Characters to send in. Shady Characters can count as both Good Guys or Mobsters, and each one adds their own twist to the game!

More about the game and the world of Fried Pickle Noir can be found at scairytalesnoir.com.

183262.name: The Forgotten Planet
183262.description:
From publisher blurb:

The year is 2145. You are working a summer job at Interweb, a galaxy-wide communications network, when you discover evidence of a government coverup. A routine space probe vanished 40 years ago--but the company denies it ever existed. Do you tell someone about your discovery? Or do you try to find out more on your own? You decide.

183263.name: Secret of the Dolphins
183263.description:
From publisher blurb:

Will You Discover the Legendary City of the Dolphins?

You are a summer intern at the renowned Dolphin Institute in Hawaii, hoping to help find the fabled underwater city of the dolphins and make scientific history. As you're nearing the spot where the treasure-filled city is believed tolie, your group is approached by some boaters. When they press you for details about what you're doing, your suspicions are aroused. How much should you reveal?

183264.description:
Description from the publisher:

The haunted house looks even scarier than usual in the light of the full moon. The four brave friends and their dog dare to enter the haunted house, but who dares to climb the highest in Spookies?

Caution: Dice maneuvers that are too risky may take you further away from victory, so determine your own level of risk in your mission to collect as many "Spookies" as possible while you still can!
183264.name: Spookies
boardgamepodcastepisode: Essen 2015 - HABA
HLG-EXTRA 5: Spellenspektakel 2016
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 72!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 73
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 76
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 77!

183265.name: Playoff Champion
183265.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do You Have What It Takes To Lead Your Team To Victory ?

Your school baseball team has made it to the finals of the national tournament. Just before the big game, your coach collapses and is rushed to the hospital. It's up to you to step in and manage the team. In the top of the fourth inning, you see an opportunity to try a blind pickoff play. But the play is risky, and even the smallest error could give the other team the opening they need. The pressure is on. Should you try it?

183266.name: Roller Star
183266.description:
From publisher blurb:

You have just discovered the challenging new sport of inline skating. You want to be the best. Have you got the speed, strength, and wits to be a roller star?

183267.name: Scene of the Crime
183267.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can You Stop A Conspiracy From Destroying Your Town?

Your small hometown has always been fairly quiet-that is, until plans are revealed to build a huge new mail there. At first you're as excited as everyone else. But then you overhear a mysterious conversation that makes you suspect that something fishy is going on. The town council is meeting in just a few hours to decide whether to approve the final plans for the mail. Should you go to the police and tell them what you heard? Or would it be better to speak up at the town council meeting yourself?

183268.name: Dinosaur Island
183268.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shipwrecked on a mysterious island, the reader discovers that the eccentric owner of the island plans to create dinosaurs from DNA samples, and the reader must warn the world about the deadly plan.

183269.name: Motocross Mania
183269.description:
From publisher blurb:

You're The Star! 15 Exciting Endings! The Race Is On!

You are a motocross racer driving in your first big race. As the race heats up, you are among the leaders. Suddenly, the rider just ahead of you skids out of control and goes down. He looks as though he may be badly injured. Should you drop out of the race to try to help? Or would it be safer to leave him to the medics, who will arrive shortly?

183270.name: Horror House
183270.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can You Find Out Who -- Or What -- Is Terrorizing Your Aunt's New Home?

Your aunt and cousins have just moved into an old Victorian house that many people think is haunted. Your relatives have been hearing and seeing strange and terrifying things -- mysterious cries for help, a dead rabbit in the library, deep rumblings in the night -- and you've decided to investigate. Shining your flashlight around the house's eerie basement, you could swear you saw a figure darting behind the furnace! Maybe it was just a shadow. There's only one way to find out...

183271.description:
Magic: The Gathering – Arena of the Planeswalkers – Battle for Zendikar

Introduces 2 additional Planeswalkers, including the first multi-color Planeswalker, Kiora, who can field both green and blue colored creatures and spells.

Includes the first 3 hero creatures, including the terrifying Eldrazi Ruiner. The Eldrazi are colorless creatures and can be summoned by a Planeswalker of any color.

Includes 1 player vs. many battlefield scenario in which players fight against the massive Eldrazi Ruiner to save Zendikar.

Includes 2 Planeswalker figures, 3 hero figures, 11 squad figures, 15 spell cards, 9 army cards, Battle for Zendikar Board Game Expansion Pack Guide.
183271.name: Magic: The Gathering – Arena of the Planeswalkers – Battle for Zendikar
boardgamefamily: Magic: The Gathering – Arena of the Planeswalkers
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 33 STAR WARS with Alex Eding

183272.description:
Description from the publisher:

Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy – Five Families allows the players to trade new family members and traits to the other players in exchange for their Favor, a new resource. Favor tokens are used to purchase new, powerful actions.

Each family is unique and the individual family members offer powerful abilities to the player willing to trade their Favor. Additionally, Five Families adds new Patrons with unique scoring options, Birth Events with more drama, and a Daisy Track for a new solitaire challenge.
183272.name: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy – Five Families
boardgamepodcastepisode: Essen 2015 - Portal Games
MOBG podcast 39 This is the Real Deal, Part 2 of Spiel Essen
Perfect Information Episode 13 - Getting the gang (back) together

183273.name: The Bridgeway
183273.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Swords & Wizardry Mini-Dungeon
For 4-6 Adventurers of Levels 4-6

An orc warchief has gathered his forces near a mystical artifact capable of moving them anywhere in an instant. He must be stopped and his army routed before he gains control of the device.

The Bridgeway is part of a series of mini-dungeons designed to drop into existing adventures or campaigns. Use them as side quests or a way of getting in a quick adventure when you’re short on time.

boardgamecompilation: BANG! High Noon/A Fistful of Cards
183275.description:
The BANG! Expansion Pack contains the following expansions for BANG!:


BANG! The Valley of Shadows
BANG! Wild West Show
BANG! High Noon & A Fistful of Cards
183275.name: BANG! Expansion Pack

183276.name: Ghoulball
183276.description:
Ghoulball is a fast-moving card game based on the favorite sport of the monstrous citizens of Moonrise, from the comic series Scairy Tales by J.R. Mounts.

Ghoulball combines quirky characters and CCG-like battle mechanics into a crazy sports simulation played from a shared deck. Players take on the role of team managers and coaches, recruiting players, setting strategies, and attempting to score more goals than their opponents. The real fun begins when the Ghoulballs themselves come alive and impact the game in surprising ways!

More about the game and the world of Scairy Tales can be found at The Ghoulball Clubhouse and scairytalesnoir.com.

183277.name: Battledexx
183277.description:
Battledexx is a card game inspired by the Final Fantasy 8 minigame Triple Triad. The game features anime-inspired artwork.

Players place cards to the grid in turn, comparing that card's statistics and abilities to all adjacent cards. The winner is the player with the most living characters after all the cards have been played.

Cards have a variety of abilities, both offensive and defensive. There are several types of magic, which resolve in a rock-paper-scissors sort of tree, as well as healing magic that revives defeated cards and summoning spells which bring an extra powerful card into play.

183279.name: Ascendancy LRP Rules
183279.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Ascendancy LRP system! Ascendancy LRP is a high fantasy Live-Action Role Play game which includes elements from many different cultures and ages. As such there is a wide array of skills, talents and abilities available to characters. [This] document is a comprehensive exploration of...rules, including character creation and advancement, which will allow you to fully interact with the Ascendancy world.

183280.name: Ascendancy LRP Safety and Code of Conduct
183280.description:
User summary:

Document specifies safety practices and anticipated code of conduct for all Ascendancy LRP events, noting that specific events may have additional rules. Primary safety concerns revolve around combat, weapons, and fire. Code of Conduct is essentially "common sense" spelled out.

183281.name: Ascendancy LRP Influence
183281.description:
User summary:

Document codifies ten levels of influence (4 negative, 3 neutral, 4 positive) that characters may hold with specific, identified groups. In-game effects are noted.

183282.name: Ascendancy LRP Chi Powers and Honour
183282.description:
User summary:

Document codifies five levels of Chi (or "karma") and four types of Chi Powers (Basic, Advanced, Master, and "Famous Lost"), and how these operate in game. Chi is a mystical (supernatural) power derived from honour and personality.

Document codifies 11 honour levels (0 - 10) and how these operate in game.

183283.name: Add On
183283.description:
User summary:
This is a majority game in which players stack their 6 tiles depicting the numbers 1 through 6 on 3 spaces on a common board. A player who occupies 2 or more spaces wins the game. A player may roll his dice at any time and use them as a tile of the number of depicted pips. Players are free to choose whether to use their dice.

To place a tile on top of an already placed tile, the new tile must bear a higher number. Additionally, even numbers must be placed on top of even numbers and odd numbers on top of odd numbers. The fact that 2 or more tiles that add up to the higher number may also be placed is a key feature of the game.

Publisher's summary:
お互いに1～6の数字がプリントされた６個の駒を３カ所のボード上のスペースに重ねて置いて行き、2つ以上のスペースを占拠した方が勝つ陣取りゲームです。
任意のタイミングでダイスを振って、出た目の数字駒として使うことができます。ダイスを使う使わないは任意です。
既に置かれた駒の上に駒を重ねて置く場合は、重ねる駒の数字より大きく、奇数の上には奇数を、偶数の上には偶数を置かなくてはなりません。
ただし２個以上の駒の合計数でも置けるのがミソです。

183284.description:
All players are factory managers who select and install machines in their factory.

They try connect all machine input and output pipes to the right reservoirs or to other machines, to build the most profitable configuration.

A new machine brings revenue. Other thing you build (reservoirs and connectors (pipelines)) cost 1K money each.

In each game round players may select one machine (from a number of machines equal to the number of players). Simultaneous. So players try to quickly oversee possible connections. But by choosing too quick, you risk taking a machine which doesn't fit well ...
When fitting in a machine, a key tactic is to keep the most and best options for connecting future machines!

After 8 rounds the player with the most money wins.
183284.name: Factory Funner
boardgamepodcastepisode: What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 72!!

183286.name: Street Race: Katukilpailu
183286.description:
Street Race -boardgame is a game for car enthusiast. The Main goal of the game is to become "The Car King".

Game features:


Hot Rod City which has 44 different places/functions (for example garage, casino, court house, traffic lights, police station, chip tuning, car repair, speed camera, slippery road, hot rod shop, used car shop, classic car shop, sports car shop, restaurant, speed pumps (50 different cards) and so on.
Race track for track - and pinks slips race (money or car as a bet)
Buy and sell cars (30 different carcards) and race against other players
Put pedal to the metal on track, but in the city watch out for the moving police unit and speed camera (or you will get the speeding ticket, 50 different tickets)
Lots of playing money
And many more


Game is a combination of luck and tactics!

Different playing modes:

The Car King (winner is who buys first one sport car (easy) or winner is who buys first two sport cars(harder)).
Elimination mode also possible

183287.name: Ascendancy LRP Character Creation and Advancement
183287.description:
User summary:

Document proposed a standardized methodology for creating Ascendancy LRP characters. Also, details character advancement requirements, social backgrounds, vocations, heritages, talents, and skills. Presents a lengthy (but not exhaustive) list of character flaws.

183288.name: Ascendancy LRP Appendix E: Groups
183288.description:
User summary:

Document presents an enhanced and expanded list of groups and organizations that exist (or may exist) in a typical Ascendancy instance. Organizations are placed into one of seven categories. Depending on the size of the Ascendancy game, most (or all) of these groups may not be represented.

183289.name: Ascendancy LRP Appendix D: Skills
183289.description:
User summary:

Document presents an enhanced and expanded list of 41 skills. Each skill is given a concise description, a typing, a lengthy description, and a section of information for in-game effect. Each skill is noted at five levels of proficiency, with associated increases in ability. Characters may have one or more skills from the list.

183290.name: Ascendancy LRP Appendix C: Heritage Talents
183290.description:
User summary:

Document presents an enhanced list of eight heritage talents. Each talent is given a concise description, a typing (however, all are "Supernatural"), a lengthy description, and a section of information for in-game effect. Each talent is noted at five levels of proficiency, with associated increases in ability. Characters may have one of these talents depending upon their noted heritage.

183291.name: Ascendancy LRP Appendix B: Vocational Talents
183291.description:
User summary:

Document presents an enhanced list of twenty-nine vocational talents. Each talent is given a concise description, a typing, a lengthy description, and a section of information for in-game effect. Each talent is noted at five levels of proficiency, with associated increases in ability. Characters may have one of these talents depending upon their noted vocation.

183292.name: Ascendancy LRP Appendix A: Social Background
183292.description:
User summary:

Document presents an enhanced list of seven social backgrounds, from "no social status" to "upper upper class". Each category includes a description and a section of information for in-game effect. Each status also presents notes on the sphere of influence a character likely will have. Note that character starting money is tied to social background.

183293.name: Ascendancy LRP Basic Rules
183293.description:
User summary:

Document presents a drastically reduced set of basic rules for beginning players and groups (but not for referees). Assumes that new characters will start with effectively neutral social status, talents, and skills. Introduces basic concepts but does not elaborate upon them. Presents a very simplified combat methodology.

In general, intended as a "Fast Play" introductory rule set.

183294.name: Monopoly Junior: Sofia the first
183294.description:
Trade your lesson books to learn royal lessons in this magical edition of the Monopoly Junior game!

Collect and connect the 5 pieces of your royal tiara puzzle to WIN!

183295.name: Ascendancy LRP Economy
183295.description:
User summary:

Document attempts to standardize and rationalize economic processes among various Ascendancy events and groups. Proposes five basic categories of wealth and six grades of items or services. These are presented as explanatory text, not as "gold piece values" or other coinage. Also presents a chart of the types of loot NPCs will typically possess.

183296.name: Zombie Cannibal Asylum
rpgseries: Playing With Murder: Mystery Party Kits
183296.description:
From the introduction:

You...are the unfortunate inmates and staff at Penderghast Asylum, a facility for the criminally insane that has been turned over to the tender care of Dr. Abraham Weiler, who is using the inmates as research subjects in his quest to find a cure for the zombie virus that is ravaging the world.

User summary:

Game is intended as a single-evening live-action event similar to, but more complex than, a traditional "murder mystery" party event.

183297.name: Pirate Vault
183297.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible space station. The station introduced in this installment of the series is a moderately small pirate station, the actual vault hiding among the decoys.

The PDF contains the background of the station, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains an image depicting the station. This PDF contains NO deckplan!

183298.name: The Terrible Castle of Baron Castaign
rpg: The Terrible Castle of Baron Castaign
rpgseries: Playing With Murder: Mystery Party Kits
183298.description:
From the introduction:

The Barony of Shufflemoore Woods is being plagued by wolves - or perhaps only a single wolf. The creature or creatures have been responsible for all sorts of deviltry, including the disappearance of livestock and, most recently, of Mitchell and Susannah Miller's youngest daughter. Now, several residents of the Barony have retreated to Shufflemoore Manor, seeking the protection of Baron Castaign.

User summary:

Game is intended as a single-evening live-action event similar to, but more complex than, a traditional "murder mystery" party event.

rpgseries: Playing With Murder: Mystery Party Kits
183299.name: The Haunted Halloween Heist
183299.description:
From the introduction:

The Shufflemore Woods are the haunted home of numerous monsters, ghouls, goblins and other things that go bump in the night. Every Halloween, the dark denizens of the forest gather in the center of the Woods to hold a fantastic Halloween festival, complete with song, dance, eerie decorations and – best of all – a great piñata, filled with candy. But this year, something has gone terribly wrong!

User summary:

Game is intended as a single-evening live-action event similar to, but more complex than, a traditional "murder mystery" party event. Includes a scavenger hunt.

183300.name: Murder at the Nir Cantina
rpgseries: Playing With Murder: Mystery Party Kits
183300.description:
From the introduction:

The Nir Cantina on Federal Station Nine in the Axilon Nebula attracts a diverse crowd of space travelers, including mercenaries, traders, diplomats, scientists, and smugglers. While most of these folks want nothing more than to have a quick drink and a meal on their way from one end of the galaxy to the other, at least one of them has a more sinister purpose in mind. It will take the guests and employees of the Nir Cantina all of their wits and skills to piece together the confounding clues and determine the identity of the killer in their midst!

User summary:

Game is intended as a single-evening live-action event similar to, but more complex than, a traditional "murder mystery" party event.

183301.name: Murder in Manhattan
rpgseries: Playing With Murder: Mystery Party Kits
183301.description:
From the introduction

[The characters] have been invited to the anniversary bash of Mr. Francis Fisk, a noted businessman. The attendees include a number of Fisk’s high-society friends, family members, and business associates. These high society sophisticates live in a world of intrigue, gossip, treachery and endless jockeying for social superiority.

Things take a turn for the deadly when a rolling blackout provides someone with the opportunity to advance their social agenda in a more brutally direct fashion than most of the guests are familiar with. When the lights come back on, a grisly crime is discovered...

183302.name: Jazz Age Jeopardy
rpgseries: Playing With Murder: Mystery Party Kits
183302.description:
From the introduction

[The characters] are a mixed group of club staff members, entertainers, and guests at a private party held at a jazz club in 1920s New York City. It is the height of the Jazz Age, and social revolution is afoot. This is the age of Prohibition—and of bootleggers and gangsters. Club owner Felix Fontano, the son of a successful bootlegger and crime boss—and a successful businessman himself—is throwing this private party for a group of select friends. It is a night of revelry like many other nights of revelry enjoyed by this group of sophisticates, artists, and hoodlums . . . until things go horribly wrong.

rpgseries: Playing With Murder: Mystery Party Kits
183303.name: Casino: Dead Money
183303.description:
From the introduction

[The characters] have been invited to an evening of gambling and entertainment at the Lady Lux, a casino owned by the wealthy Dona Mancini. The guest list includes a number of gambling enthusiasts—from high rollers to novices—as well as the performers, dealers, and other staff employed by Dona Mancini. Everyone is expecting an evening replete with games of chance, dinner, drinks, and maybe a show—they aren’t expecting a power outage, the murder of a member of the surveillance team, or a lockdown that prevents them from leaving the casino.

At the midpoint of the evening, the power goes out in the casino. When the generator kicks in and the lights come back on, a woman screams—the sound coming from somewhere outside the gaming area. Upon investigation, the casino staff find that Kat Bloomberg, the Surveillance Manager, has dropped dead in the employee restroom. Was it foul play?

183304.name: Mardi Gras, Masks, Murder!
rpgseries: Playing With Murder: Mystery Party Kits
183304.description:
From the introduction

[The characters] play a mixed group of characters who have been invited to a Mardi Gras masquerade hosted by Marshall Inglewood, the Governor of Louisiana. The party will be held at the governor’s posh New Orleans mansion. Everyone is expecting an elegant evening with hor d’oeuvres, drinks, and dancing, but as it turns out, something mysterious is afoot!

183305.name: Science Ninjas: Valence
183305.description:
Valence is a fun card game that uses simple math, colors, and cartoon ninjas to teach kids (8+) chemistry! Players use more than 25 different molecules to interact with each other and win the game!

Players draw Element cards from the deck in order to form Molecules. Each Element has a different Valence number that describes how many electrons it has to give (positive) or how many electrons it needs (negative) to have a full valence shell. If the Valence numbers add up to zero, they form a Molecule!

Each Molecule is worth a certain point value. If your molecules add up to 10 points then you win the game! But beware… several molecules are vulnerable to attack from your opponents! Acids attack Bases (4 points) and turn them into Salt and Water (1 point each). Deadly Carbonyls (which have the special power of removing oxygen from the board) are vulnerable to attack by Water. Players interact with each other using real chemical reactions!

183306.name: Set Sail for Disaster
rpgseries: Playing With Murder: Mystery Party Kits
183306.description:
From the introduction

[The characters] have been invited on a pleasure cruise by Captain Michael Von Ammon. The guest list includes a number of the Captain's friends, family members, and business associates, as well as the crew of the Captain's sixty-foot yacht, the Elizabeth May. Everyone is expecting an evening cruise replete with dinner, drinks, and dancing - they aren't expecting foul weather, the murder of the Captain, or a sudden shipwreck on a deserted island in the uncharted Caribbean.

183307.name: Last Stop: Murder
rpgseries: Playing With Murder: Mystery Party Kits
183307.description:
From the introduction

[The characters] are passengers on the luxurious Oriental Express. Your fellow passengers number several unsavory characters, almost certainly up to no good. No one knows who they can trust, as everyone seems to have an ulterior motive.

Unexpectedly, the train is snowed in and one of the passengers is murdered. Fortunately, the famed detective Pardot is on board. With the help of your guests, the identity of the murderer should be discovered by the time the police arrive.

183308.description:
The railway history of both Switzerland and Austria can be explored in 1844/1854, two previously self-published designs — both based on the 1829 (aka 18xx) game system created by Francis Tresham — that have been thoroughly revised for this new edition.

In 1844, set in Switzerland, the challenge lies in running different types of businesses: Local railway companies, which merged at that time to form SBB, and national historical societies require different decisions and support different strategies. Many companies have a destination station and receive a large part of their working capital only if they have connected this stations to their route network. The game also features mountain railways, tunnels, private companies and two different types of locomotives, providing for lots of variation for railway enthusiasts and lovers of complex games.

A special feature of 1854, set in Austria, is located in the stock split, which comes into play in the additional shares. As in 1844', there are mergers of companies, two types of locomotives, tunnels, mountain railways, and private companies. In addition, some private companies operate on a separate game board depicting the Steyr region.
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 107 -- Through a Crack in the Slats
Episode 110 - Keeping the PWM at a Constant Duty Cycle
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 44!!! The EPIC Week!!!

183309.name: The Weird West
183309.description:
From the introduction:

A Live Role-play game set in a twisted version of the Wild West where you join forces with other Hunters attempting to do battle with nightmare creatures to win back the west. Incorporating themes from Steampunk, Spaghetti Westerns, The American Civil War Era, Comic Books and film.

User note on credits:

The document is authored by "Team Bridgwater 2" [sic] and also states "By those geeks at False Utopia & The Grange".

183310.description:
Convention and Webstore only promo set, provided with purchase of the Dark Gothic Deck Building Game.

1 Large Villian Card
8 Living Trees Special Minion Cards

The Dryad of Harper's Wood is a Level III Magick villain. When revealed, she places a line of Living Trees below the center line. Whenever a card is acquired from the center row, a Living Tree card moves in to replace it. Living trees require a player to pay extra resources when they are defeated or they go directly to the Shadows pile. Additionally, the Dryad herself requires +1 resource to defeat for every Living Tree still in the center line.
183310.name: Dark Gothic: The Dryad of Harper's Wood

183311.name: ZombieRun
183311.description:
After a massive apocalyptic thunderstorm you find yourself in the middle of a forest graveyard with two zombies drooling over you. It seems that the thunder wasn’t the only thing that hit the world while you were out. It’s time to act fast, stay alive and get to the city for some answers.

The game features:
- Cool classical weapons like shotgun and grenades.
- Four different worlds that each have their own mysteries and specialities.
- Lots of different paths that make you want to play again and again.
- Enemies, enemies and more enemies. Don’t think just shoot.
- Healthy collectables (yes we like to be healthy). Collect carrots and apples to activate superpowers. Yes you’ve got super powers. How cool is that.

Source: The Game Website.

183313.description:
Convention and Webstore only promo set, provided with purchase of the Dark Gothic: Colonial Horror Deck Building Game.

It consists of one Large Villain Card. The Harbinger of Death is a Level III Villain that adds the top card of the Main Deck to the Shadows any time any other cards are added to the shadows, accelerating the game toward player defeat. Additionally, The Harbinger of Death destroys all gear and allies used to defeat it.
183313.name: Dark Gothic: The Harbinger of Death

183314.name: Cinema Frontier
boardgameartist: フジオカ　アデリ (Aderi Fujioka)
183314.description:
In Cinema Frontier, players should combine cards in the most efficient way to create the best possible movie.

"Scene" cards and "actor" cards are distributed with each player on a turn either adding a card to a pile or claiming a pile, and once all players have claimed a pile, they need to shoot the scenes, preferably with the actors they have. The last player to pick a pile must draw an accident (event), but will also be first player next round.

The actors' special skills spice things up as they allow the players to do various tricks to improve their situation. Points are awarded each time a scene is finished, with a bonus at the end for linking certain scenes together and having a varied movie. Most points at the end wins.

183315.description:
By the end of the III century the Roman Empire is doomed. Enemies surround the borders, instability spreads over the provinces, and whenever a Roman Emperor has the courage and ability to fight a threat, usurpers take his place in Rome and increase the chaos. The Emperor Diocletian only sees one, revolutionary way out: share the power with some trusted colleagues. In a few years he creates an Imperial College together with Maximian, Constantius and Galerius, forming the first 'Tetrarchy'. Now their enemies are doomed...

TETRARCHIA (Latin of Tetrarchy, "leadership of four") is a cooperative game in which 1 to 4 players take the role of the 4 Emperors, fighting the revolts within the Empire and the Barbarian armies that try to bring it down. With simple rules, the core engine leads to very different games, offering several difficulty challenges (up to 81!) and many interesting choices.

The flow of each Emperor's turn is very simple: spend up to 6 'Imperivm Points' (IP), and then propagate threats with the roll of two dice. The Emperors can spend their IP in: Move to a linked province, order a Roman fleet to Sail to an adjacent sea zone, Secure the province by placing one of their tokens, Subdue the province by removing the Unrest/Revolt token, or Attack a Barbarian army in a linked province. The players win if they secure the borders of the Empire before the majority of provinces revolt or Rome falls.
183315.name: Tetrarchia

183316.description:
A mini expansion for Agricola, to honor the 90th birthday of Erwin Glonnegger.

It is a special field, costing extra food to build. But on seeding grain here, one puts 1 grain and 1 vegetable instead of two grain on it.
183316.name: Agricola: Glon­na­cker

183317.name: Mopi Ranger
183317.description:
Box

All is not well in Mopiland! Invaders from far away, the Razzons, are bent on enslaving the peaceful Mopiras! The first phase of their plan was to capture the young Moplits and lock them up in their maze-like water castles, but they didn't count on Mopiranger, the hero defender of Mopiland! As the Mopiranger, ride your trusty canoe through the Razzon's water castles, and free the Moplits! Use your Stone Beamer to turn the Razzons to stone, but be careful not to block yourself into a corner of the maze! Go, Mopiranger, Go!

183318.name: Catfolk, Ratfolk, and Dhampir Feats
183318.description:
Publisher Blurb

Catfolk, Ratfolk, and Dhampir Feats is our latest Mythic Mini devoted to an assortment of furry and ferocious playable PC races. The catfolk and ratfolk are each cunning, agile, and shifty in their own way, with their animalistic characteristics outside hiding cleverness and courage within. Dhampirs are in some ways the opposite, outwardly human but with the blood of a beast roiling in their veins and a hunger kept barely controlled by their dedication to a life of adventure and heroics. This product contains 13 marvelous mythic feats for your beast-blooded heroes from Blood Feaster and Tunnel Rat to Claw Pounce, Natural Charmer, and Burrowing Teeth!

Mythic Minis are short, inexpensive products designed to take one rules concept or set of Pathfinder RPG rules and bring them to you in a new way for the mythic rules, including converting existing rules as well as introducing entirely new rule options. Created by the same designers that helped bring you the official mythic rules, Mythic Minis skip the fluff and give you all crunch, all the time.

Nobody knows mythic like Legendary Games, and whether it's new mythic feats, class abilities, path abilities, magic items, or anything else, every Mythic Mini delivers a delicious dollop of dazzling design that will fill out your mythic experience one slice at a time. Check for a new Mythic Mini every Monday to make your game just a little more Legendary!

183319.name: Electric Gypsy's RPG
183319.description:
User summary:

Electric Gypsy's RPG was intended to be a universal RPG framework with very light mechanics to facility roleplay and eliminate complex calculations. It was developed privately and in August, 2010, was released as electronic text (e.g., HTML) on the author's now-defunct website. The document was about five pages long, depending on pages size, etc.

183321.name: Rules for Epidemic Survival
183321.description:
User summary:

Tri-fold flyer containing the core rules for the game. Presented as though distributed by the "CDC Infection Taskforce", with some hand-written corrections. In essence, this serves as a concise "Player's Guide" to the game.

This document occasionally is referred to as "Survivor Rules" elsewhere in the rule set.

183322.name: The Ensign
183322.description:
User Summary

The Ensign is an imaginative prequel to the iOS hit, A Dark Room. There is no difficulty setting other than permadeath, and players will die often.

Movement is limited to NSEW. Players are trying to uncover the map, the story, upgrade equipment -- all while being threatened by the different creatures and occupants of this strange planet.

The story element of the wanderers and the invasion are what will keep players hooked on this game. As an added bonus, the developer has included several audio commentaries on different aspects of the game.

183323.description:
This promotional card was given at multiple conventions including Origin and GenCon 2015.

For an action point, an alien can move to its toxic planet or for two action points to their home planet.
183323.name: Chaosmos: Dimension Rip Promo Card

183324.name: Survivor Tracker and Equipment List
183324.description:
User summary:

Essentially a character record sheet, but with atypical presentation. Most characters will be nearly indistinguishable from each other based upon this list.

Page one tracks achievements (essentially, actions completed in game). Page one tracks equipment--i.e., weapons.

183325.name: The Verbeeg Valley
183325.description:
From publisher blurb:

This "encounter" is designed for you, the Dungeon Master, to conduct at any point between the series of modules within this Super Adventure. You can run it after the G4, the G6 or the G8 (running it between the G5&6 or G7&8 is problematic, for the first one in those pairs leads directly to the next in sequence, with little room or reason for the party to divert to this). That being said, you can even run this before the Super Module begins, or after the last installment.

183326.name: Survivor Cards
183326.description:
User summary:

Essentially a miniature character record sheet presented as a "tent card" for table display. Includes "Personal Goal", weapons information, health status, a "Stuff" box, and "Revelations" on the player side.

Also includes six pages of pre-generated characters ("Miriam", "Carlton", "Gaz", "Sharon", "Peter", "Mick").

183327.name: Range Map
183327.description:
User summary:

A generalized playing surface for Fight Infection that presents several "zones" for use during play. Can be printed and used "as is" or serve merely as an example of layout. Primarily used during combat.

183328.name: Infected Tracker and Rules
183328.description:
User summary:

The Infection Tracker is a play sheet used by the GM to track NPCs/monsters and players-turned-bad. The Rules section includes scenario lead-in samples for the GM as well as infection control procedures, etc. In essence, this document is a concise "GM Guide" to the game.

183329.name: Curse of the Cloud Giant Queen
183329.description:
From the Introduction:

Like the adventure before it (The Sanctum of the Stone Giant Lord) this module was designed as a supplemental scenario to be used in conjunction with the G-Series adventures written by Gary Gygax. It can be run any time after the party finishes the G-Series. It does not directly affect the information or exploration of the other giant modules and is offered as additional experience the party can acquire.

183330.name: Infected Cards
183330.description:
User summary:

Document includes several "table tent" record sheets for infected ("monsters"). The NPCs include "Fatty, the bile spewer", "Lasher, the tongue snarer", "Stalker, the pouncing predator", "Banshee, the sleeping psycho", "Hulk, the raging beast", and "Horde, the mindless masses". Typically, each named NPC will be used once per game session.

183331.name: Forge of the Fomorian Smith Lord
183331.description:
From the Forward:

E. Gary Gygax wrote the beloved G-series of modules back in the mid to late '70s. The first two installments ran only 8 pages each (the last being a whopping 16) and all came with maps on the inside of the folder-cover. It is easy to refer to them as beloved since, from the moment of their original printing till now it is safe to say that no other module or series has so ingrained itself into the fabric of the fantasy role playing community.

From the Introduction:

This adventure is intended for use with the First Edition Game rules, and should not consider anything from the UA manual or any errata that has appeared since. The party of adventurers should range from 5 to 9 in size and from levels 8 to 12. Dwarves and paladins should be included within the group, with at least one cleric, magic-user and thief along as well. Whether a paladin is used or not the general bent of the group should be Lawful and Good. The DM should deny any evil race or class from being used. The DM should make a list of pre-rolled characters in case the players do not have any of the appropriate levels; one or more of these may also be used as henchman to strengthen a small group.

183332.name: Giants in the Deep
183332.description:
From the Forward:

E. Gary Gygax wrote the beloved G-series of modules back in the mid to late '70s. The first two installments ran only 8 pages each (the last being a whopping 16) and all came with maps on the inside of the folder-cover. It is easy to refer to them as beloved since, from the moment of their original printing till now it is safe to say that no other module or series has so ingrained itself into the fabric of the fantasy role playing community.

From the Introduction:

This adventure is designed for a party of 5 to 8 characters with levels ranging from 6 to 10. It should contain at least one cleric and magic user and several fighters; dwarf and gnome fighters being the more preferred for their subterranean skills. A party of Prerolled characters is provided in the appendices after the adventure and can be used by the DM to add NPCs to the party or to allow players lacking a character of appropriate level to venture along.

183333.name: Manor of the Mountain Giant King
183333.description:
From the Forward:

This is my 5th adventure designed for the purpose of pitting high level parties against giant adversaries. The previous scenarios, Sanctum of the Stone Giant Lord, Castle of the Cloud Giant Queen, Forge of the Fomorian Smith Lord, and Giants in the Deep, are (were) designed to be supplemental adventures for
characters of more experience, more savvy, and having a desire to continue hunting giants and their kin. While all can be played as separate adventures, they can also be linked with some minor creative writing by the DM. There is already a storyline connecting the G5 to the G6, and another linking the G7 to this one; subtle as they are.

183334.name: Secret of the Swamp Giant Steward
183334.description:
From the Forward:

This is a wilderness adventure. Though it is designed for mid to upper level characters it is unforgiving to those players that behave rashly, or assume too much. While some groups may think they are too powerful for such a simple scenario the possibility of losing half the party is not only likely, it is eminent, should the group underestimate its dangers. And
while many might think it is full of contrivances placed simply to diminish the full powers and abilities of such groups, and characters, it is worth noting that from time to time groups need reminding that the natural world is just as dangerous as a fantastic one.

ACKNOWLEDGEMENT

As the last adventure in a tribute to Gary Gygax's Giant Series, it is hoped that those that read and play it will find some sense of enjoyment from it.

183335.name: It's All in the Blood
183335.description: Rumors of faceless demonic creatures have been steadily rising in the Hillsfar region, and it is said that far below the surface of Faerun, nestled in the bowels of the underdark, ancient terrors are stirring. The imperiled drow of Szith Morcaine have extended an intriguing offer, but can the drow be trusted, and for how long? An eight-hour adventure for 11th-16th level characters.

183336.name: The Occupation of Szith Morcane
183336.description:
From the front cover:

Agents of the fire giants of Maerimydra, a city in the Underdark, have overtaken the drow outpost of Szith Morcane. The factions seek out adventurers to free the outpost’s leaders for questioning on the giants’ activities. Can you extricate them before it’s too late? A four-hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters.

183337.name: Gladiator Class
183337.description:
User summary:

This is an optional set of rules to run Gladiators in Advanced Dungeons & Dragons.

183338.name: Shackles of Blood
183338.description:
From the front page:

The Red Plumes have increased patrols in the region surrounding Hillsfar, and a string of disappearances has followed in their wake. Naturally, this has roused the suspicion of the factions. Join your factions and find out the truth behind the missing farmers. A four-hour adventure for 1st-4th level characters.

183339.name: 7 Icon Campaign
183339.description:
From the introduction:

Start with a thought experiment: What would happen if we compressed the 13 icons into 7? Build on GM notes and player questionnaires from Jonathan’s 7-icon home campaign. Polish to a dangerous sheen with six new feats, spells, and talents inspired by the stories of the ‘new’ icons and usable in any 13th Age game.

183340.description:
Description from the publisher:

Who's feeling brave and wants to go on an exciting adventure? Then fly into the air and set a course for the 13 islands!

In Der Schatz der 13 Inseln, the airship must first travel to cliffs and volcanoes, then make its way through the dense fog. Part of the game is to collect rare artifacts and mysterious objects on the island. That's how a group of researchers will impart their important clues to help find the legendary treasure. But time is running out! Because other pilots have also been searching for the treasure. Who will be the first to unravel the mystery of the 13 islands and earn the legendary treasure?
183340.name: Der Schatz der 13 Inseln
boardgamepodcastepisode: MOBG podcast 39 This is the Real Deal, Part 2 of Spiel Essen

183341.name: Grunz, Miau & Muh
183341.description:
Description from the publisher:

Every morning, Bruno the farmer must bring his animals to the pasture. But where are the lambs, cows, chickens, pigs and cats hiding? Only the players who press the animal sound buzzer, prick up their ears, and recognize which animal sound it plays will be able to find the animals quickly and lead them to the pasture.

Grunz, Miau & Muh is a collection of three animal games: memory, snap, and reaction.

183342.name: Schnapp die Schätze
183342.description:
Description from the publisher:

Honorable Sultan Semih wishes to reward his most able counselors with gold from the royal coffers. The Sultan has ordered amazing rare objects — a silver column, a flying carpet, a magic lamp, and more — to be carefully stacked upon a magical silver column.

In a thrilling contest in Schnapp die Schätze, players vie for the magical silver column. Only the one who fortune shines upon most — granting him speed, agility and luck — will earn his weight in gold and the title of Grand Counselor. A breath-taking, fast-reaction game.

183343.name: Quest for the Shaven Yak Starring Ren Hoëk and Stimpy
183343.description:
User Summary

Based upon the popular Nickelodeon show. Tectoy, Sega's Brazilian publisher, released the game to the Master System in 1993 exclusively for Brazil. Later, it was ported to the Game Gear and release in North America and Europe.

183344.description:
Description from the publisher:

Can you hear the growling stomachs of the two Stone Age hunters Bone Breaker and Mammoth Masher? They're off to roam the wilderness in search of food. They split up so that they can maximize their efforts. On their way they find all kinds of nutritious things to eat: juicy mammoths and dangerous dinosaurs, thick lizards, but also useless bones.

In Ugah Ugah!, players help the two Stone Age hunters to earn the spoils. Whoever has the most munch points when Bone Breaker and Mammoth Masher meet up again has won the hunt.
183344.name: Ugah Ugah!

183345.name: Kesselchaos
183345.description:
Description from the publisher:

Every year on witching night, a great magic potion brewing competition takes place. All young sorcerers have to gather everything together for their magical recipes. Who can brew their potions the fastest in the fast-paced reaction game Kesselchaos? And also make sure all the ingredients are right? Watch out because the Senior Sorcerer Yorandel will check all of the potion cauldrons at the end.

183346.name: Kleiner Garten
boardgamefamily: HABA My Very First Games series
183346.description:
Description from the publisher:

Hurray, springtime has sprung again! Gardener Gabriel is overjoyed as he can finally get back to tending his garden. This year he wants to grow sweet strawberries, crunchy carrots and yellow tulips. Who wants to help him plant, water and weed the patches?

Unfortunately Molly Mole is also busily burrowing her molehill. Who will be quicker: the children or Molly? Kleiner Garten is a cooperative color game.

183347.description:
Description from the publisher:

Every day, Mailman Marty has loads of packages to deliver. Sometimes he's not very careful and he makes a mistake. Luckily, Marty has helpful children to make sure all the packages arrive at the right address.

In Die Post ist da, the children need to look very closely in order to recognize the colors and objects, matching them correctly. Each turn, a player receives a package card. He has to select a room to deliver the package to (the correct room is the one with the matching colour). After the player has delivered the package, he can verify if he has selected the correct room by flipping the card: on the back is a picture of an object - if that object is also depicted in the room, the package has been correctly delivered.

The game ends in a (shared) victory when all packages have been delivered.
183347.name: Die Post ist da
boardgamefamily: HABA My Very First Games series

183348.name: Planarch Codex: The Calvino Cycle or, If on a Wintry Plane a Freebooter
rpghonor: 2014 Indie Supplement of the Year Runner-Up
183348.description:
From the publisher:

The Calvino Cycle or, If on a Wintry Plane a Freebooter is an experimental adventure module for the tabletop roleplaying game Dungeon World, inspired by the literary works of Italo Calvino. It is meant to be used with the first module in the Planarch Codex series, Dark Heart of the Dreamer.

183349.name: U-Boat Attack
183349.description:
You are the captain of a U-Boat during the height of World War II. En route back to port, you come across a large allied merchant fleet carrying critical supplies to the war effort. Low on fuel and torpedoes, it is critical you destroy a number of ships before escaping the fleet.

U-Boat Attack is a solo game. Each turn you may take 2 actions to assist with destroying the merchant ships, or to avoid the destroyers and their depth charges.

The board depicts your submarine and surrounding ocean upon which destroyers move across, dropping depth charges. Depth charges and your submarine are represented on the board, and on a Depth Indicator. If a depth charges explodes at your location and your depth, you are destroyed.

Navigate in 3 dimensions through the depth charges, obtain firing solutions, destroy 3 merchant ships and reach the escape point to win!

183350.name: Witch - Quick Start Guide
183350.description:
Publisher blurb
WITCH is a dark, modern fantasy, tabletop role playing game that centres around the Fated, men and women who have answered the question above with yes. The Fated have sold their soul to a demon and received strange new magical powers in return. Those powers are the key to a world hidden within our own, it has its own rules and is governed by an ancient Council.

183351.description:
Oversized Play Mat to be used as your Pathfinder Adventure Card Game Board. There are card guides showing the layout and placement of each set of cards for up to 6 players.

Dimensions: 24" x 24" (61 cm x 61 cm).
boardgameaccessory: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Skull & Shackles – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – Base Set
183351.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Adventure Mat

183352.name: August 2015 Free Monster of the Month: Giant Velvet Worm
183352.description:
From publisher blurb:

Although similar in appearance to a chubby centipede, giant velvet worms are ancient and deadly creatures.

183353.name: Sacredote
183353.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book contains the sacerdote base class, a new base class for the Pathfinder roleplaying game.

The sacerdote is a wisdom and intelligence class, a scholar and divine spellcaster class that is powerful and versatile enough to compete with the arcane wizard. Specialized in magic, they are less practical than clerics and are not leaders or warriors. They cast cleric and domain spells, know numerous divine secrets, and can use all the domains of a typical deity or draw power from a whole pantheon. They have a huge number of spells per day and rely on magic in combat and on channeling their spells into devastating manifestations of divine wrath.

This book contains rules for the sacerdote, including 23 feats and eight archetypes, the augur, invoker, proselytizer, theurgist and the druid, elemental, healing, and spirit sacerdotes.

183354.name: Rooftops
183354.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rooftops is a set of printable textures compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game.

Contains: 8 6x10 textures depicting rooftops. These can be printed and trimmed to fit over our building floor plans, or cropped for VTT use and used as overlays.

Uses: Placing the rooftop textures over the floorplans can hide the contents until the players enter a building, or allows the players to stand on the roof, leading to chases, ambushes and a whole new level to your encounters.

183355.name: Characters in the Medieval Market
183355.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you checked out the Medieval Market from DramaScape yet? No? Don't worry, I'll wait...

Ok. By now I hope you've checked it out. Awesome, right? And free!

Well, what happens if your PCs want to visit this masterpiece of mapping? Who's there to greet them at each stall? What will they find there? Are there any plots brewing?

There are now!

Insta-NPCs Crossover: Medieval Market offers eleven different fantasy genre NPCs, each with:

a picture (courtesy of the Terrible Character Portraits Project by Jeff Preston - CC BY 3.0)
a description (who are they, where are they from, what's their backstory?)
and a few plots (what are they up to? are they in trouble? how can we get the PCs involved?)




This is the first and hopefully not the last of these, offering collections of pre-made NPCs inspired by the Insta-NPCs products (these were inspired by Insta-NPCs #10: Caveat Emptor)!

183356.name: Comic Book Adventures: Mission Book 3
183356.description:
From publisher blurb:

This third in a series of mission usable with Comic Book Adventures, these low level mission and adventure are feared towards 3rd to 5th level heroes and meant to continue your fun solo games. The mission book is packed full of new missions and adventures and builds on the story and plot line begun in the Mini-Mission and the first mission books.

183357.name: Infinite Threats: Too-Nia
183357.description:
From publisher blurb:

The oldest and most advanced species known to core world science, the Too-Nia have built a vast interstellar empire that spans hundreds, perhaps thousands of worlds.

Little is known about this reclusive and secretive civilization, save that they have been exploring the stars since before the species of the core world had developed anything that could be called a civilization. Hailing from a stretch of the galaxy far beyond the frontier worlds of the Fringe, the Too-Nia have only been encountered in the deepest reaches of space. The exploratory craft and trading vessels of this race venture far out into the unexplored depths of the galaxy and sometimes make hesitant, intermittent contact with other worlds.

On the outer Fringe, an old space hand might see a Too-Nia ship once, maybe twice in a lifetime. Rare as it is to contact a Too-Nia vessel, it is even more unusual to lay eyes on one of the shelled aliens in the flesh. They are masters of robotics technology and prefer to use automatons as their intermediaries in diplomatic affairs. Only during conflict will the Too-Nia interact directly with members of other species, and even then the enemy is most likely to encounter automated war machines and warriors who are invisible underneath their stealth screens.

This book presents a GM with an NPC species for use as allies, adversaries, and foils in a campaign set on the Fringes of settled space. Infinite Futures: Too-Nia contains a number of new creatures, complete with background information and plot hooks, for use with the Infinite Futures 2.0 and the Fringe main rulebooks.

183358.name: XenoShyft
videogamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game App Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
183358.description:
"In XenoShyft, you and up to three friends take on the role of different NorTec Military Divisions — The Science Labs, Med Bay, Armory, Weapon’s Research, Barracks, and Command Center — that make up the NorTec base. Equipped with special abilities unique to each Division, players must protect the base against waves of the relentless Hive while field operations are completed on the planet. Everyone must work together to ensure NorTec’s operations remain safe or everyone will perish.

The XenoShyft app features full internet multiplayer, so you and your friends can battle the Hive from anywhere! And an easy to follow, quick tutorial is included to get you in the game as fast as possible. Expansions are available through in-app purchases.

Source: The Developer Website.

183360.name: Legends of Draxia
183360.description:
Legends of Draxia is a fantasy strategy card game which utilizes resource management to kill monsters, make buildings, and cast spells.

Players will pull 3 random cards from the character deck, each with a secret end-game bonus) and choose one, discarding the others. Players take turns pulling two resource cards from the main deck into their hand. Based on what resources they have in their hand and from any buildings they have built, players can buy spells, construct buildings or fight monsters. Resources must be wisely spent while not exposing the player's secret end-game bonus.
