Game ends after all cathedral buildings are constructed or monster deck is exhausted. Players tally points for the buildings they constructed, monsters they have destroyed along with the end-game character bonus. Player with the highest points wins.

183361.description:
The shogun is dead, long live the shogun. Ripples of rebellion are spreading through the lands and the shogunate erupts into a bloody power struggle between the strongest clans. As the venerated advisor of your clan you must do everything in your power to herald your clan to victory. Unfortunately the opposition is fierce, and you must rely on the scheming and planning of others to help you exalt your leader.

Shogunate is a game of strategy, deduction, and risk for 3-5 players. Your goal is to get your clan leader named Shogun while blocking and defeating opponents. Each player starts with the same five action cards that will alter the line of succession. On a turn, each player submits one action and the active player chooses in what order the actions are taken after seeing the outcome of each move. Powerful cards lead to early gains, but make your leader a target for assassination.
183361.name: Shogunate

183364.name: Mad Libs: The Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: NJAGP At The Table 4: Mad Libs The Game
183364.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Mad Libs: The Game, players use the word-filled game cards in their hand combined with the sentence card in play to make the most appropriately inappropriate sentences possible. The funniest sentence by popular vote wins the round, and the first player to win three rounds wins the game.

183366.name: Bulwark: The Blood Hunt
183366.description:
Contains one Foe deck for Bulwark.

The Baron of Ruin is a vampire. He has an army, and a pack of hound to chase down those that run in the face of his power. Can you stop him in his tracks, even as the new Menace mechanic makes him all the stronger?

183367.name: Bulwark: Shadows and Knives
183367.description:
Contains one Foe deck for Bulwark.

Guildmaster Umbra is seeking to expand his network of spies, assassins and thieves. Duplicitous and indirect, it will take a lot more than brute strength to put an end to his schemes.

183369.name: Bulwark: Nevtelen Lucksmith / Carnival of Chaos
183369.description:
This double pack contains two decks - a new hero deck and a new foe deck.

Nevtelen Lucksmith is a gambler. That doesn't just mean he puts wagers money, he also puts his life on the line on matters of chance. For years he's been scratching that thrill-seeking itch doing a little good as he goes, and the prospect of wlaking away from a confrontation with an army is too good to miss!

The Carnival of Chaos is brooding, sinister and unexpected. What happy smiles for children when the clowns have no faces? What joy and laughter can there be when mute horrors swing scythes at any that cross their paths? The mystery at the heart of the carnival may never be solved, but it's up to you to chase it away from the town it has selected to feast on.

183370.name: Bulwark: Hemi Szakma
183370.description:
Contains one Hero deck for Bulwark.

Hemi is a merchant, and a damn fine one. Once a rapacious profiteer, he now turns his resources to more socially-aware ends. He knows the cost of war and the value of freedom, and however frail he might be in person he has tricks and resources that can save even a seemingly-doomed town.

183371.name: Bulwark: Harsfa the Silent
183371.description:
Contains one Hero deck for Bulwark.

Harsfa isn't exactly mute, but you would be forgiven for thinking so considering how seldom she speaks. She has elevated being a bodyguard to an art form, being able to lead a terrified client through a hail of arrows unscathed and skewer two goblins with one thrust of her trusty spear. If you bring her into battle alongside you, you can concentrate on taking out the enemy without worrying about your own safety.

183372.name: Bulwark: Glassforge
183372.description:
Contains one Location deck for Bulwark.

A town made prosperous by industry and its famous glassware was never intended to be defended from a rampaging army - yet this is exactly what has happened! 'Glassforge offers new uses for Heroism and unexpected ways of interaction with your trashed cards.

183377.name: Bulwark: Extra Wounds
183377.description:
This deck of alternative Wounds can be used to add variety to your Bulwark games. Simply use this deck in place of the original Wounds, or shuffle together with them and use a random selection of 30.

These extra Wounds also give you the components you need to have two groups playing Bulwark at the same time without needing an additional base set.

183380.name: Spiel-Spaß-Kiste: Wichtelwaldfest
183380.description:
Description from the publisher:

The summer feast is coming up in the gnomes' forest, and for the forest animals there is nothing they like more! The gnomes have prepared a variety of fun games such as a race up to the fairground, balancing leaves on their heads, an amusing searching game, and a flower memory game. Who wants to join in the feast of the forest gnomes and animals?

Spiel-Spaß-Kiste: Wichtelwaldfest is a box packed full of games and fun that offers endless playing.

183381.name: HOPE Cardgame
183381.description:
About the game

HOPE: Heroes of Postapocalyptic Earth represents a card game full of conquests, battles, strategies and survival based on post-apocalyptic vision of the near future, which is designed by Czech gaming and graphic company HOPE Studio.

Core game of HOPE contains everything you need for 2 players and provides a fresh start for new players and experienced players alike. A unique concept ensures high replayability thanks to the variety of cards and the different play of dissimilar types of races. What tactics you choose is entirely up to you.

Each player represents one of the four surviving races, which are skirmishing for a control over the rest of the sources needed to survive on the unhospitable planet Earth. Combat like a leader of Mutants who try to infect their neighborhood with radioactivity. Be side by side of frightening Aliens who desire for blood and fast occupation of enemy territory. Bots got the dynamic artificial intelligence and represent a threat to enemies with deadly weapons and huge level of defense. And Humans? Will they successfully survive with your help another terrifying night in a shelter?

Conquer the collapsing world by gaining sources, winning battles against opponent’s units and finally controlling over sections of the battleground. Combat for dear life is just beginning!

For more info visit

Websites
Facebook
Google+
Instagram.





4 deadly races

In the HOPE Cardgame you can find one of the four deadly races or create your own deck.


Aliens

Aliens are bloodthirsty race, which represents the scariest dreams and nightmares of people. They come from the deepest underground, from which climbed due indelible traces of fear and hopelessness of humans, who lived through the agony during the World War III. In recent years, Aliens are making heartless attacks for food and attack fortresses of people in subway and in ruins of towns and cities. They don’t know a fair fight, they attack in groups and don’t leave any witnesses. Create a band of many Aliens and feed them with fresh meat!


Mutants

Radiation disease or adapted to existing conditions, as well as posthumous form of living. This would simply introduce representatives of Mutants. There are many kinds of them. While animal species are wild and incontrollable, there are an intelligent sort of Mutants, which leads the wild Mutants for one purpose: to infect other living creatures to join their company. Stand on the side of Mutants and infects all who breathe clean air!


Bots

During the World War III, people experimented with dynamic artificial intelligence. The result was the emergence of the first robots with fully dynamic AI, but, as it turned out, was a huge mistake. Thanks to dynamic AI robots able to live its own life and began to desire to annihilation of their creators. "Bots", as they were called in short, occupy most of factories and abandoned industrial zones. Bots are great specialists in the fight against superiority of opponents, because of their defensive abilities and are equipped with destructive weapons. Lead Bots and smash all enemies in the dust!


Humans

Humans represent apparently the weakest race, but they profit from the knowledge of terrain and cities. During and after the World War III, Humans had to hide in underground fallout shelters and subway stations. Larger groups defend desperately every meter of underground basis, which are still declining. Others often set off on the surface and looking for usable supplies and everything that could be used to increase their chances to survive. There are also loners who wander the devastated country and combat face to face with their opponents. Connect to people who struggle to survive and use their greatest strength – the fight from a distance!


Short characteristic


The game combines card and board game.
Recommended player’s age 14+.
Playing time 15-30 minutes.
The game is completely in English.
3 types of cards – Units, Locations and Events.
4 types of races – Aliens, Bots, Humans and Mutants, that can be played separately or creating own decks.
3 game modes – Classic game, Artifact game and Two on two variant.
Each round is divided into six phases – Playing Units, Moving Units on the Game board, Survey the terrain, Battle, Dominance on the battleground and Drawing cards.
Regularly issued expansions cards, called "Survival packs".

183382.name: Adventures Unlimited (Issue 6 - Summer 1996)
rpgissuearticle: Bloodlines: Clans of the Far East
A Slice of Life (or An Order of the Gods)
183382.description:
Adventures Unlimited
Issue 6
Summer 1996

Bundled with collectible cards for Sim City and On the Edge

183383.name: Happy Holidays!
183383.description:
Happy Holidays is a small-box, kid-friendly party game about giving good gifts and horrible gifts.

-The game takes place in rounds. Each round, one player is the Gift-Recipient and the others are Gift-Givers.

-The Gift-Givers submit cards from their hands with gifts on them.

-The Gift-Recipient chooses which gift she likes most and which she likes least, and the players who submitted them keep those cards as points.

-First player to 5 points wins.

It's a very simple game which can be played and enjoyed by anyone.
￼￼

183384.description: The Earth Genasi Fighter Owain Montis is the competitive prize for Month 1 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Elemental Evil. The prize includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
183384.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Earth Genasi Fighter Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

183385.name: Stonehorn
183385.description:
Publisher blurb:

Leaping from impossible perch to seemingly sheer cliff is the stonehorn, a mighty beast that is to goats what dire wolves are to normal wolves. These four-horned, pony-sized animals reach the highest of peaks and consume the salt and other minerals they crave imbedded in the stone of the mountains. Though they are not predatory, they do not hesitate to defend their territory and their young with vicious stone horns completely infused with the minerals they consume.

Mountain Terrors: Stonehorn is a bestiary PDF for the Chronicle System, the rules engine that powers our popular A Song of Ice & Fire Roleplaying game.

183387.name: Draw 4: Dig for Dinos
183387.description: In Draw 4: Dig for Dinos, you are a paleontologist digging through the dirt on an expedition to complete your dinosaur bone collection! Players try to collect complete sets of dinosaur bones by taking turns picking either an Action Tile or Dinosaur Tile from the grid, while collecting cards may be limited by their location or by another player's actions! Expose and collect the most dinosaur bones and become a world-renowned paleontologist!

183388.description:
The Protocol Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 1, "Shockwave," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Temporal Cold War. It is considered a Resource and costs 5 squadron points.

When using the resource, you are granted three abilities of which you may do one of per round with any one of your ships. You may a) place 2 tokens instead of one when performing an Evade, Scan or Battle Stations action, b) prevent your ship from being Target Locked on the round it Cloaks, or c) use a 3 Forward Maneuver template when performing a Sensor Echo.
183388.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Protocol Resource
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

183389.description:
The Advanced Technology Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 2, "Future Tense," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Temporal Cold War. It is considered a Resource and costs 5 squadron points.

When using this resource, during the Activation Phase, any ship in your fleet may:

1) Disable 1 of it's Tech upgrades to perform any Action on its Action Bar as a free Action. OR

2) Discard 1 of it's already disabled Tech upgrades to perform an Action on its Action Bar as a free Action.

A ship may not perform any other free Actions the round it uses this ability.
183389.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Advanced Technology Resource
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

183390.description: Main Power Grid Cards are a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 3, "Zero Hour," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Temporal Cold War. It is considered a Resource and costs a variable number of squadron points.
183390.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Main Power Grid Resource
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

183391.name: Akuma-kun: Makai no Wana
183391.description:
User Summary

JRPG based on the manga of the same name. Game has parts that are typical top-down Dragon Quest perspective and side scrolling similar to Zelda II.

183392.description: This card pack is the grand prize for the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, the Temporal Cold War. It consists of 4 Upgrades, 1 Captain and 2 Additional Rules cards.
183392.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Temporal Cold War Card Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

183393.name: Broken Urthe World Guide
183393.description:
From the producer's website:

The Broken Urthe - World Guide is a supplement to the Broken Urthe role-playing game. This books contains some more information on Urthe as well as new vehicles, artifacts, items, and many robots to use in your games. This supplement also provides rules to make mutants for characters to become, like humanoid insects or animals. Included are tables to create encounters based on habitat or terrain, along with some traps to add danger to your adventures.

183394.description:
In Viticulture, the players find themselves in the roles of people in rustic, pre-modern Tuscany who have inherited meager vineyards. They have a few plots of land, an old crushpad, a tiny cellar, and three workers. They each have a dream of being the first to call their winery a true success.

The players are in the position of determining how they want to allocate their workers throughout the year. Every season is different on a vineyard, so the workers have different tasks they can take care of in the summer and winter. There's competition over those tasks, and often the first worker to get to the job has an advantage over subsequent workers.

Fortunately for the players, people love to visit wineries, and it just so happens that many of those visitors are willing to help out around the vineyard when they visit as long as you assign a worker to take care of them. Their visits (in the form of cards) are brief but can be very helpful.

Using those workers and visitors, players can expand their vineyards by building structures, planting vines (vine cards), and filling wine orders (wine order cards). Players work towards the goal of running the most successful winery in Tuscany.

Viticulture - Essential Edition comes with components for Viticulture, but adds some of the expansions from Tuscany, including 36 Mama & Papa cards, Field cards (previously known as "Properties"), expanded/revised Visitors, and 24 Automa cards (solo variant), along with a couple of minor rule changes.

Card Totals

The Viticulture Essential Edition contains 154 cards at the 44 x 67 mm size and 88 cards at the 63 x 88 mm size.
183394.name: Viticulture Essential Edition
boardgamepodcastepisode: #19: Viticulture on tap, Quadropolis & TableTop Day
#30: Stephen Buonocore interview; The Dragon & Flagon on tap; Dice City & Viticulture
#45: Six-Player Six Pack; Las Vegas on tap; Barcelona; Mystic Vale; Betrayal at the Brewery on the Hill
ba005 – Altes Dorf in neuen Schläuchen
Episode 17: The one about terraforming mystics, iconography, cults of the new
Episode 2: San Juan, Viticulture, Thebes, Agility, Myrmes
Episode 41 - Viticulture Essential Edition BA Holiday Special
Episode 49 - Star Wars: Rebellion Two Year Anniversary
Episode 50 :: Top 20 Board Games of All-Time + Big Bad Celebration Giveaway
MOBG Podcast 37: 500 Games of Summer.
Podcast EP09 – Jeux « Filler » et Café l’Aléa
Podcast EP10 – Top 10 jeux de société
Podcast EP13 – Suggestions de cadeaux de Noël

183395.name: Broken Urthe Creature Guide
183395.description:
From the publisher's website:

The Broken Urthe - Creature Guide is a supplement to the Broken Urthe role-playing game. This book contains 300 creatures you can use in your adventures.

183396.name: Dragon Age: Inquisition – Trespasser
183396.description:
User Summary

Trespasser acts as an epilogue to the main game. It tells an entirely new story, set two years after the main game. The story explores what it's like to be a world-saving organization when the world no longer needs saving.

183397.name: Queen of Bones
183397.description:
From the Introduction:

For BX-BECMI Characters Levels 12-16

No frills, here. No fancy charts and tables. No art to dazzle your eyes. Just a crawl; that happens to have a bit of a background, and a (group)death-dealing Bad Ass! waiting for the characters. How you run it is your business. What you delete, exchange out/in or modify is up to you. You can be as kind and patient with the players as you like, or let the chips fall (dice roll) where they may. You can allow pre-rolled characters, provide pre-gens yourself, or let the players bring their own, favorite character they have worked hard to get to the levels indicated; reminding them, if the latter, that character-death is part of the game! I issue only the following comment: if run as it is laid out, it is nearly certain that at least one character, and as many as all of them, might die during the adventure.

183398.name: Cheesy
183398.description:
The central character in this game is a mouse called Cheesy, who is trapped inside Dr Chem's castle where he must walk the treadmill to provide power for the mad scientist's genetic experiments.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cheesy (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

183399.name: Snow White and the 7 Clever Boys
183399.description:
User Summary

A poorly made game that was purposefully made to resemble the Disney Snow White.

183400.description:
Description from the publisher:

Yiiiiippy! In toy wonderland, the mischievous little kobolds swipe everything in their reach. Who wants to join them by collecting toys in different shapes and colors? But not so fast! You have to pay close attention and be able to "see" with your hands because the toys could be hidden in the bag or the kobold cave.

Whoever is the fastest to collect four different shaped toys and colors in Silly Shenanigans wins this crazy toy hunt and is crowned the "Lord of all the Kobolds".
183400.name: Silly Shenanigans

183401.description:
Description from the publisher:

All of the castle residents are fast asleep and do not notice the nimble robber sneaking around the walls. Only the twelve guardians of the legendary castle's treasure do not sleep — or perhaps they nap just for a moment? Whoever catches the two guards sleeping in Sleepy Castle can steal the guarded treasures, but you have to be clever to manage it...
183401.name: Sleepy Castle

183402.description:
Description from the publisher:

The final frontier of space...and in the middle of it brave pilots are exploring distance planets and galaxies in their spaceships. But will the emitted cube probe meet the intended target? And will the fuel crystals be powerful enough to make the journey to the next planet? Only those who skilfully aim and roll the die in the dice and discovery game Space Planets will be able to score points in the end and collect the coveted explorer stars.
183402.name: Space Planets
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 78- My Village and GenCon 2016 Preview

183403.name: Monster Menu
183403.description:
Description from the publisher:

Time for a feast! The two monsters are particularly hungry again today. But be careful! The two gluttons may be fed only once! So Monster Menu is all about cleverly deciding how to distribute your cards. Who will be the best at pampering the monsters by feeding them the most matching food cards, and thus collecting the most points?

183404.description:
In A Bind Jr invites you to make funny poses and animal noises. Each card has an instruction, e.g., "one finger touching ear", "this card on a shoulder", or "whenever you draw, trumpet like an elephant". If you forget to do one of these instructions (or can't), you get a warning; three warnings and you lose the game. The goal is survival!

In A Bind Jr works like In A Bind+expansions, but with bright colors, simplified instructions, and some modified triggered binds. In addition to the default mode, there are also rules for team-based or co-operative play.
183404.name: In A Bind Jr

183405.description:
Midnight at Arcane Academy, yet the apprentice wizards are far from their beds. They have slipped away under cover of the soft autumn shadow to the woods where whispered spells conjure a campfire away from prying eyes. Huddled around the flames with a bottle of starmead, the young wizards play a game. Someone casts a fragment of elemental flame into the midnight sky, whoever conjures that mote into the most powerful mythical creatures is the winner. This is Ember.

Ember is game where you draw cards each turn to make "hands" which you then discard to conjure (purchase) mystical creatures.

But if you think it's THAT simple, it's not. The complexity comes from the configuration of creatures, who has what, and when the final call to end the game comes... it's not always clear who is the winner.

Ember comes complete with 52 suit cards, 30 creature cards and 3 Archmage cards.
183405.name: Ember: the Magical Card Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 23 - Love, Ember & Arkham Horror

183407.name: Halo: Fleet Battles – UNSC Fleet Box
183407.description:
Few in the upper-echelons of the UNSC are as respected as Admiral Lord Hood. As a veteran of numerous military campaigns throughout his military career, Hood is an outstanding choice to lead your fleet to victory. Supported by the Artificial Intelligence Cortana, one of the most potent and valuable assets in humanity’s arsenal, your fleet will ensure the Covenant pays a heavy price in ships and soldiers.

This is an ideal way to upgrade an existing UNSC force or begin building your brand new fleet. Within this boxed set you will find two Epoch-class Heavy Carriers, four Marathon-class Heavy Cruisers and thirty Paris-class Frigates. Armed with Light MACs and an array of impressive missile batteries, the Epoch is able to deploy both Bombers and Interceptors into the heat of battle. Marathon Heavy Cruisers are your bulk heavy hitters, commonly fielded in Battle Groups with Paris-class Frigates in either Arrowhead or Trident Formation.

183408.name: Halo: Fleet Battles – Covenant Fleet Box
183408.description:
A giant even amongst the Sangheili, Xytan ‘Jar Wattinree is revered by his comrades for his incredible prowess in battle. Supported by the Minister of Etiology, a minor Prophet in the Covenant during the Human-Covenant war, this fleet delivers the leadership needed to harness a tireless religious zeal that will eventually lead to the Fall of Reach.

This is an ideal way to upgrade an existing Covenant force or begin building your brand new fleet. Within this boxed set you will find two ORS Heavy Cruisers, two CCS-class Battlecruisers and sixteen SDV Heavy Corvettes. Armed with a host of plasma-based weaponry, the ORS and CCS are able to launch both Bombers and Interceptors directly into the heart of battle. Supported by SDV Heavy Corvettes, watch your heavy vessels lay down overwhelming weapons fire and obliterate your enemy.

183409.name: Open Sea Fishing: The Simulation
183409.description:
User Summary

Fishing simulator where you manage your boat, crew, finances. And catch fish!

The fishing itself is quite simplistic, as you just have to lower your nets, hooks or whatever, and steer over the large green circles in the ocean. When you do that, you'll your weight counter of caught fish running up. So in that regard, it's definitely a notch or two easier than in reality.

183410.name: Karma Crystals: Move Master
183410.description:
Focus On Your Karma Path And Collect Elemental Matches!

You can travel down life through good deeds or bad deeds, but karma will follow you either way. In Move Master, your best tactic is to collect that bad karma now and give it to your opponents to get the win.

This 3rd entry into the Karma Crystals game collection adds the use of elemental shards with move shards to gain movement and 12 new monster elemental cards for your collector’s deck!

Your mission is to gain as many moves forward down the karma path, collect elemental shards and be nice to other opponents so they don’t pass their Karma Crystals to you.

Roll dice to work with the various monster elemental cards - monsters are the good guys and help you win! Determine how many karma moves you score per roll and collect your karma move shards. Your move match also earns you an elemental shard, but if you get more of one type, you get to pass a Karma Crystal to another player. Your opponents also get Karma Crystals through a no-match roll, and you will get those too! When you get 11 or more karma moves, that triggers the end the game and the winner is determined at the end of that round!

In addition to the unique dice matching game mechanic, a unique auto player system is also used to facilitate up to EIGHT total players per game. The game also provides an easy way to track multiple game wins for playoffs in case you have more than 15 to 20 minutes to play. No paper score cards and pencil needed - just move and elemental shards, and of course, Karma Crystals to track and build your score!

183412.description:
While the base game of Operation: Dandelion is an easy to teach gateway game for families and even children, it might lack the tough choices and challenges a more serious gamer expects. Brigade Morning Sun is aimed at more experienced players who want to spice up their game a bit.

It offers 4 modules that can be combined with the base game as the players like it. Those modules offer player powers, challenging events and growing crops.
183412.name: Operation: Dandelion – Brigade Morning Sun

183413.name: Lucidaze
183413.description:
Fight to awaken from the maze that is your consciousness as you battle against your darkest fears.
But, beware, there is always a player trying to stop you! Yes, The Sandman will manipulate traps, conjure fears and even shifts the maze itself to confuse, deter and eventually kill you!

Choose from 4 Wanderers, each with a special ability, and embark on this dream-bending adventure.

One will wake or all will die.

Gameplay:

One player plays as The Sandman. They initially set up the layout of the maze, choose player spawn points, chest locations and where the Mind Fragments are. Throughout the game the player draws cards to spawn monsters, set traps and even re-arrange the maze itself. This player also controls any monsters in the maze and can attack the other players.

Each other player is a Wanderer. They must move around the maze, controlled by The Sandman to collect chests and Mind Fragments. The loot from chests, or from killing the other Wanderers, is used to strengthen the player, such that they can collect all four mind fragments for themselves and win. If all Wanderers die in the maze, The Sandman wins

183414.name: Yura Yura Cafe
183414.description:
This game is actually a game collection. It hosts 4 games and 2 additional variants for one of them.

1.Yura Yura Balance Café
This is the main game the components can be played with. You have a stack of cards that represent coffee orders, several coffee “ingredients” and a playing area, which is a tablet on a dome shaped foot. The name part “balance” comes from the way it’s played. You draw a card from the deck which tells you, if you need to place a straight coffee, a coffee-to-go, a Milk Coffee or one of the 2 Macchiato versions on the tablet. There is a grid on said tablet to determine the places where you can, but on a coffee to go you can stack another coffee if you like. Whoever tips the tablet over loses. Besides the usual red cards, there are also green ones in the deck. These give you the opportunity to order somebody else to place the coffee (with a green cup), of course on their own risk.

2.Speed Order Café
This speed game needs at least 2 baristas and 1 customer. The customer shuffles the deck of cards and pulls 5 into her hand. She than reads them aloud to the baristas. After all 5 orders are read the customer gives the start sign, and all baristas start to assemble the coffees in order. Whoever is fastest stops the game. If she is correct on all coffees she wins, otherwise the win goes to the next most complete and errorless contender.

3.Black and Milk Reversi
This is just Othello played with the components of the game.

4.Coffee Cup Tower
This is a stacking game were 2 or more players (Variant A/B) are stacking Black Coffee cups and Coffee-To-Go’s as high as possible. The variants are differentiated by the footprint of the initial layer. First Player to tip the tower loses.

183415.description:
"A smell of blood, fire and electricity roams the dark and moist corridors. An epic battle is taking place! The mighty wizard lifts his staff, looking down on his fallen Warrior – we have a new fighter, a new hero, a new Master!"

Mastery: Become a Hero is a fantasy adventure card game that combines the dynamics of a three-dimensional board game with the strategy, speed and excitement of simultaneous battles.

In this world, you are an adventurer seeking fame and riches. In this first version of the game, you will have a warrior and a magician. Later, there will be several classes added to the game. When choosing your class, chose the one that most represents you as a character. Each class has its own completely unique combat style, that has some vital statistics which will influence the performance during battle.

Cards are the key element in Mastery: Become a Hero. Careful selection of the cards when constructing your deck will allow you to create complex and devastating strategies. Mastery cards belong to three types/categories:

1. Actions and Magic: these are the cards used to construct your deck, they characterize your characters combat style and skill.
2. Objects: treasures that you will collect through out Mastery – become a hero. They influence your combat strategies but you cannot include them in your deck: they are placed, face down, beside the game table.
3. Equipment: weapons and armor. They have special effects which influence your strategies. As with Objects, they cannot be part of your deck: they are instead placed, face up, beside the game table.

Each match round takes place through five simultaneous phases; Turn's beginning › Card drawing › Movement › Combat › Turn's End. You have to choose you cards for the whole combat round in advance and your cannot change any cards after the round has started. In the world of Mastery, the deck is representing your character profile. Constructing your character profile is here summarized within these three rules:

1. The character profile must be formed by no less than 30 cards and no more than 50.
2. You can only include cards marked with the class your character belongs to (exceptions are possible on some game variations).
3. Object and Equipment cards should not be part of your deck. But you can choose and bring with you to a match 2 object cards, placed down beside the board. You can freely select Equipment cards as long as the total number of occupancy (parameter written on the Equipment card) for all the equipment chosen is equal to or less than 5.

The combat rounds continue until either of the champions has fallen and the winner has become a hero!
183415.name: Mastery: Become a Hero

183416.name: Unusual Townsfolk
183416.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are common villagers and then there are unusual townfolk. This book contains five such characters for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game (Level 3-5). Among them are an orphan who hears the voice of her parents, a conman on the run from the law, and a talented entertainer looking for a powerful patron to help her career. These five individuals are ready to be allies, enemies, or even bounties for your home campaign.

183417.name: The Unique Shopkeeper
183417.description:
From publisher blurb:

Zydrek represents a sample of the upcoming Extras! line by D3 Adventures. He is a 9th level ratfolk witch working for a powerful bronze dragon. He watches for threats, listening to his adventuring clientele, and acts upon them if needed by either confronting the evil himself or fowarding the information to the Lord of Thunder for him to deal with.

To most people, however, Zydrek is a simple shopkeeper and alchemist who makes custom potions and other minor magical items. He sells to the wealthy and adventurers by day, and helps the poor by night.

183419.name: Ladybug Dice Game
183419.description: Ladybugs eat aphids, be the first player to roll the dice and eat 5,000 aphids for victory. Eat fast and win!

183420.description:
If you hung around your local zoo after it closed for the night, you'd see the nighttime rituals of the exotic animals you visited during the day. You'd see cages being cleaned and souvenir stands being restocked. If you were lucky, you might catch an impromptu seal show or moonlight nightingale concert.

And if you stayed late enough, long after the last employee had left for the night, you just might see the greatest, and most secret, of all zoo attractions—the late-night Kung Fu fights!

Welcome to Kung Fu Zoo!

Kung Fu Zoo is a dice-flicking dexterity game for 2-4 players. You control a team of highly-trained animals, from crocodiles to zebras, in a Kung Fu battle against your rivals. Who will be tonight’s champions of the zoo? Grab some dice and find out!

In Kung Fu Zoo, players use six-sided animal dice to do battle in an enclosed arena. There are two gameplay variants: Cage Battle and Points Match. In either variant, players start with a team of dice-animals. But the similarities stop there. In a Cage Battle, players take turns flicking their animals into the arena. Your goal is to knock your opponent’s animals onto their backs (stunning them) or through holes on the board (the “cages”). You win the match when all of your opponent’s animals are stunned or in cages. The first player to win three matches wins! In a Points Match, players take turns flicking their animals into the arena. Your goal is to score 21 points before your opponent. Points are awarded at the end of each round, based upon the position of your dice that are left on the board.
183420.name: Kung Fu Zoo
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 022 – Origins 2016
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 036 – Blood Rage vs Scythe

183421.description: The Air Elemental Zephrylos is the competitive prize for Month 2 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Elemental Evil. The prize includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
183421.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Air Elemental Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

183422.name: Brutal Force
183422.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Brutal Force is a shooter with levels that are randomly placed in the overworld, changing your experience each play.

183423.name: Bloody Forks of the Ohio
rpg: The Bloody Forks of the Ohio
183423.description:
From the introduction:

A live-action roleplaying scenario adapted from the tabletop scenario.

In 1753, a young George Washington was sent into western Pennsylvania as a diplomatic envoy to the French army. His message from the British crown was claim of ownership over the region. If the French did not exit the area, the British would force them out.

The French disregarded the message, and forced the British army from its fort at the forks of the Ohio River. In its place, the French have built their own base, Fort Duquesne. Now it is a year later, and Washington has returned to settle the matter once and for all.

183424.name: Tesla Girl
183424.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mistress of steampunk! The harnesser of lightning! The genius of a new age of technology! And she’s only in grade school! A true super-genius who’s on her way to becoming a serious threat and seriously evil! Will the heroes treat her as a joke or offer some guidance? Their choice could make a big difference!

183425.name: Alchemistress
183425.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the last moments of life, the original Alchemistress created a daughter out of pure will and surrounding matter. This daughter believed herself to be a goddess, capable of disassembling and reassembling matter as she sees fit. She wants nothing less than to be worshipped and will stop at nothing to get what she wants.

183426.name: S.E.L.F.I.E.
183426.description:
From publisher blurb:

Originally a robot created by a young prodigy to offer online advice and reviews to get his social channels more subscribers, but quickly changed to become a thieving robot in order to draw in even more viewers. How long before S.E.L.F.I.E.’s viewers insist she try to take on a hero?

183427.name: Adventure Shorts Volume One, Second Edition
183427.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure shorts volume one is a series of short encounters, written for the new fifth edition of the world's most popular roleplaying game. Our encounters are written for those playing at a beginning level that might appreciate something they can just jump into for a one or two-hour gaming session. They can be played as stand-alone encounters or dropped into an existing adventure or campaign.

Each encounter includes a few monsters, traps, obstacles and treasure to get your new fifth edition characters started. Each one also includes a map that can be used to set up your own player grid. The encounter titles are as follows:

Forgotten Tomb
Ambush
Abandoned Mine
Old Cottage
Black Tower

183428.name: Adventure Shorts, Volume Two
183428.description:
From publisher blurb:

What if while planning a route to their next objective your player characters discover another route that they’re told will save them a day’s travel time? Would they take it? They might have a pleasant walk through a little-traveled area of the woods, or they might discover the Cult of Myrkul waiting for them.

Adventure shorts volume two contains two encounters, written for fifth edition of the world's most popular roleplaying game. The first encounter, Shortcut, can be played as a stand-alone or as a lead-in to the second more detailed encounter, Obsidian Temple. We’re trying something new this time by providing balanced encounters and treasure for a party of five characters from levels two through five. If played together the encounters are expected to last for about a two or three-hour gaming session.

As in Adventure Shorts Volume One, these encounters include enemy NPCs, monsters, traps, obstacles and treasure to challenge your players’ fifth edition characters. Along with each encounter is a map that can be used to set up your own player grid. The encounter titles are as follows:

Shortcut
Obsidian Temple

183429.name: Forgotten Tomb (5E)
183429.description:
From publisher blurb:

We’re excited to offer Forgotten Tomb as a free introduction to Adventure Shorts, Volume 1. This short encounter, written for the fifth edition of the world’s most popular role playing game, can be played as a stand-alone encounter or dropped into an existing adventure or campaign. The encounter is for those playing at a beginning level and might appreciate something they can just jump into for a one or two-hour gaming session.

We’ve included a few monsters, traps and treasure to get your new characters started. The encounter also includes a map that can be used to set up your own player grid.

183430.name: Blackstone Tomb
183430.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Halls of Blackstone Tomb Lay Desecrated, and Haunted

In the depths of Black Mountain there’s a secret. Hidden for a generation Castle Blackstone’s Tomb lies waiting for redemption.

Years ago a dark wizard used the tomb to practice his evil magic. He desecrated the resting place of Castle Blackstone’s heroes and used their bodies, practicing spells to reanimate the dead. When his crimes were discovered, Southern Realm soldiers captured him, but not before many of them died. The few who survived worked to seal the tomb and keep it a secret.

It’s up to your adventurers to discover the secret, bring the tomb back to light and restore the honor of those who still rest there.

Blackstone Tomb is a full-length adventure written for five level one characters using rules from the fifth edition of the world’s most popular role playing game. It features numerous encounters with rich narrative descriptions, secret codes to decipher, riddles to solve and a story line that leads to the tomb itself. There are also a number of detailed maps included to add a rich visual experience for the players and assist the game master in setting up player grids.

The adventure takes place in a small corner of a country called the Southern Realm in a campaign setting of our own design, a continent we call the Lands of Arvum. The continent is home to diverse landscapes, countries with rich histories, people of varied races and many fantastic creatures. And for those with a stout heart, it’s a place that promises to be a land of adventure.

183431.description:
Mysterium expansion contains 78 new cards:
42 dreams
6x2 persons
6x2 places
6x2 items
183431.name: Mysterium Hidden Signs

183432.name: Hellweg westfalicus: Marktflecken
183432.description: Hellweg westfalicus: Marktflecken is a postcard mini-expansion for Hellweg westfalicus.

183433.name: Scourge
183433.description:
From publisher blurb:

SCOURGE!
Welcome to Acts of Villainy #100! Raised to be an assassin, the villainess Scourge wasn't satisfied serving others. After a near-death accident that gave her strange powers, she decided to take control of her life and form V.I.L.E.! This issue not only includes her write-up, but also the organization that she controls!

183434.name: Animech
183434.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you dare stand before the unbridled fury unleashed by a Cybersamurai of the Digital Daimyo and wandering champion of the people against the Iron Kaiju of the Sinister Silicon Shogun?

Or, the delusional metahuman psi who thinks that's what she is, anyway? Animech is the name given this powerful (and deranged) meta, a young woman that generates a mech around her, right out of an anime up to and including the sound effects. Just because those giant metal fists are really a psionic construction doesn't mean they don't pack the same punch as, well, real giant metal fists...

Animech is a PL 11 threat to add to your Mutants & Masterminds campaign.

183435.name: Zooloretto Würfelspiel: Baby Boom
183435.description: Zooloretto Würfelspiel: Baby Boom has been announced as an expansion. It is scheduled for autumn 2016 according to the publisher.

183436.name: Klikt het?
183436.description:
A game with multiple choice questions where you have to guess which answer someone else would give. A handheld electronic buzzer-object will tell you if the answer is correct or not. If answered correctly, you get to draw another card, and the first person to get ten correct answers is the winner.

So each turn, you draw a card and ask the question and answers on it (for example, "what would you take out of a burning house?" A my pet, B photo album, C diary or D hairgel and facial cream). The player to your left has one electronic object, you hold the other. Choose the letter that corresponds to the answer you think that person would give and hold the two objects together. If answered correctly, there should be a buzzing sound.

You get to know each other a little better, and the best "mind reader" wins.

183437.name: Universal Adventures Expansion Pack: Chamber of Bones
183437.description:
From publisher blurb:

The scrape of bones on stone and creak of old leather echoes off the walls as a skeleton clad in rusted mail begins to rise off the floor.

Explore the Chamber of Bones, if your dare. Search for lost treasure amid the bones and debris, but beware of what lurks beyond the edge of your light. The first expansion pack for the Adventure Module, Chamber of Blood, Universal Adventures Chamber of Bones brings you 9 cards for use with the Chamber of Bones area, or a similar area of your own choice. Add new depths of danger to your Universal Adventures with the Chamber of Bones!

183438.name: Kreaturen der Nacht
183438.description:
Regelergänzung für das Warhammer FRP

Aus der Einführung:

In den Wäldern, auf den Ebenen und Bergen und in den Wüsten der Old World gibt es Kreaturen, Ungeheuer und Wesen von denen die wenigsten Menschen etwas ahnen... und wenn doch, dann tauchen diese Geschöpfe allenfalls in ihren schlimmsten Alpträumen auf.

183439.name: Mord im Kloster
183439.description:
Ein Abenteuer für das Warhammer FRP

Aus der Einführung:

Abgelegen in den Grey Mountains liegt ein altes Kloster, das sich der Wahrung des Wissens verschrieben hat. In seinen Kellergewölben lagern die unzähligen, namenlosen Schätze aus vielen Kreuzzügen gegen Araby, in seinem massigen Turm befindet sich eine Bibliothek, die ihresgleichen sucht. Die umliegenden Dörfer sind arm, da der Unterhalt dieses Klosters sehr viel Gold kostet und die Mönche sich kaum um weltliche Dinge kümmern, sondern völlig weltfremd ihre Wissensschätze hüten.

183440.name: Museum des Wahnsinns
183440.description:
Ein Abenteuer für das Warhammer FRP

Aus der Einführung:

Die Abenteurer erhalten einen brief in einem äußerst edlen und teuer wirkenden Umschlag, in dem sie herzlich dazu eingeladen werden, zusammen mit anderen Gästen aus der Adelsschicht und einigen reichen Kaufleuten aus Nuln und dem gesamten Empire an der Eröffnung des Museums und Zoos von Adalbert Aulenbacher teilzunehmen!

183441.name: A Game of Gnomes
183441.description:
Description from the publisher:

You are a gnome — small in stature but large in heart. Your craving for adventure is matched only by your desire for treasure and your love of mushrooms. You are a fun guy (ahem).

Anyway, it's time to leave the protection of your beautiful gnomehome and seek your fortune in faraway places. Gnome and away. Will you sail a leaf boat down the river, climb Mount Gnome, and pick the rare but valuable Montane King mushroom? Or visit the frightening Sorcerer and carry out his quests? Or just buy and sell mushrooms, wear sensible footwear, and travel the known world? Perhaps a proper basket and a proper rucksack are in order?

It's time to fix your pointy hat. It's time to comb your beard. It's time to ready your pond pipes. It's time for...A Game of Gnomes.

Winter is numbing...

183442.name: Renowned Explorers: International Society
183442.description:
User Summary

As a member of the Renowned Explorer Society, your team must explore various mysterious places in order to gain the most fame among all the society's members.

The game mixes board game-like exploration, risk-reward decisions in the form of classic dice rolls and tactical battles that are reminiscent of the Heroes of Might and Magic Series. Renowned Explorers also features light RPG elements in the form of improvable stats and inventory management.

183443.name: Penny Arcade (1979)
videogameversion: North American Apple II Cassette Edition
183443.description:
User Summary

The object of the game is to get the ball in your opponents goal. Do this five times and you win!

This version of Pong has four different “tables”, ball speed and gravity options.

183444.name: The Truth About Dungeons & Dragons
183444.description:
(from the back cover)

Psychologists have claimed, time and again, that when someone lives in the realm of fantasy for an extended length of time, the lines dividing fantasy and reality become distorted, fuzzy.

In the last decade, the concept of "fantasy living" has been proven to be a real and increasing danger. The contributing force behind it for many youths has been Dungeons & Dragons and other fantasy roleplaying games.

You need to read this book...if you, or anyone you know, are involved in Dungeons & Dragons or other fantasy role-playing games.

183445.description: This ship is the competitive prize for "The Void" episode Organized Play event.
183445.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.R.W. T'Met
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

183446.description: This ship is the competitive prize for the "The Doomsday Machine" episode Organized Play event.
183446.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Constellation Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

183447.description:
Dice Drivin' is a tiny racing game, with a track comprised of cards. To advance on the track, players throw customized dice, choosing (wisely) how many and which kind of dice as every track card has different requirements that must be met in order to advance. Players also have action cards to use at opportune times.

Set up a new track each time you play for new challenges!
183447.name: Dice Drivin'

183448.name: Think in a Blink Need to Know Knowledge
183448.description:
Think in a Blink is a fun, interactive safety and ethical trivia game designed to teach children how to stay safe and to be kind.

Think in a Blink is an interactive family game where children "laugh while they learn." With humorous questions and brilliant illustration, Think in a Blink empowers children with "need to know knowledge" so they can respond safely and appropriately to life's detours.

In this edition of Think in a Blink there are four destination areas: Home, School, Recreation and Shopping. Each area is color coded and has 16 spaces for questions. The player/team rolls the number-die and moves the number spaces indicated. When a player reaches the middle he collects the souvenir piece for that location.

Object of the game:
To answer the questions correctly and collect all 4 souvenir pieces. The player or team that collects all 4-souvenir pieces first is the winner.

183449.description:
Duel List is a competitive knowledge listing game in which players simultaneously list as many items in a topic as they can in 60 seconds on a piece of paper.

Gameplay: On a turn, the active player picks one of the 9 knowledge decks and rolls 2 dice. 1st die chooses category, 2nd die chooses specific topic. Players have 60 seconds to list as many items as they can in that topic on a piece of paper. Once the time is up, the active player starts to list out the items they wrote. Players list out their answers in clockwise order, scoring as needed. If any other player shared an answer, every player score 1 point for that answer. Otherwise, the player receives 2 points for every valid, unique answer.

End of game: Once every player has had the chance to be the active player and choose a knowledge deck, then the game is over. Count up points, whoever has the most points wins.
183449.name: Duel List
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 21: Steam Works And Duel Lists

183450.description:
Description from the publisher:

The wonderful thing about living in the glorious Age of Steam is the way that we can marry traditional randomizers, such as dice, with the new power of SCIENCE!

In addition to six d6s, Munchkin Steampunk: SCIENCE! Dice includes four new cards for Munchkin Steampunk!
183450.name: Munchkin Steampunk: SCIENCE! Dice

183451.name: Family Computer Disk System
183451.description:
a peripheral for the Nintendo Family Computer console in Japan. It uses proprietary floppy disks (called "Disk Cards") for data storage.[1] It was announced, but not released, for the North American/PAL Nintendo Entertainment System. Through its entire production span, 1986–2003, 4.44 million units were sold.

The device is connected to the Famicom deck by plugging a special cartridge known as the RAM Adapter into the system's cartridge port, and attaching that cartridge's cable to the disk drive.

Source: Wikipedia, "Family Computer Disk System", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

183452.name: Quickpick: Island of Monster Masks
183452.description:
Description from the publisher:

Quickpick: Island of Monster Masks is the first game of a new line presenting innovative gameplay based on the ability of choosing and taking actions quickly, using different perception skills, such as recognition of expressions and sounds.

In Island of Monster Masks, players arrive at an island inhabited by strange creatures and began to fit in by wearing big masks themselves, but then they can no longer recognize one another among the island inhabitants.

The gameplay combines pattern recognition, dexterity, and simultaneous action mechanisms. The mime draws a Mask card and imitates the face shown, while the other players try to guess which Monster he is acting out. If a player guessed correctly, he and the mime collect a Mask. The winner is the player who collects the most masks during the game.

183453.description:
Promotional mini game version of Carcassonne. Contained in the 999 games 25th anniversary box.

The game is only playable with two players and contains 20 smaller tiles and 8 smaller meeples in red and blue. The rules are the same as the original game excluding the farmer rule.

A summary of the rules is printed on the inside of the box. No score track is provided.

The tiles feature the new art style introduced in 2014.
183453.name: Carcassonne: Probeerspel

183454.name: The Raven Braid
183454.description:
From the back cover

The first full length adventure set in the antediluvian world of ATLANTIS!

“Your children who follow you in later generations and foreigners who come from distant lands will see the calamities that have fallen on the land and the diseases with which the lord has afflicted it. The whole land will be a burning waste of salt and sulfur—nothing planted, nothing sprouting, no vegetation growing on it”

THE RAVEN BRAID
An infernal hunger spreads across the lands consuming
everything in its path.

► A full length adventure that span the Turani plains
► Complete non-player character write ups
► Chaotic Combat scenarios
► And much, much more.

183455.name: Riptide GP
183455.description:
Riptide GP® is the first ever console-quality water racing game for mobile!

Rev up your supercharged hydro jet and take a wild ride through twisting canals and rivers, futuristic cityscapes, and mysterious research facilities. Skill, stunts, and speed will be your best allies as you grab massive air off huge waves, kick out death-defying tricks, and boost your hydro jet to victory across a dynamic, ever-changing torrent of foam and spray.

Designed from the ground up to take full advantage the latest mobile hardware, Riptide GP features super-realistic water physics, real-time reflections, and gorgeous high-detail vehicles and environments.

GAME FEATURES
12 twisting, futuristic water raceways
7 screaming fast hydro jets
3 game modes: Race, Hot Lap, and Championship
Grab massive air and perform dramatic stunts to earn boost
Alter your environment mid-race with interactive triggers
Earn Achievements, post to Leaderboards with integrated Swarm support on Android/iOS, Scoreloop on BlackBerry, and GameCenter support on iOS
Easy and fun to pick up and play – delightfully challenging to master

Source: The Publisher Website.

183456.name: Riptide GP: Renegade
183456.description:
Riptide GP: Renegade drops players into a futuristic world of illicit hydro jet racing, where armored riders kick out death-defying stunts over massive waterfalls, outrun cops, and boost at breakneck speeds across surging waves. With a deep career mode and both split screen and online multiplayer, Riptide GP: Renegade is the first game in the popular racing series designed especially for modern consoles.

Game Features

Next Gen Water Racing
Vector Unit’s first game since Hydro Thunder Hurricane to be designed from the ground up for modern consoles, RGP:R sets the bar for dynamic water racing, with breathtaking dynamic water physics, splash-tastic spray effects, and more!

Thrill-Ride Environments
Evade police boats and drones while you blast through vast interactive race environments packed with interactive elements, secret shortcuts, and animated obstacles.

Deep Career Mode
Battle your way through a variety of race types and boss fights to reach the top of the underground hydro jet racing circuit. Earn XP and cash to upgrade and customize your hydro jet, unlock new stunts, and increase your rider's performance.

Online and Split Screen Multiplayer
Compete online against the best players around the world – or against your pals in split screen local multiplayer matches (with a mix of human and AI racers).

Futuristic Customizable Vehicles
Collect and upgrade a garage full of blistering fast hydro jets that transform while you ride them. Win money to upgrade and customize the stats, colors, decals and numbers.

1080p / 60fps
Silky smooth, blisteringly fast racing action – even in split screen!

Source: The Publisher Website.

183458.description:
The Special Dagger deck is a mini-expansion for Swords and Bagpipes board game.

It is an alternative Dagger deck for experienced players. Now the Dagger cards that you get for betrayal have additional features!
183458.name: Swords and Bagpipes: Special Dagger deck

183459.description:
Halfling Feast is a non-collectible card game for 2-6 players. Each player represents a halfling champion eater and must consume the most dish cards during the game. The dish cards have a fullness value which must be applied to the halflings belly total. Once the halfling is full they must find creative ways to release space in their belly.

At the end of the game the player with the most dish points wins the game.

Each turn a player may eat a dish, make room in their belly, draw an action card, play an action card or use a special Halfling skill. Action cards and Halfling skills can target opponents to hinder them or on yourself to help you eat to victory.
183459.name: Halfling Feast

183460.description:
Kickstarter Promotional Bagpipe card for Swords and Bagpipes. The card's title comes from the motto of Scotland "In My Defens God Me Defend".

The card allows cancelling the special trait of the current English Arms invasion!

Two copies of the card come in the pack.
183460.name: Swords and Bagpipes: God Me Defend promo

rpgseries: Far Away Land RPG Adventure Module
183461.name: Fire Dungeon
183461.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fire. Lava. Molomoxors. Flametaurs. Fire Elemental. More lava. More fire. Journey into the Fire Dungeon as you seek a magical blade of awesome power. But beware, skin and fire do not mix and you might just find you are ash before you know it. Fire is not your friend in this Far Away Land adventure.

183462.name: Kennutcat
183462.description:
From publisher blurb:

The small island of Kennutcat, with its broad natural harbour and bountiful fishing, proved to be a great boon to early colonizers. After subjugating the native inhabitants, the colonizers quickly established a small prosperous village catering to the many merchant ships sailing the nearby trading routes. Yet, at night, a thick fog rolls in, blanketing the stone streets and wood shingled houses. Strange shapes move in the mists, while sibilant voices echo in the still air. These are Kennutcat’s dead—fathers, mothers, sons and daughters—spirits trapped and inexplicably bound to the island by an unending, unkillable nightmarish horror. For within a tangled forest, the surviving natives pray for salvation and the spirits of the island have answered in the form of Lobata—a formless creature of darkness that lurks in the surrounding waters. Those who answer Lobata’s siren call surrender to a nameless compulsion to hunt the strange beast, but find nothing more than their own watery graves amid the storm-tossed waves.

rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
183463.name: The Black Dwarf
183463.description:
From publisher blurb:

MURDER, MYSTERY, AND HIGH TENSION!

After almost losing his fortune to griters and gangsters, retired professional football player "Shorty" Wilson teamed up with four ex-criminals to bring criminals to justice who were evading the law. As the Black Dwarf, he now wages a tireless battle against all manner of crooks.

The Black Dwarf presents six hard-hitting tales of the tough-talking, streetwise Black Dwarf and his gangbusting gang. Co-written and drawn by one of the most unique artists from the Golden Age of Comics, Paul Gattuso, these tales are among those that upset Frederick Wertham and his fellow crusaders for comic book righteousness and eventually led to the creation of the Comics Code Authority.

In addition to the classic comics, The Black Dwarf features an all-new ROLF! battle scenario that pits the Dwarf against his fellow ultra-violent crimefighter Veiled Avenger. It features game statisitcs for both heroes, new and modified traits and combat maneuvers--and some fun optional combat rules by game designer Rob Garrita.

NOTE: VERSIONS A and B OF THIS TITLE HAVE THE SAME CONTENT,
EXCEPT FOR DIFFERENT COVERS AND PIN-UP PAGES.

183464.name: A Knight's Rest
183464.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a free encounter scenario for the Eldritch Role Playing Game, set in the world of Ainerêve. A disgraced Psarmorum knight, Sir Goodwin, swore an oath to protect his beloved Lady Teague’s tomb from all who would despoil it. The PCs' encounter takes place near this modest holy shrine to the many gods of the Celts. There they must convince a jealous Sir Goodwin to allow them to lay to rest the ashes of Lady Teague's first love.

183465.name: Clan of the Ox
183465.description:
From publisher blurb:

Play a minotaur.

Animal Races: Clan of the Ox introduces a new, playable race of minotaurs. Customize your minotaur with racial traits inspired by a wide range of bovines, from bison and buffalos to oxen and yaks. Grow large and stout as you gain in power. Get drunk on aurochs beer. Fight for glory in the bullring.

From sacred cows to raging bulls, this PDF has all you need to play a new breed of minotaur.

183466.name: The Secret of Mystery Hill
183466.description:
From publisher blurb:

You travel through space and time to a dense, hilly forest where you find yourself face to face with a huge, green man who orders you to cut off his head! You're sure this is some kind of test, but what is the right answer? What happens next is up to you.

183467.name: The Name of God
183467.description:
From the publisher website:

The Name of God is a little cynical trip into a bizarre hole, filled with homeless people, weird omens, dangerous situations, and ritual chanting. No, seriously, you will have to intone the words, or you will never find your true self again!

The Name of God is a nanogame. As such, it fits in less than half page and can be cut to appear as a tiny deck of business cards. Kicked into existence thanks to the lure of the GameChef2013, it has been inspired by the great ideas of Epidiah Ravachol, but then took a bizarre twist of its own.

The Name of God is freely inspired to such works as Neil Gaiman's Neverwhere, American Gods and Anansi Boys. And The Prodigy's song Narayan which more or less means "The Name of God". And also to my undying love for Unknown Armies.

Designed for 3-4 participants.
Zero Prep.
GM-less.
Lasts about 3 hours.
Surrounding people will direct worried glances in your direction.

183468.name: King of the City
183468.description:
From the publisher website:

You are the grey eminence spreading rumors.
You are the spider pulling the strings.
You are the monarch ordering and governing.
The hero swooning public opinion.
The criminal marking territory.
The police patrolling the streets.

You are a very influential person, a power player, and your target is the final control over the only kingdom that actually matters... the City.

But you are not the only one.

This GM-Less game uses real chess boards and pieces to help you and your friends recreate the kind of story told in works such as Game of Thrones, Dune or Romanzo Criminale where influential individuals clash against each other to shape the destiny of a kingdom, a planet or ... the City.

Whose King will emerge victorious?
How many lives will be lost or ruined for the King's ambition?

Designed for 2-4 participants.
Zero Prep.
GM-less.
Meant for short/medium play (2-5 sessions)

183469.name: Tactical Ops
183469.description:
From the publisher website:

Tactical Ops offers high octane action adventures in any setting you desire. Players will form a cohesive team of skilled individuals facing challenging missions. From mysterious investigations to heated shoot-outs, from dangerous deceptions to hectic chases, this game focuses on the "tactical" use of fiction, description and ideas rather than number crunching and rules min-maxing. Then again, you also get to roll a bucket load of dice!

This is a GM-Less game unlike any other. Most games of this kind work by turning all Players in part-time GMs. Instead Tactical Ops uses every trick at its disposal to emulate the sensation of "just being a Player": you never act as director of a story, you never know what lays behind the next corner, you never have all the answers. You play your character as you would normally do, while the structure of the game and its rules take care of everything else with the contribution of all Players involved.

This allows you to explore rich and detailed game settings that no one had to prepare or study, and live engaging stories that no one has decided beforehand but feel like someone had tailored them just for you. The aim is to make you feel like an invisible GM is at the table, maneuvering the opposition and plotting the events.

Designed for 2-5 participants.
Zero Prep (after character generation)
GM-less.
One Shot friendly, geared towards medium/long play (5-15 sessions)

183470.name: FateLess
183470.description:
from the UnPlayableGames.tk website

This GM-Less game focuses on the adventurous stories of individual characters, their personal goals and their development as human beings.

Players might be allies or enemies, lovers or strangers, but somehow their destinies will end up twining and influencing each other.

All of this on the backdrop of a rich and detailed game settings that no one needs to know ahead, as the game will make it grow through active play, adapting it to the Player's tastes and needs. This is true exploration of a world that no one knows until it gets revealed by the actions of the Characters.

FateLess is not a random name. This game leverages the main dice engine and point economy from Fate Accelerated; but without a GM, without a higher power waving the destiny (the Fate) of the Characters it is ... well ... FateLess. The other big source of inspiration is Tactical Ops, a GM-Less game focused on "tactical" groups tackling challenging missions.

The resulting mix is a GM-Less game that (like TOps) uses every trick at its disposal to emulate the classic rpg sensation of "just being a Player" while focusing (like FAE) on strong individual Characters facing personal struggle, drama and adventure.

Designed for 2-5 participants.
Zero Prep (after character generation)
GM-Less.
Meant for medium/long play (5-15 sessions)

183471.name: Terrain: Taxes
183471.description:
With the Terrain: Taxes expansion, players can now place villages on the map, and these villages accrue wealth as more tiles are added to the map.

Additionally, each player has a tax collector who may be sent to a village to tax the coins on it, with each coin being worth 1 victory point at game's end.

183472.description:
Across Africa is a cooperative game for the young players that are just starting their adventure with board games. The game is designed for two to four players of age 6 and up.

During their African expedition the young players will discover new routes through the wilderness and take photos of the animals they encounter on the way. If they are lucky enough, they will meet one of the legendary diamond seekers and perhaps collect some precious jewels themselves.

The game consists of players turns, during which each of them rolls the dice and moves his pawn by the shown number of spaces on the board. The pawn may stop on one of the eight kinds of spaces. The player fulfills the action assigned to the type of the space. This may be for example making a photo of animals, moving backwards in the next turn, drawing an adventure card, collecting the diamond, meeting the snake and many more.

In order to win the game children have to fill up the whole crocodile shaped photo album with photos they took during their adventure and reach the last space on the board.

Across Africa offers also the alternate mode of playing. This time the players will not cooperate but race to the finish line, trying at the same time to collect as much diamonds and valuable photos as possible.
183472.name: Across Africa

183473.name: Game Mastering Secrets
183473.description:
This book will give you the help you need to run an exciting, interesting and thoroughly entertaining game.

Whether you're a seasoned Game Mastering veteran or a brand new GM, you're probably searching for the secrets to running a fantastic game. You've looked in your game's Game Master's guide but it's just filled with the game's rules. Game Mastering Secrets puts in print what previous Game Masters had to learn on the streets.

(From the back of the book)

183474.description: Tressette or Tresette is one of Italy's major national trick-taking card games, together with Scopa and Briscola. It is recorded only from the early 18th century, though greater antiquity is suggested by its trumplessness. The name of the game, literally "three Seven" may refer to seven sets of three or four point possibilities when a minimum of three each (three, two, ace or all of those together in a matching suit are dealt), or to the fact that it is played up to twenty-one. There are many variants depending on the region of Italy the game is played in.
183474.name: Tressette

183478.description:
In Ciao! you want to say goodbye to the cards in your hand as quickly as possible.

Each player starts with a hand of seven cards; cards show either rock, paper or scissors, and they are colored either green, yellow or red. Some cards have special icons on them, such as play again or draw three cards. Cards are ranked in typical RPS order, but red beats yellow, which beats green.

On a turn, you play a card to the discard pile that beats the card showing on top, whether by playing paper on rock or by playing a higher ranked paper than what's already there. If you can't play, you draw one card, then play that card if possible.

The first player to empty their hand wins!
183478.name: Ciao!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 55 - Interview with Stonemaier Games Jamey Stegmaier

183479.description:
Are you ready to have a Happy Party? I hope so, but you'll need to blow out the right candles in order to be happiest in the end.

Each player starts with four face-down tokens in front of them, and they need to fill the four spaces on their personal gift board in order to win.

On a turn, a player rolls the two dice, then tries to blow down candles on the cake that match what's shown on the dice. If they don't, whether by not blowing down enough candles or by blowing down the wrong ones, their turn ends. If they blow down the right candles, they can reveal tokens in front of themselves or other players, and if those tokens match the images on their gift board, they claim that gift.

The first player to fill their gift board wins!
183479.name: Happy Party

183480.name: Magination
183480.description:
Magination is a game where you are in charge.

You can think of Magination as a deck of cards, where you can play a variety of different games. But unlike a deck of cards it’s much easier to be creative with the way you play. By experimenting with the pieces you will easily find fun and creative ways to enhance your gameplay. You can play games like magnetic golf, curling, air hockey or find new games never seen before. You can also use the magnets to build magtastic structures, either to use in games or to build new creations.

Magination will have an online community where the game can evolve. You will be able to find games, rate them and upload your own, and never run out of awesome ways to play. We know you guys will find more creative ways to use Magination than we ever could, which is why we’re handing the control to you. You vote on the best design for new pieces, making Magination completely user-driven. To make sure it grows into something personal for you, it will be possible to mix and match the pieces and colors of your choice, and easily expand the set you already own.

183481.description:
The party game Rackare consists of two decks of cards: White and Black. Each round, the Rackarkung or dealer player draws a random white card from the deck, then the other players each secretly choose the black card in hand that makes for the funniest combination. The Rackarkung then chooses the combination they like best and the winner keeps the white card which is worth one point.

The title of Rackarkung alternates and the winner is the player to first reach 10 points.

This is a Swedish adaptation (cultural references as well as language) of Cards Against Humanity, with additional optional rules concerning the white cards. Some of them are marked with one of three smiley-like symbols. One gives double points to the winner, one allows all players to discard one black card of their choice and draw a new black card, one means that the winner of this round gets the punishment that all players agreed to before the game started.
183481.name: Rackare

boardgameintegration: DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League
Marvel Dice Masters: Age of Ultron
Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men
DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League
Marvel Dice Masters: Age of Ultron
Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men
183482.description:
Card Text:

While active, Minsc and Boo get an experience token (+1A and +1D) at the end of your turn. If Minsc and Boo go to the used pile, remove all of their experience tokens. Once per turn, you may remove a token from Minsc and Boo to force an opposing character to block.

Flavor Text:

"Go for the eyes, Boo!
183482.name: Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Battle for Faerûn Minsc and Boo Promo Card

183483.name: The Reality Machine
183483.description:
From publisher blurb:

You're a whiz at playing the new Virtual Reality machine that's been installed in the local video arcade. That's why a man named Dr. Telos has offered you a fabulous summer job testing the Virtual Reality games being developed by his company. On your first day on the job Dr. Telos tells you about two exciting games, "Super Time" and "Super Space." Then he asks which one you'd like to try first. Will it be "Super Time" or "Super Space" ?

183485.name: Comet Crash
183485.description:
From publisher blurb:

During your summer internship at the Kimball Science Observatory, you discover a comet headed straight for where your family lives. It's possible the comet will just graze the Earth's atmosphere. But you know there's a good chance the comet will either strike the city of Los Angeles or crash into the Pacific Ocean, causing an enormous tidal wave to sweep throughout the country. The President orders NASA to fire a missile to change the comet's collision course. People are fleeing from the area. Your parents can't decide what to do and turn to you for advice. What do you suggest?

183486.name: Everest Adventure
183486.description:
From publisher blurb:

Will A Terrorist Plot Keep You From Reaching The Highest Place On Earth?

Although you're an experienced climber, you never thought you'd be chosen to attempt Mount Everest, the world's highest peak. But someone is trying to stop your expedition. During a stopover in Beijing, you're exploring the crowded city when you are suddenly grabbed from behind! The cold steel of a knife presses against your throat. "Stay still and you will not be hurt," a voice hisses in your ear. Should you try to get away? With all these people around, he wouldn't dare use the knife, right? On the other hand, it may not be wise to test him.

183490.name: Soccer Star
183490.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a new player for one of the top soccer schools in the country. The decisions you make, both on and off the field, will determine whether or not you score big as a soccer superstar.

183491.name: The Antimatter Universe
183491.description:
From publisher blurb:

While testing Dr. Eisenbaum's universal transmuter, a portal that bridges our universe with the antimatter universe, something goes awry, and the reader is faced with a series of choices that mean the difference between returning and remaining trapped.

183492.name: Master of Judo
183492.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a black belt in judo and have been offered the summer job of a lifetime teaching this martial art to the steppson of a billionaire. Better still, you'll do your teaching on a yacht headed for exotic ports in the Caribbean Sea. But when your student is mysteriously kidnapped during one of your island visits, it's up to you to find him. Do you dare trust your suspicious shipmates to assist you? Or should you rely on your judo mastery and the local police to help you with the hunt?

183493.name: Search the Amazon!
183493.description:
From publisher blurb:

You and your grandfather are in the Amazon region investigating the disappearance of the rare pink dolphin. Then your grandfather disappears! Do you go to the police or investigate yourself? You decide.

183494.name: Quibble
183494.description:
Quibble is a quiz game, where you have to name differnt numbers of items in a specific category. You get different point for different difficulty levels and also the time is different in these levels.

Each difficulty level is represented by a pile of card, worth 2, 4, 6, 8 or 10 points and on these cards is written how many items need to be named to win the points (e.g. you have to name 8 movies that won an Oscar).

The player can offer points to other players to get help and moves foward the won points on the scoreboard, when the needed number of items was named. First player to 42 points win the game.

183495.name: Broken Symmetry - Playtest Draft
183495.description:
Science Fiction Roleplaying

User summary:
Core rulebook contains everything necessary to create characters and campaigns, including space maps establishing system setting.

Contents:
- A Broken Galaxy
- Systems Online
- Shipyards
- Recruitment
- Planetologist
- Envoy
- Shadowmaster
- The Sheol Prerogative
- No Assembly Required

183496.name: MethyrFall Ambientazione
183496.description:
From the back of the book:
Questo libro - totalmente illustrato con mappe a colori - descrive il glorioso e tormentato mondo di Cyphelas.

English translation:
This book - fully illustrated with color maps - describes the glorious and tormented world of Cyphelas.

183498.name: MethyrFall Artefici delle Maree
183498.description:
From the back of the book:
Salpate dai porti più favoleggiati di Cyphelas! Le città che si affacciano sull'Oceano Vetàlquad sono da sempre sinonimo di avventura, immense fortune e segreti perduti nelle profondità degli abissi.

English translation:
Sail from the most fabled ports of Cyphelas! The cities overlooking Vetàlquad Ocean have always been synonymous of adventure, huge fortunes and lost secrets in the depths of the abyss.

183499.description:
Cacao: Volcanoes contains three volcano tiles that replace the three gold mines. Each volcano tile has two edges that give a player 2 gold per attached worker and two edges that make a player pay 1 gold per attached worker. Thus, the placement of these volcanoes should be chosen carefully...

Additionally, the punchboard works as an inlay for the box to keep all components in place even when storing the box upright or transporting it.
183499.name: Cacao: Volcanoes

183500.name: D12 RPG Equipment Guide
183500.description:
From the rulebook:

This book provides a large number of items for the Game Master to use in the game. They could be bestowed upon the adventurers after a long and arduous quest from the king, they could be quested for as a goal in and of themselves, or they can be used against the adventurers and given as a reward for defeating the item’s previous wielder.
